loans.name: Marìa Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es una mujer que con ayuda de su padre y esposo aprendió a cuidar adecuadamente novillos para engorde, y desde niña ha vivido rodeada de animales para engorde debido a que es una de las únicas opciones de generar ingresos al hogar. Pertenecía a uno de los grupos de Fundación Mujer, anteriormente solicitó un crédito individual por un monto de 600 000 colones; los cuales cancelado puntualmente, aunque el monto que solicito anteriormente no era tan alto como el que va a solicitar actualmente; ya que  requiere esta cantidad para volver a invertir en la compra de novillos para tenerlos en el galerón que construyeron hace dos meses. Tiene 6 años de contar con esta actividad en conjunto con su compañero sentimental. En los últimos años y con la experiencia adquirida han logrado mantenerse  con novillos de diferente peso, al año pueden vender entre 8 y 12 novillos a la Subasta de la zona.
 Doña Isabel compra los novillos con un peso de 350 a 400 kilos para poder venderlos con un peso de 700 a 750 kg a la Subasta de Coto Brus que se realiza todos los jueves. Ella cuenta con 9 hectáreas para que estos animales se alimenten. 
Eligió Fundación Mujer por la buena atención y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a woman who, with the help of her father and husband, learned to properly care for and fatten bulls.  Ever since she was a child, she has lived surrounded by animals for fattening, because this was one of the only options to generate income for her household.  Maria Isabel is a member of one of the communal banks working with Fundacion Mujer.  Previously, she requested an individual loan for 600,000 Costa Rican colones, which she paid off on time, although the amount she requested previously was not as large as sum as she is currently requesting.  She needs this larger sum to invest again in her business, buying bulls to keep in the corral that she built 2 months ago.  She and her partner have 6 years of experience in this line of work.  In recent years, with the experience she has acquired keeping bulls of varying weights, she's been able to sell between 8 and 12 bulls a year in the auction in her area.

Isabel will buy bulls between 350 and 400 kilos in weight, so that she can later sell them at a weight between 700-750 kilos in the Coto Brus cattle auction that takes place every Thursday.  She has 9 hectares of land where the cattle can feed.  She chose Fundacion Mujer because of the good service and low interest rates that they provide.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат является добросовестная и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Фарогат очень заботливая мать. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Фарогат занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Она продает на местном рынке курагу, орех, миндаль и т.п. Фарогат покупает оптом товар и реализует в розницу. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром. Она работает 6 день в неделю уже более 15 лет. С полученного дохода она дала обучение своим детям. Ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Фарогат запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farogat is a kindhearted and cheerful woman. She is married and has three children and is a very caring mother. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, and Farogat works buying and selling dried fruit. She sells dried apricots, walnuts, almonds and other items, which she buys wholesale and sells at the local market for a profit. Her work day starts early in the morning and she has been working six days a week for more than 15 years. She has been able to pay for her children's education with the money she's earned, and they help her with the business. Farogat is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy dried fruit to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to increase her working capital

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика разведенная женщина, одна воспитывающая четверых детей. У нее трое дочерей и один сын. Малика женщина с высшим образованием, ей 45 лет. В течение 15 лет она работает учительницей в местной школе своего района Хамадони. Одновременно Малика у себя дома берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Она вкалывает на двух работах, чтобы прокормить семью. Ей конечно трудно без мужской опоры, но она справляется. Дочери унаследовали от матери ее талант шитья и помогают ей усердно в ее швейном деле. Малика берет кредит для купли еще одной швейной машинки, чтобы расширить деятельность. И этот кредит ей действительно важен.
texts.en:
Malika is a divorced woman raising four children on her own. She has three daughters and one son. She is 45 and has a higher education. For more than 15 years she has been working as a teacher in the local school in the Hamadoni region. At the same time, she works from home sewing women's dresses in the national style to order. She works two jobs in order to feed her family. It's always difficult without her husband's support but she manages. 

Malika's daughters have inherited her talent for sewing and help her wholeheartedly with the sewing business. She wants a loan to buy another sewing machine in order to expand the business. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine to expand her business

loans.name: Guadalupe Chico Group

texts.es:
“Guadalupe Chico” está integrado por siete personas, todas nuevas dentro de VisionFund México, comentan que un vecino les recomendó solicitar su préstamo porque sus intereses son muy bajos y decidieron acercarse a la institución. Explican que desde un inicio, todo el personal de VFM les dio mucha confianza y eso los motivó aun más a iniciar su negocio
El lugar donde viven los integrantes es una comunidad muy tranquila donde se puede cultivar maíz, haba, frijol, calabaza etc. La fiesta más grande es el día 2 de noviembre, de hecho se trata de una gran tradición mexicana en la cual se celebra a todos los difuntos. 
Carmen es la representante del grupo, tiene 29 años de edad y vive en unión libre desde hace siete años con el señor Erick quien trabaja en el campo. Ellos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales van a la escuela. Mientras el esposo de Carmen trabaja como jornalero en el campo, ella se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos; recientemente vendió todos sus animalitos, pero el préstamo le permitirá volver a comprar algunos. Una parte del dinero también la quiere destinar a la compra de pastura y material para construir un corral. Desde que inició la crianza de borregos, Carmen ha tenido éxito, nunca se le han enfermado ni ha perdido ninguno.  “En realidad, lo mío son los borreguitos aunque me encantaría tener otros animales como gallinas y vacas ”. 
Todos los integrantes se muestran muy contentos y agradecidos por su préstamo, pero también comprometidos para hacer sus pagos muy en tiempo y no defraudar la confianza depositada en ellos. Juan, Rosa, Laura y Félix invertirán en sus borreguitos; Maribel, en su molino de  nixtamal y Concepción, en pavos.
texts.en:
"Guadalupe Chico" is made up of seven members, all new to VisionFund Mexico. They say that a neighbor recommended they ask for their loan because their interest rates are very low, and they decided to approach the institution. They explain that from the start, all the employees of VFM gave them a lot of confidence, and that motivated them even more to start their business.

The place where the members live is a very quiet community where corn, broad beans and other beans, squash, etc., can be grown. The biggest festival is November 2; in fact, it is a great Mexican tradition in which all the dead are celebrated.

Carmen is the group's representative. She is 29 years old and has been in a common-law marriage for 7 years with Erick, who works the land. They have formed a family with three children, who go to school. While Carmen's husband works as a day laborer on the land, she raises and fattens lambs. Recently, she sold all her animals, but the loan will allow her to buy some more again. She also wants to use one part of the money to buy feed and material to build a pen. Since she started raising lambs, Carmen has been successful. They have never gotten sick and she has not lost even one of them. "In reality, the lambs are my thing, but I would love to have other animals like chickens and cows."

All the members are very happy and thankful for the loan, but they also promise to make their payments on time and not to disappoint the confidence placed in them. Juan, Rosa, Laura, and Félix will invest in their lambs; Maribel in her boiled corn mill, and Concepción in turkeys.

loans.use: to buy lambs and feed

location.town: Guadalupe Chico, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Francisco tiene 38 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos por quienes esta decidido a realizar una lucha para trabajar todos los días, sus dos hijos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
La actividad que el realiza con tanto empeño es la compra y venta de abarrotaría dicha actividad lo realiza en la comunidad donde el vive, el lo aprendió de su hermano desde hace 20 años y deja buena ganancia y un ingreso económico para el beneficio de el y la de su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para tener su tienda surtido de mercadería para que pueda servir a la clientela con los productos que el pone a la disposición.
Uno de sus sueños es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse profesionales en los diferentes campos de la vida y por medio de las ganancias que le genere su negocio el quiere comprar terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en: Life gave him the opportunity to work as a food store employee.  It’s what he was waiting for; not only an open door, but also what was behind the door.  What he found was what defined what he wanted to become.  Francisco is 38 years old and has two children for whom he works every day.  His children are excellent students in their community school.  He works with great dedication, buying and selling groceries in his community.  He learned this from his brother 20 years ago and it provides him with a good income so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.  He will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for his store so that it will be well stocked and so he can serve his customers with the products he has.  One of his dreams is to watch his children grow up and become professionals in different fields.  He wants to use his earnings to buy land for his children.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Mohizifnun

texts.ru:
Мохизифнун молодая замужняя женщина, занимающаяся бизнесом. Она в возрасте 22 лет начала свой бизнес и уже 5 лет как успешно продвигает его. 
Сейчас Мохизифнун исполнилось 27 лет, она воспитывает двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках вдали от семьи. 
Мохизифнун занимается продажей детской одежды. Ее торговая точка расположена прямо на рынке. Она ценит свой бизнес и своих клиентов, так как она ежедневно получает доход. Чтобы увеличить объем продаж ей необходимо привезти побольше ассортимента сезонной детской одежды. Для этой цели она берет кредит.
texts.en: Mohizifnun is a young married woman who has her own business, which she started when she was 22 and has been running successfully for five years. She is now 27 and raising two children. Her husband works abroad, far from the family. Mohizifnun earns a living selling children's clothing from a stall at the market. She values her business and her clients since she receives income every day. In order to increase her sales she needs to bring in a bigger assortment of seasonal children's clothing. For this reason she is looking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothing for her shop

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKORO sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz,  l’arachide et le mais avec CHATA A 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKORO are married women, who average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in KOUEN, in Commune de KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice, peanuts, and corn, as is the case with CHATA A (the first person standing at the right in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of:  2 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in KOLONDIEBA. She envisions making a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per enabling her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for the planting season

loans.name: Leudith Esther

texts.es:
Leudith es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 34 años de edad, muy emprendedora y dedicada; ya que desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender mercancía como electrodomésticos en el municipio de Montería con el afán de progresar y cumplir su sueño de ser independiente.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea compra surtido de mercancía, más precisamente electrodomésticos para así fortalecer su inventario y poder vender una mayor cantidad de mercancías.

De este negocio depende el progreso y educación de sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que son el motor de su vida y la principal motivación que tiene para esforzarse todos los días para ser mejor.

Leudith tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Leudith, 34, is a very enterprising, dynamic, and dedicated woman.  Three years ago, she began to sell merchandise such as electrical household appliances in the town of Montería.  Her goal is to make progress and fulfill her dream of being independent. The loan she is requesting is the backing to strengthen her business, so she wishes to purchase a variety of merchandise, specifically household appliances, to strengthen her inventory and be able to sell more merchandise.  The progress and education of her two children, ages 11 and 8, depends on this business.  They are her reason for living and main motivation for striving every day to be better. Leudith has the firm intention of taking her productive plan ahead, and wants to become a successful business woman and ensure a better quality of life and well-being for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise to strengthen her inventory and have good sales, which will allow her to pay for the education of her two young children.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa vive en casa propia de material rustico, ella vive sola, es separada de su conyuge, no cuenta con ningun hijo a su cargos, Rosa tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que Rosa se dedica es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, ella cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 2 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera todo esto ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción con una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto a buen precio, lo que aumentará sus ingresos, mejorará sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in her own house made of rustic materials. She lives alone, is separated from her spouse and does not have any children under her care. Rosa has very good personal and work references in her community, which is located in the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in Peru's northern mountains.

Her occupation is agriculture, specifically rice harvesting. She has two years of experience in this area. She will use the loan for agricultural work, applications related to phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for her harvest. All of this will help improve her crops' productivity, physiology and morphology, and will help having a timely harvest and hence a larger, higher quality production. This way, she won't have any problems selling her products at a good price, which will increase her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural work, applications related to phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for her harvest.

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркул, 49 лет, замужем, мать 5 дочек и 3 сыновей. Чынаркул работает в санатории, также дополнительно занимается животноводством, начав с суммы  8,000 сом (KGS)в 2004 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Чынаркул на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 2 бычка, 15 коз, 1 осел. Также у Чынаркул есть собственный магазин. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка скота и сена. Чынаркул уже начала заготавливать корм для скота на зимний период, так как зимой она содержит его дома. Доходы от кредита Чынаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 49 and married with five daughters and three sons. She works in a hospital and also has an animal husbandry business, which she started in 2004 with 8,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one cow, two steers, 15 goats and one donkey, as well as her own shop.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynarkul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS in order to buy livestock and hay. She has already started to put aside feed for the winter since she keeps her cattle near her home at that time. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further developing her business and increasing her head count of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and hay in order to invest in further growth of her business

loans.name: Liseth Yasmin

texts.es:
Liseth de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación, es madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales viven con ella y uno de ellos estudia educación básica. Ella vive junto  a sus padres quienes son agricultores y sus hijos.

Liseth se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda desde hace 2 años. Es una persona emprendedora que decide dedicarse a esta actividad ya que no curso mucho los estudios y no le ha permitido encontrar otro trabajo que le ayude a sacar a su familia adelante y es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.  

En el negocio se involucra un tía de la cliente, quien le colabora en la venta cuando ella no está en casa o tiene que ir a comprar la mercadería ya que viaja en bus aproximadamente 66 kilómetros al lugar donde va a comprar.   


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar jabón, azúcar, café, gaseosa, etc. Lo que le permitirá mejorar las ventas, ya que la tienda está en la parte céntrica del cantón  y su tienda es muy visitada.

Esto vendrá a mejorar los ingresos a cubrir necesidades puntuales de sus hijos. Los sueños de Liseth  para su negocio son tener un puesto de venta bien surtido donde la gente busque lo que necesite, para su familia desea que sus hijos estudien y un día puedan sacar una cerrera universitaria.

Las ganancias del negocio desea seguir surtiendo su tienda,  para que este sea un puente para salir adelante  y atreves del préstamo lo lograra.
texts.en:
Liseth is 25 years old. She went to school through the ninth grade. Liseth is a single mother and has two children who live with her, one of whom is attending primary school. Liseth and her children live with her parents, who are farmers.

She is a saleswoman and has had her own shop for the past two years. She is an entrepreneurial person who decided to go into sales because she did not complete her studies and she has not been able to find another job that helps her get her family ahead. For these reasons she decided to set up a shop selling basic household products.

Liseth's aunt helps with the store, looking after the sales when Liseth cannot be there or has to go purchase merchandise, which requires a bus trip of approximately 66 km to the place where she makes her purchases.

The loan she has requested from CREDICAMPO is to purchase soap, sugar, coffee, sodas and other products. This will permit her to improve her sales, since her store is in the central part of their town and gets many visitors. The revenue from the business will keep it stocked, and higher sales will improve Liseth's income and ability to meet the needs of her children. 

Her dreams for her business are to have a well-stocked location where people are able to find what they need. Her dreams for her family are for her children to go to school and to eventually get university degrees.

Liseth believes that her business is a bridge to a better future. Through this loan she will achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase products such as soap, sugar, coffee and sodas for her store.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 45 años de edad, ews soltero y muy conocido en el medio, por su labor de criar y vender animales menores desde hace 15 años. Vive en casa de material rústico y presenta buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos, su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

David se dedica a criar y vender animales menores en la ciudad de Cayaltí; también es peón agrícola. El crédito será destinado para compra de animales menores, ya que desea comprar una cantidad mayor de animales y asi poder diversificar su stock para poder ofrecer mayores opciones a su público consumidor, pues esta inversión le permitirá a David generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende su calidad de vida mejorará.
texts.en:
David is 45 years old. He is single and is very well-known in the media for his work raising and selling small animals. He has been in this business for 15 years. He lives in a home built of rustic materials and is well liked by his neighbors. His community is located in the district of Cayaltí in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

David raises and sells small animals from the city of Cayaltí. He is also a farmworker. The loan will be used to purchase small animals, since David wishes to purchase animals on wholesale and diversify his stock in order to offer more options to his customers. This investment will enable the business to earn more and increase David's take-home pay, which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Diantoyerela  1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA  1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide avec AWA 2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group “DIANTOYERELA 1” are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in KOUEN, in Commune de KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are rice, peanuts, and corn, as is the case with AWA (the second person sitting from the right in the photo). With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of:  2 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in KOLONDIEBA. She envisions making a profit of 200,000 francs CFA per enabling her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for the planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, irrigation and other items for the betterment of his crops and his family

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Omar es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con obligaciones laborales de jornalero. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas y adicional a esto tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano que también vende en la plaza de mercado.

Su principal dificultad es el alto costo de los insumos agropecuarios.

El desea mejorar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le dé la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Apoya la actividad de un campesino humilde y trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Agricultural work is one the most difficult jobs in this day and age due to the great effort that is required to prosper. Omar is a man who has never given up in spite of the weather or any other challenging circumstances that can occur. He is always prepared to obtain the resources needed to support his family. 

He wakes up very early to go to different farms to work as a day laborer.

He alternates this job with the sale of milk that he obtains from his own cows. In addition, he has small plantain crops and sells the plantains in the market.

His main challenge is the high cost of agricultural supplies. 

He wishes to improve his working capital to guarantee the maintenance of his businesses. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a milk cow that will allow him to increase his earnings and improve the quality of life of his family. 

Support the work of a hardworking and humble peasant with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to improve his work and support his family.

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un lugar muy comercial y productivo vive Carmen, una señora de 28 años. Es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos están estudiando en una escuelita cerca de casa. 
Carmen ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia ya que de ella dependen sus hijos, se ha esforzado en darles educación y alimentación para sus pequeños. Por ello todos los días se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en un coche que tiene, donde ella acuden varios clientes. Ahora necesita incrementar su negocio, por eso acudió a Fundación Alternativa ya que anteriormente trabajó con la institución, con este crédito podrá comprar una carpa y mesas para su negocio ya que  también va a vender comida porque tiene una buena sazón y mucha clientela, está segura que le va a ir muy bien con este nuevo negocio ya que donde tiene su puesto es una zona comercial.
Últimamente ha pasado por meses duros pero aquello no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante, Carmen no se queda de brazos cruzados, también vende cosméticos para ayudarse con los gastos de casa. Se siente muy agradecida porque la institución y el proyecto Kiva le ayuda a crecer poco a poco en su negocio y le ha dado el apoyo siempre, por eso es cliente fiel a la institución.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old and lives in the Santo Domingo de los Colorados District, a very commercial and productive place. She is a single mother with 4 children. Three of them are studying in a small school near their home.

Carmen has has to get her family ahead since her children depend on her. She has worked hard to give her children an education and food. This is why every day she works selling salchipapas (sausages and fries) from a stand she has, where she has various customers. Now she needs to expand her business, and this is why she turned to Fundación Alternativa, as she has worked with this institution before. With this loan she will be able to buy a canopy and tables for her business since she will also sell other food because she has a delicious seasoning and a lot of customers. She is sure that the business will do well since her stand is in a commercial area.

Recently she has been through a tough few months but this has not stopped her from moving forward. Carmen isn't one to stand about, as she also sells cosmetics to help with the household bills. She is very grateful because the institution and Kiva are helping her to grow her business little by little and have always supported her. This is why she is a loyal customer of the institution

loans.use: to buy a canopy and tables for her business.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan. She and her husband breed and raise pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

Jeneth sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes the pigs are slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 PHP in sales every month.

Jeneth requested a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional hogs and feeds. In the future, she hopes to become successful and expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional hogs

loans.name: Phinoy

texts.en:
Phinoy, pictured here, is 30 years old and single. He lives with his sister in a Phnom Penh suburb. Phinoy has full-time employment in a company and also attends video editing class when he is freed from work. 
He plans to run his own video production business when he finishes his class and has a professional skill. Now, Phinoy applied for a loan in order to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 28 years old. He is married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. His wife provides additional income for the family.

Victor sells groceries, a business he has done for the last 4 years, and he earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES. He has requested a second loan of 15,000 KHS with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase groceries to sell. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Victor will be able to take his children to a better school and also work on his dream of having a home for his family.

Victor's hopes and dreams are to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación. Está acompañado desde hace 7 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, tienen en común 2 hijos los cuales aún viven con ellos.

Elmer se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años,  aunque el trabajo del cultivo del maíz y el frijol lo aprendió desde que estaba muy pequeño,  pues su padre se lo ha enseñado, otra actividad económica que tiene el cliente es el de pescador, cuando no está trabajando en la agricultura lo hace pescando lo que le genera un ingreso adicional, el trabajo del cliente lo tiene a pocos minutos de su casa y quien se involucra en los trabajos en ocasiones es su esposa. El horario de trabajo del cliente es de 6 horas al día. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes. Entre otros productos que son de importancia para el cultivo del maíz. El préstamo le ayudara a tener los insumos para sembrar y así tener la alimentación asegurada para sus hijos.  

Los sueños de Elmer son seguir trabando en lo que le gusta y ha sido el medio del cual sigue sacando adelante a su familia y desea poner un puesto de venta de sus granos, ya que actualmente los sale a vender lo que le genera más gasto. Para sus hijos espera que ellos estudien y tengan un medio mejor para ganarse la vida.

Las ganancias de lo que le genere la actividad lo invertirá en la siembra de otros productos agrícolas, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is 25 years old, and studied in school up to 4th grade. His partner of 7 years takes care of the housework. They have two children who live with them.

Elmer has worked in agriculture for 12 years, although his father taught him how to grow corn and beans from a very young age. Elmer also works as a fisherman, when he is not working in agriculture, in order to earn an additional income. Elmer's work is just a few minutes away from his home, and his wife helps him out from time to time. His work day starts from 6 am.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy compost, seeds and fertililzers, as well as other necessary products for corn production. This loan will help him to have the supplies to sow and therefore ensure that his children have food to eat.

Elmer's dreams are to continue working doing what he likes and which has always been the way he gets his family ahead. He also wants to install a sales point for his grain, since currently he goes out to sell his produce which increases his costs. He hopes that his children study and will have a better way of earning a living.

Elmer will invest the income he generates from this work into sowing other agricultural products, in order to increase his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds and fertilizers, as well as other necessary products for corn production.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 32 years old and single. Due to lack of job opportunities, she engages in buying and reselling clothes/dry goods within the public market to generate income. She dreams to become financially stable to uplift the living status of her family. 

She aims to continue and improve her business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase more short pants, t-shirts, pants, polo shirts, long sleeved shirts, blouses, and underwear to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more short pants, t-shirts, pants, polo shirts, long sleeved shirts, blouses, and underwear to resell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 34 years old. She is married to Patrick and together they have been blessed with three children of 14, 9 and 5. Patrick provides additional income for his family.

Hadija sells retail goods of different kinds like blankets, mattresses and plastic storage tanks. Hadija has requested for her first loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya. She will use this loan to buy blankets, mattresses and plastic water storage tanks to sell. 

With the anticipated profits, Hadija will be able to expand her business even further. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to diversify her business by opening a money transfer shop and being a wholesale supplier of the products she currently sells. Hadija would also like to see her children educated for life.

loans.use: to buy blankets, mattresses and plastic water storage tanks to sell.

loans.name: Katheryne

texts.es:
Katheryne es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, debido a algunas situaciones económicas en su familia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, y para ayudar a sus padres trabaja en el área de ventas de una empresa de calzados. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora y siempre atiende con mucha amabilidad a los clientes.
Katheryne quiere comprar una cocina para su domicilio, de esta manera podrá reemplazar la cocina que tiene que ya está un poco deteriorada y peligrosa debido a las fugas de gas que podrían ocasionarse. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado comprará la cocina y así mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia y brindará mayor seguridad. De esta manera seguirá luchando y trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Katheryne is a yound entrepeneur. She is 20 years old, she is not married and lives in Ica with her family.

She is a person who very much wants to get ahead. Due to her family's economic situation she could not study for a professional career, and in order to help her parents she works in sales department for a footwear company. It suits her well because she is very responsible, hard-working and is always friendly to customers.

Katheryne wants to buy a kitchen for her home, in this way she will be able to replace the kitchen that she has, which is a little deteriorated and dangerous due to occasional gas leaks. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy the kitchen and so improve her family's quality of life and make them more secure. In this way she will continue fighting and working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 31 years old and she is happily married to Marcial, who works as an assistant assessor. God has blessed them with children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Gerly owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, or other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and  then she will sell them per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 30,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Gerly hopes to have an expansion of her business. She only dreams to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.en: A $1200 loan has been offered to Lepoldina to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, noodles, biscuits, bread, body lotion, candles, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko beer and water.  She has been involved in these business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, noodles, biscuits, bread, body lotionn, candles, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko beer and water.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 30 years old.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Donna requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Donna has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Donna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional rice barn, feeds, etc.

Lourdes has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives with her two sisters in the village Gugark of Lori region. She graduated from medical college and works as a nurse at the hospital. Her sisters also work very hard and do their best to provide better living conditions for Anna’s daughter. Despite the efforts of Anna and her sisters, Anna’s daughter has an unrealized dream of owning a computer.

Anna requested a loan, which she will use to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Alice to improve her business  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  She will buy some additional supplies such as  bread, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and body lotion.  She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Alice independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy bread, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and body lotion

loans.name: Erkamo

texts.ru:
В свои 42 года Эркамо все еще не замужем и не имеет детей. Она живет с родителями в районе Хамадони. Ее отец мастер-строитель, а мать домохозяйка. Сама Эркамо занимается выращиванием бычков. Она продолжает эту деятельность в течение 5 лет. Эркамо еще умеет шить и предоставляет свои услуги по шитью женских одеяний. Она успешно совмещает оба эти деятельности. 
Сейчас Эркамо обратилась за кредитом для своего бизнеса животноводства. Она хочет купить несколько крупнорогатых скотин и увеличить их поголовье. Кредит поможет ей увеличить доходность бизнеса.
texts.en: At her age of 42, Erkamo is still not married and has no children. She lives with her parents in the Hamadoni district. Her father is a professional construction worker, and mother is a homemaker. Erkamo is involved in raising bulls. She has been running this business for 5 years. Erkamo also knows how to sew and provides her women's clothing sewing services. She successfully combines both of these businesses. Now Erkamo is requesting a loan for her animal husbandry business. She wants to buy several cows and increase her livestock headcount. The loan will help her increase the business profitability.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years. He is married to Stacey, and together they have been blessed with two children who are four and two years old. Stacey provides just a little additional income for family.

John has a retail shop where he sells household goods and also runs a money transfer business in his retail shop. He has run these businesses for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 12,000 per month.

John has requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000. He will use the loan to boost his M-Pesa cash services by getting more float as well as cash for the clients.

John will use the anticipated profits to cater to the needs of his family and to repay his loan within the stipulated time. John's hopes and dreams are to have a successful business as well as to satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: to boost his M-Pesa cash services

loans.name: Lonisa

texts.en:
Lonisa is 40 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lonisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Lonisa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is 48 years old and has seven children.  Marlita is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marlita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and rice barns.

Marlita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Marlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and rice barns

loans.name: Muhammad Abdullah Khan

texts.en: Abdullah lives in Karachi. He is 40 years old, married, and has five children. He is a barber by profession, as seen in the picture, and has run a barber shop in his community for the past 10 years. He has a good reputation and is always trying to fulfill his family needs and wants. His customers are satisfied by his services. So he has loyal customers and he is also able to attract more. He wants to buy additional items like hair cutting equipment, different types of creams, hair dyes and face wash, etc. for his shop to provide better services to the existing customers and to attract new customers. For this purpose he has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: The loan helps this borrower buy items for his barber shop.

loans.name: Aman Ullah

texts.en:
Aman Ullah runs a hardware shop in Karachi. He is 38 years years old. His wife is a housewife and and they have three children. 

Aman Ullah has been successfully running his business for 15 years now. This business not only helped him generate income to meet his expenses, but he is also educating his children. He wants to buy more pipe nuts for his hardware shop due to its high demand. Therefore he has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner, for purchasing these items. He plans to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pipe nuts for his hardware shop

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en:
Costasie is 59 years old.  She is married and has eight children, aged between 13 and 32.  All of them go to school. She has been farming for 20 years, She will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production.  With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers of rice to increase the production

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and married.  She has five children.  With two children in school, Milagros works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

Milagros has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she cam afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, chips, etc

loans.name: Maly

texts.en:
Maly, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old and married. She is a mother of three children; one is too young for schooling and two are in school. The main sources of her income are from her cassava farming and her husband's job as a local doctor. 

This is the first loan for Maly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She decided to get an education loan in order to support her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in midwifery.  Maly hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To support her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in midwifery.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is  taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children.  

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as  body lotion, water, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, soap, shampoo, slippers, books, pencils, biscuits, and fish. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, water, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, soap, shampoo, slippers, books, pencils, biscuits, and fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married mother of four children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, rice, cooking oil, fresh beans. She generates additional income from selling green bananas. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land . She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, beans and rice

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 42, who is a lovely mother of four dependent children and one married child, lives in a small community of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last sixteen years, she has been involving in the farming business. Her husband, Len, is also a farmer but whenever he is free from farming he goes fishing in the lake near his house.

Since the earnings that her husband can get from fishing are becoming the main source of her family income, now she is requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a boat and fishing nets for her husband. With the support of this loan, she hopes the boat and the fishing nets will be the most effective fishing instruments which can provide her more and more benefit. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is 42 years old, married to Elly, and blessed with five children, aged between four and 22 years.  For 11 years, Carren has been running a retail shop where she sells a variety of shop items such as detergents, soft drinks, sugar and maize flour, etc.  She earns a monthly income of KES,40,000

She has applied for a loan of KES.75,000, which she will use to buy more stock of soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil for sale. 

Carren hopes to grow her business and in future be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 56 years old and she is happily married to Joel, who works as a barber. God has blessed them with five children. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Melba owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, or other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell them per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Melba hopes that her business will continue to flourish and desires to expand soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is a 55-year-old hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income though he is also a headmaster of a primary school where he earns an extra income. He started farming to look after his family and educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes and delayed salary payment. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer and building a permanent house. He is requesting a loan to buy materials for construction.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 33 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, noodles, egg, milk, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for three years.  In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, egg, milk, etc

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Residing in Takeo province, Sary is 63 years old, a widowed mother blessed with three children. Currently, she needs to support one remaining kid who is studying in a local university. 

She grows rice to cover the necessary expenses in her family including the tuition fee of her daughter. However, the tuition fee remains a challenge for her. Therefore, she gets an education loan to pay for school for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for school for her daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree in accounting.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Aurea to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $100.00. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like water, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, and soap.  

Aurea is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy water, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion, and soap

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 56-year-old man, a Palestinian refugee and a married father of five children, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been selling used clothes for ten years to cover the expenses and needs of his family. 

He is the sole earner of his family, and he succeeded despite the difficult living circumstances to improve his work, and benefited from Al-Majmoua loans to move his work to a better location inside the camp. 

Kamel is suffering from the limited number of customers inside the camp. Thus he is now acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise by buying the new season’s collection, especially before autumn, and to work on creating the need among his customers to acquire more of his products.

This loan will help Kamel expand his business, increase his income, and provide his beloved family with better social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise by buying the new season’s collection, especially before autumn

loans.name: Dúo Bondad Amorosa Group

texts.es:
DÚO BONDAD AMOROSA
Este dúo esta conformado por María Antonia es casada y madre de familia tiene su propio negocio, doña María se dedica a vender tortillas en un local que tiene en su propia casa, todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder empezar el día cociendo el maíz que utiliza para poder elaborar sus tortillas que las vende para el almuerzo y la cena diariamente,ella vende 150 quetzales de tortillas y gracias a DIOS su venta ha prosperado y por eso necesita un crédito para poder comprar maíz por mayor, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The Dúo Bondad Amorosa is made up, in part, by María Antonia. She's married and a mother. She has her own business. María sells tortillas in a location that she has in her own house. Every day she gets up very early to be able to start the day cooking the corn that she uses to be able to prepare the tortillas that she sells for lunch and dinner every day. She sells 150 quetzales worth of tortillas and thanks to God, her business has prospered, and for this reason she needs a loan to be able to buy corn wholesale. She hopes that you can help her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn for the preparation and sale of tortillas

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey (in the photo), age 21, is single and lives with his parents and sister in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents are scarf weavers.

Raksmey is a third year student, majoring in accounting. He plans to work in the microfinance or banking sector when he finishes his studies.

Raksmey wants to continue his studies, so he decided to apply for a loan in order to pay for his school fee.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 41 years old, is a lovely mother of four dependent children and one married child. She lives in a small community of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she is working in a private cashew factory with the wages of USD 8.00 a day.

Heang is living in an old house. Some parts of its wall are broken and need to be repaired. Because of the shortage of budget, she is now applyingfor  a Kiva loan through HKL to buy sheets of zinc to use as the wall of her house. Through this loan, she hopes that she can make her home become more comfortable for living. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc

loans.name: James Harry

texts.en:
This is James Harry, 29, a resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. He is single and already managed to support his schooling up to now through his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. He is also helping his family with their every day necessities.

James Harry operates a food house. He caters snacks and typical meriendas (light meals) like cake, pasta, noodles, fruit shakes, burgers, made-to-order lumpia (pastries) and salad and other delicacies of the like. He also cooks and sells affordable meals and viands in their community. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

James Harry dreams to have an extension of his food house business. He dreams to save enough so that he could buy his dream house and lot, and help his siblings finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 38 years old and married. With four children who are in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Salve has been in this business for four years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a widow and mother of five children. She has a grinding mill that earns her income. She wants a loan to pay school fees for her children, since her earnings do not come at the time when fees are expected to be paid.  Janet hopes to educate her children.  However, she faces a challenge of inadequate capital. Janet is a hardworking and committed woman.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dufatanye Cb Group

texts.en: Dufatanye means "let us work together" in English. It is a group led by Consolee who is 54. All the group member have different business types they run on a daily basis.Consolee sells soft drinks such as soda and locally made juice. She has spent 19 years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more soda for sale. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family..In the picture, Consolee has her hand raised up as a sign that she is the group leader.

loans.use: To buy more soda for sale.

loans.name: Roxana Raquel

texts.es:
Roxana una joven de 27 años de edad, con un estudio académico de 7º grado de educación básica. Ella es comerciante en pequeño; Se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Roxana esta acompañada y hoy en día tienen una bebe de 1 año de edad, ellos luchan día a día por ayudar a su pequeña ya que por mal formación padece una condición física. 

Roxana sabe que trabajando arduamente vera la condición de su hija mucho mejor, ella a temprana edad comenzó a conocer el negocio de la venta de ropa, su madre lo hacia. Ahora es un medio de sostenibilidad para su familia y una base en la que se apoyo para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas faldas, pantalones, short y camisetas.Ademas, Roxana con parte del efectivo comprara 100 bloques y medio quintal de hierro  para hacer arreglos en su pequeña casa.

Ella a futuro sueña con ver a su niña correr y jugar como cualquier otro niño, desea y le pide a Dios que su niña se mejore.
texts.en:
Roxana is a young woman who is 27 years of age. She completed her basic education through the seventh grade. Roxana is a small-time merchant who sells clothes. She is in a relationship and now has a baby who is a year old. She and her partner strive to help their young one, who suffers from a physical condition due to poor development.

Roxana knows that she must work hard in order to see great improvement in her daughter’s condition. At an early age, she began gaining experience in the clothing retail business that her mother managed. Now she is working in the same trade in order to sustain her family. It has also become the basis for helping her young daughter get ahead.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more skirts, trousers, shorts, and T-shirts. In addition, Roxana will use part of the loan to buy 100 blocks and half a quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) of iron in order to repair her small house.

In the future, Roxana dreams of seeing her daughter running around and playing with other children. She hopes and prays to God that her daughter will improve.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives Lahore and is a housewife. Her husband has a spare parts shop in their community. He is hard working and honest. He works day and night to make sure that their needs are met. But right now he is short of cash. Not much cash is left after paying their family expenses for them to save. Nazeeran is always supportive of her husband so she decided to request a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy spare parts to increase his sales, which will help to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts for her husband's spare parts shop

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children. One is still at school and the other one is still small. She has been selling rice, cooking oil, maize flour, backing flour, sugar, and beans for seven years now. She works from 7am to 4pm daily and is able to make a very small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaisha's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start making and selling bricks, sold sugar, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to buy a plot of land, bought a TV set and a cupboard. She will use this loan to make bricks and to buy sugar, rice and beans to resell. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her loan group "Hakika" which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to make bricks and to buy sugar, rice and beans to resell.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven emprendedora, es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo pequeño a quien ama y quien es su mayor motivo en la vida para salir adelante. Por iniciativa propia ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y se ha convertido en una próspera empresaria porque tiene muchos clientes, ofrece productos de calidad y siempre atiende con mucha amabilidad a sus compradores.
Rosario quiere comprar mercadería por temporada de invierno para surtir el negocio. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar sus productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así pueda obtener mayores ingresos. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder abrir su propio local.
texts.en:
Rosario is a enterprising young woman. She's single, is 21 years old, and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho together with her family. She's a single mother; she has one small child who she loves and who is her greatest motive in life to move forward. Through her own initiative she has started a small business selling clothes, and it has turned into a prosperous business because she has a lot of clients. She offers quality products and always attends to her customers with a lot of friendliness. 

Rosario wants to buy merchandise for the winter season to stock her business. She is very grateful for the Kiva loans because with the support that they have provided her, she will be able to buy her products to offer them to her clients and in that way she will be able to obtain greater profits. In this way she will continue making an effort to move forward to be able to open her own store location.

loans.use: to buy clothes (merchandise) for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos dependientes; vive con su familia(esposa e hijo) en el caserio Yapana, José realiza las labores de destilación de aguardiente, ya que él cuenta con extensiones de caña. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

José está dedicado a la destilación de aguardiente, hace más de 10 años, él requiere el presente crédito para realizar inversión en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de aguardiente, así como reparación de equipos de destilación lo que le asegurá un gran producción, y le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 37, is married and has 4 dependent children.  He lives with his family (wife and children) in the Yapana rural settlement.  Jose works distilling brandy; as he has land with sugar cane.  His community is located in the Callacyuc district, in the province and region of Cajamarca in the northern highlands of Peru.

Jose has been distilling brandy for more than 10 years.  He needs this loan to invest in his brandy distilling business so that he can repair some of his distilling equipment.  This will enable him to have a good production and generate more income and profits so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair some of his distillation equipment

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old. He is married to Pamela, and together they have been blessed with three children, who are eight, five, and two years old. Charles is in the transport business, using his motorcycle. He has done this business for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 2,500.

Charles has requested a loan of Kshs10,000, which he will use to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

With the anticipated profits, Charles will be able to improve his transport business. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. His hopes and dreams are to stay happy and stable together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Kabango Joint Women Organic Farmers Organisation Group

texts.en: Margret, a member of Kabango Joint Women Organic Farmers Organization Group, where each member guarantees each other, is involved in crop production and the mobile money business. She faces challenges of price fluctuation and weather changes.  However, she has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning. Margret needs a loan to buy inputs like seeds for planting ahead of the season.

loans.use: to buy inputs like seeds for planting ahead of the season.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Hello lenders! Meet Peter, who is a very hard-working, passionate and dedicated small-scale farmer. He is based in Chemoge, a remote village in Bungoma. He is happily married and together with his beautiful wife are blessed with five children. For the past six years he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary source of income has been milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. He sells milk and farm produce to his neighbors and to the local market but has been facing one big problem and that is timely delivery of the products to the market. He is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that would solve his transportation problem. Chemoge is located in a very remote area that has a poor road network and the terrain is very bad. The only mode of transport is Boda Boda (motorbike).This loan will be of great help because it will allow Peter to transport his farm products to the market and deliver them timely. Milk and vegetables are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch high prices. Through the loan, Peter will not be worried because he will always deliver the products on time and gain more profits. This motorbike will be reliable for quick transportation for both long and short distances. Through the motorbike, Peter's life is going to change and his standards of living are going to improve.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan belongs to Lahore. She is 40 years old, married, and a mother of five children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession. They make their living out of the income generated from the rickshaw. 

Her husband is a hardworking person, but due to low income they have to face problems such as difficulty in paying for some monthly expenses on time. Therefore her husband has decided to buy another rickshaw to get some additional income by renting it out. Rasoolan is therefore applying for a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in buying this new rickshaw. Their dream is to give their children a better and secure future.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is a 52-year-old woman living in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. At home, she is a lovely mother of three dependent children and two married children. To make a living, she manages and operates a rice farming business in a small farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this career for twenty five years. 

Uk wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL.  After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Virginia Feliza

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, madre de tres hijos y su negocio es el tejido de mantillas de alpaca.
Ella es una persona emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, decidida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de Batallas que se caracteriza por la escasa cobertura vegetal y también por el suelo erosionado y seco, todo estos factores generan un clima frio pero más húmedo debido a la influencia del lago Titicaca, existiendo una evaporación de sus aguas generando un clima mucho mejor que en la Zona Alta. 
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio y en la ciudad. Ella se dedica al tejido artesanal de mantas típicas hechas con lana de alpaca. La fibra de alpaca es considerada una de las fibras más lujosos y finas del mundo, no sólo por sus atributos físicos como su capacidad térmica, su suavidad y resistencia sino porque es escasa en el mercado, haciéndola más exclusiva. La recolección de la lana es de su propio ganado pero también la compra para continuar produciendo. Ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace siete años y encuentra la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida realizando la compra de una máquina de tejer y más lana de alpaca.
Es por esos motivos que Virgina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina para tejer con lana de alpaca y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 37-year-old woman. She is single and the mother of three children. Her business involves making knitted baby blankets out of alpaca wool.
