Virginia is a person who is enterprising, determined, strong, decisive, responsible, and extremely hardworking. She goes about her work in the community of Batallas, which is known for having scarce vegetation and for also being an arid land that undergoes erosion. All of these factors contribute to the cool, but humid, climate that is also influenced by Lake Titicaca. The evaporation from this body of water helps to create a more pleasant climate than that experienced in the highlands.

Virginia is tan-skinned and has long black braided hair. She wears traditional clothing and her native language is Aymara. However, she speaks Spanish for her business and when traveling to the city. Virginia makes hand-knitted traditional blankets from alpaca wool. Alpaca fibers are considered to be one of the finest and most luxurious materials in the world. This material is scarce in the market, not only for its physical qualities, but because of its capacity to keep things warm, its softness, and its resistance. Products made from this material are exclusive. Virginia collects the wool from her own animals, but she also buys wool in order to continue her production. She has been in business for seven years and needs to improve her quality of life. Therefore, she needs to buy a knitting machine and more alpaca wool.

For these reasons, Virginia is requesting a loan. The money will be used for the purchase of a knitting machine and additional alpaca wool. As a result, this will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Joani

texts.en:
Joani is 61 years old. She is married to Harun, and together they have been blessed with five children. Joani is a supplier and seller of tea leaves, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has requested her second loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy stock of tea leaves to supply to customers. With the anticipated profits, Joani will be able to expand her business by growing her stock. Joani's hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children for life.

loans.use: to buy stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Silper

texts.en:
Silper is 42 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have been blessed with five children, ages 9, 12, 13, 16, and 22.

She is in the cereals business, a business in which she has been involved for the last five years, earning her a monthly income of 30,000 KES. Silper has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, a loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to increase her stock of cereals, such as dry maize, millet, beans, etc. for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business further. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more assorted cereals for sale

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesùs María tiene 62 años de edad, vive con sus familiares, en una comunidad pequeña en el distrito de Buenos Aires, goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jesús María es a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, además del comercio de fruta de temporada como son mamey, naranja, plátano y otros. Actividad que realiza hace más de 5 años, ya que cuenta con terrenos propios instalado de fruta donde la cosecha la comercializa cada temporada. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias en la zona, es conocida y con buen historial crediticio. El Destino del crédito será para mejoras en su negocio comprando una mayor cantidad de fruta a otros productores para poder comercializarla a un mejor precio, lo que hará que sus ingresos aumenten, sus ganancias crezcan y por ende su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 62 years old. She lives with her family in a small community in the district of Buenos Aires. She enjoys good personal and working relationships on the part of her neighbors. Her town works in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It's located in the province of Morropon, department of Piura, north coast of Peru.

The work that Jesús María does is the raising and selling of poultry in addition to the sale of seasonal fruit like mamey, oranges, platanos, and others. This is work that she's carried out for more than 5 years, and now she has her own plots of fruit installed where the harvest sells it every season. She counts on very good relationships in the zone; she's known and has a good credit history. The end use of the loan will be for improvements in her business buying a larger quantity of fruit and other products to be able to sell them at a better price, which will make her profits increase, her earnings will grow, and therefore her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fruit and other products to be able to sell them at a better price

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own house rental business for four years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve her profit, Jennifer would like to apply for a new loan for the maintenance of the boarding house. An amount of PHP 20,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place so that they could attract more boarders. She will also utilize the loan to add up to the capital needed for the maintenance of her video gaming shop. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Jennifer dreams to manage her own Apartel. She also hopes to have her own family soon. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and the father of five children. He lives in Kapsowar, a remote rural town that has harsh living conditions and requires tough skin to survive. He has earned a living by farming for the last seven years and his main income sources are milk, eggs, and various crops produced on his farm. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. Dairy farming is one of the most profitable and promising businesses ventures in Kenya because returns are available to the farmer within a short period of time. That is why Juhudi Kilimo is financing small farmers with assets like this so that they can generate income and guarantee payments. Today, very few other businesses can guarantee these quick returns of cash. 

The additional income from dairy farming will be used in securing the future of his school-going children, because he believes that education is the gateway to success. Increased profits will also be used in improving his living conditions and in trying to get out of the poverty bracket.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Urumuri Acb Group

texts.en: Urumuri means " Light" in English. This group is led by Marie Chantal, aged 42. The group is composed of different members who do different business activities. They all strive to live an exemplary life for others. Marie Chantal sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 12 years. With the loan, Marie Chantal would like to buy more shirts, especially men's fashions, for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business. She plans to have a car in the future, which will help her in running the business efficiently.

loans.use: To buy more shirts for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es: Andres tiene 26 años de edad, el vive con sus padres y con sus hermanos que están estudiando Andres  se dedica desde hace 2 años a la  crianza de chanchos, también trabaja de albañil, sus padres  se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, con el dinero del crédito Andres  va a comprar chanchos para que su madre le dé  cuidando  estos animalitos, la aspiración de Andres es comprar más chanchitos para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Andres is 26 years old. He lives with his parents and with his siblings, who are in school. For 2 years, Andres has raised pigs. He also works as a construction worker. His parents are farmers and raise small animals. With the money from the loan, Andres is going to buy pigs so his mother can care for them. Andres' aspiration is to buy more pigs in order to help his parents with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is aged 25 and she is married with one child, aged one year, not yet ready to go to school. She has been selling sorghum for three years, and with the loan; she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is aged 39. He is married with four children, aged between 4 and 20. All of them go to school. He has been selling goods in a shop for 11 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cooking oil, soap, sugar and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soap, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 64 years, is a resident of Sambir, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. He owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 27 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Joseph passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 46 years old and a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and needles to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, a resident from the Banteay Meanchey province, is 32 years old and married. She is a mother of four children, three of whom still count on her as they are too young for schooling. The main sources of her income are from her occupation as a school teacher and her husband's job as a taxi driver. 

This is the first loan for Sopheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She forms a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent stall for selling grocery items. She hopes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to build a decent stall for selling grocery items

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 40-year-old married mother of eight, who has been working selling used shoes to help her husband in covering their big family's living expenses since 2000. She is a hard worker, well known in her region for the special prices she sets to sell her merchandise quickly and meet customers' needs.

Khadija's income combined with her husband's isn't enough to cover their family's needs and develop her business at the same time. For this reason, she decided that her business development will be done through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She will invest in buying big quantities of used shoes for the coming season, especially since parents are preparing their children for school needs. She will make sure that her work will keep on developing and meeting customers' expectations.

loans.use: to buy big quantities of used shoes for the coming season

loans.name: Rolando Tito

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Rolando se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, él solicita préstamo para la compra de más animalespara poder surtir su stock de animales que ya posee, ya que dicha inversión le servirá para tener una mejor y más grande variedad y productividad en animales, pues de esta forma el podrá atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, logrando de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias, y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para él y para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 52 years old. He is married, has a son, and lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area, located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Rolando raises and sells animals. He has more than 8 years of experience and his business is located in his own house. He is asking for the loan in order to buy more animals to supply the stock of animals he already has, since that investment will help him to have a better and larger variety of animals and productivity. In this way he will be able to serve the diverse tastes and needs of his customers, thus succeeding in generating more income, better profits, and therefore a better quality of life for him and his entire family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to supply the stock of animals he already has

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a steaming machine and to  buy  up to date salon equipments.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange, aged 26 years old, is married with two children aged 4 and 8. One of them goes to school. She has been selling sorghum for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve family welfare.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Koran

texts.en:
Koran, age 51, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. 

With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her second loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Nyagatare Jyambere Cb Group

texts.en: Joyeuse Is a group leader who is 34 years old.   She is married and has three children between 6 and 12years old.  all of them go to school. The group is called Nyagatare Jyambere, which means “go forward” in English. The group members sell different items, but they have the same objectives: to improve their standard of living.  Joyeuse has been selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum, maize flour and millet for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of the children.  She also wishes to increase her capital and become a food supplier from village to town.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize for sale.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a local van driver. He works on a small salary and it is difficult for him to manage to pay for the household expenses with his current salary. Therefore he has decided to become self-employed, by buying a new rickshaw. He believes that the income will be greater than his current salary and he will be in a better position to take care of his family. That is why his wife has applied for a loan to help her husband buy a new auto rickshaw. Their dream is to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en: Leonidas is 41 years old. He is married with five children, between the ages of 6 and 17, and all of them go to school. He has been selling clothes and shoes for 15 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes and shoes for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is 30 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Her husband runs a garment business in the local community. He is a capable person and works hard to make sure that his family's needs are met. He wants to buy more variety of garments in order to enhance his business and increase sales. He does not have sufficient savings to buy items in large quantities. Therefore, his wife has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help him buy a different variety of garments.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's garment sale business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 30-year-old man, Palestinian refugee, and married father of one child. He lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Ten years ago, he started working in air conditioning services and maintenance inside the camp but he suffered from limited income due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinian refugees, especially those who live in camps. Thus, Khalil planned to open a new business, and used his previous Al-Majmoua loan to open a chicken selling shop, through which he can make sure that he will have a daily income business. At the same time, he needs necessary updated machines, requested for his air conditioning business.

Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tools for updating his chicken shop. This loan will help Khalil facilitate his work and provide quick services for his customers.

With both businesses, Khalil is struggling to improve his family’s living situation inside the camp and increase his income to provide his beloved child a better social and financial life.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for updating his chicken shop to facilitate his work and provide quick services for his customers

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Адолат женщина предприниматель из района Хамадони. Ей 31 год. Она замужем за такого же предпринимателя, как и она сама. Однако ее муж занят в сфере продаж продуктов питания. Адолат имеет двоих детей. Они еще несовершеннолетние.  
15 лет назад Адолат начала свою предпринимательскую деятельность, которую продолжает и по сей день. Она в основном занимается продажей детской одежды. Ее торговая точка находится на центральном рынке района. У Адолат большой опыт в торговле и она знает подход к каждому клиенту. 
На сумму кредита Адолат хочет привезти сезонный товар, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Adolat is a woman-entrepreneur from the Hamadoni district. She is 31 years old. She is married to another entrepreneur, just like she is. However, her husband is involved in the field of selling food products. Adolat has two children, both of whom are underage. Adolat started her business 15 years ago and continues it to this day. She is primarily involved in selling children's clothing. Her retail outlet is located at the district central market. Adolat has a lot of experience in sales and knows the right approach for every customer. Adolat wants to use this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise in order to increase her sales volume. She hopes for the support very much.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise in order to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en:
Kamoliddin lives in a rural area. He is married and has a little child. Kamoliddin is the breadwinner for his family as his wife is a homemaker.

Kamoliddin has been busy with animal husbandry. He began this business 5 years ago. Kamoliddin feeds cattle for a number of months and then sells them in a local market. He has additional income from growing potatoes and carrots. His wife helps him with managing the business.

Kamoliddin is going to increase the number of cattle he feeds but he needs a bigger cowshed as his present cowshed is small. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy construction materials for building a cowshed. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a cowshed

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Gerald one of the most hardworking men on this planet earth. He is a smallholder farmer who is based in Gatunganga a remote village in Kerugoya area of Kenya. He is happily married to a beautiful wife and blessed with two children. For the past five years he has been engaged in mixed farming. He earns a livelihood through selling milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. In order to make ends meet he engages in personal business to make extra cash. Being brought up in a rural setting taught Gerald to always be hardworking and patient, and that’s what is needed to become a successful farmer. Through hard work he has single-handedly raised his family. The biggest challenge he faces as an aspiring farmer is lack of farm implements to increase his productivity. 

He is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. The biggest challenge he has encountered is getting access to funds, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, he feels relieved and knows his dream of improving his living conditions will come to pass. Through the loan he will buy good quality seeds, fertilizer and implements that will increase productivity in his farm. Increased productivity will translate to more income and hence, more profit margins. He plans to reinvest the profits back to the land, so as to ensure continuous improvements. This loan will be the turning point for Gerald’s family, because he will be able to secure their future and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 54 year-old married woman who works as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through sever financial crisis that compelled her to use her tailoring skills in a productive manner. She felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Over time she has attained a good number of customers. In order to stitch up more dresses on time, she needs to purchase materials such as spools of thread, ribbons, and buttons in different colors. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, such as spools of threads, ribbons and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is 38 years old, living with her family in Lahore. She has five children. She is a caring mother and always supports her children. One of her children owns a boutique in the nearby market. He is a young, hardworking, and enthusiastic entrepreneur. His current set-up allows him to earn good money; he is happy with his business. But he has figured out that if he invests more in his business, he will be able to attract more customers and increase his sales. Therefore in order to enhance his business, Rafia has requested for a loan to help her son buy a different variety of clothes for his boutique.

loans.use: to enhance her son's boutique business

loans.name: Peruza

texts.en:
Peruza is an experienced agronomist from the Shenik village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and school-aged son (9 years old). Her husband works in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Peruza is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding a livestock of pigs, and cultivating cucumber, cabbage, watermelon, and greens. She sells the products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Peruza needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation. She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en: Shanaz deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their household expenditures alone. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is 35 years old and a dedicated mother of five children. She is always supportive of her family. Her husband is a taxi driver. The main source of income comes from driving the taxi. As they have a big family it is very difficult for them to meet their daily expenses.  Due to regular driving, the taxi needs to be repaired so that it drives smoothly. As the entire family depends on this single source of income, its proper maintenance is very necessary. Their current income is not sufficient to help them pay for the maintenance charges of the taxi. Therefore, Jameela has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva to help her with the loan.

loans.use: to cover the rickshaw repair cost

loans.name: Mislima

texts.ru:
Мислима 47-летняя учительница из района Рудаки. Она в течение 20 лет преподает в местной школе. Ее муж работает ведущим специалистом на гидроэлектростанции. Все их дети старше 18 лет. 
В данный момент один сын Мислимы является студентом. Он учится в Таджикском Техническом Университете, в факультете "Архитектуры и строительства". В этом году он переходит на третий курс и сперва его семья должна оплатить за новый учебный год. У Муслимы нет сбережений, поэтому она единственный выход видит в получении кредита. Когда она обратилась в ХУМО за кредитом, ей предложили кредит на образование с низкими процентными ставками. Ей этот кредит пришлось по душе. Вся сумма кредита - 1200 долларов США, пойдет на оплату контракта. Мислима очень хочет, чтобы ее сын продолжил учебу в университете и получил высшее образование.
texts.en: Mislima is a 47-year-old teacher from the Rudaki. She has been teaching at a local school for 20 years. Her husband works as a leading specialist at a hydroelectric power plant. All of their children are over 18 year old. At the present time, one of Mislima's children is a student. He attends the Tajikistan State University, Architecture and Construction department. He will be starting his 3rd year this year, and his family has to pay for the new school year. Mislima does not have enough savings and sees obtaining a loan as the only solution. When she came to Humo for the loan, she was offered an education loan with a low interest rate. She liked this loan. The entire loan amount - 1200 US dollars - will be used to pay the tuition obligation. Mislima really wants her son to continue his education at the university and obtain a higher education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 29-year-old, married father of one child. Seven years ago he was employed in a supermarket, where he sells meat and dairy products. Jalal has a limited income salary, which makes covering his family’s living expenses and needs difficult. He is working hard to make things easier for them and for himself at the same time.
 
Today, he is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car that would help him move easily to his work, and at the same time respond to his family’s needs. This Loan will facilitate Jalal’s life, as he has always hoped to have his own business, and in the future to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car that would help him move easily to his work, and at the same time respond to his family’s needs.

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara is an experienced farmer from the Qarakert village of the Armavir region.
 
Donara, as she used to, is engaged in agriculture and she breeds two cows, four pigs, ten chickens, and one beehive. She also cultivates various vegetables and fruits. This will be Donara's second loan from Kiva. She used the first loan to purchase four pigs, an ox, and forage for feeding them.

This time she asks for a loan of 1,500 USD in order to purchase different types of forage for feeding the livestock. As her livestock is now big, she needs this loan and hopes for the support of the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for different types of forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 40-year-old married father of two children. Fourteen years ago, to increase his income and better support his family, he travelled to Saudi Arabia and started working as a chef there. Then he decided to come back to Lebanon and work in the same profession, to be close to his beloved family.

To supplement his income from his current work, he recently started his own personal catering business, which he runs from his house. He wants to make sure that his income can cover his family’s needs.

Mohammad is trying very hard to increase his income to cover his family’s needs and expenses and provide them with a better life. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children’s increasing school tuition fees and to replace his catering plates and necessary tools to keep his business up to date.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his own business, in order to make it his full time job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s tuition fees and to replace his catering plates and necessary tools to keep his business up to date.

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 25 años de edad, que desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades y, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

El negocio lo tiene hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 9 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y a su hija no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.

Carlos, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 25-year-old man who started working at a variety of activities once he finished secondary school. Currently he has a grocery store that a family member transferred to him so he could work and generate income to cover the household expenses.

He has had the business for 3 years. He works every day from 7 am to 9 pm and, despite the competition that exists in the sector, he has obtained good results, generating sufficient income so that his wife and daughter do not lack anything.

The loan he is requesting is to buy wholesale supplies (pastries, dairy products, cookies, and grains, among others). This will let him offer a greater variety of products to satisfy the immediate needs of his customers, increasing sales and the income he receives for his labor.

Carlos has the spirit of overcoming and the desire to move ahead with his family that push him to continue fighting and to advance in order to meet the goal of acquiring his own home, in which he can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his family and provide his daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business such as groceries, grains, soft drinks, fritters, liquors, and other food products to stock his store and give his daughter an education

loans.name: Martha Elisa

texts.es: Martha es una señora colombiana, es casada y tiene 3 hijas, Martha juntamente con su esposo se dedica el jornal y también cría chanchos que los tiene en un pedacito de terreno que lo cerró con alambre junto donde vive su madre, Martha se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era muy joven, comenta que es su madre quien le enseño a esta actividad, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos para incrementar su negocio, con el que espera progresar y a juntan un poco de dinero para comprar una casita.
texts.en: Martha is a Colombian woman. She is married and has 3 daughters. Martha and her husband work as day laborers and also raise pigs, which they have on a small piece of land that they closed in with wire next to where her mother lives. Martha has raised pigs since she was very young. She says that it was her mother who taught her this activity. With the money from the loan, she is going to buy pigs to increase her business, with which she hopes to progress and save a little bit of money to buy a little house.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Zahooran

texts.en: Zahooran is 44 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Her husband is a mason by profession. He builds houses and is an expert in his work. He is the sole earner in the family. But, given their big family, they find it difficult to pay for monthly expenses. As a result, he does not have sufficient savings. As his tools have deteriorated due to wear and tear, he needs to buy new tools along with some additional ones. Therefore, Zahooran has requested for a loan to help her husband buy these tools to help him buy the necessary tools for his mason work.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's mason work

loans.name: Wara Cristina

texts.es:
Wara Cristina es una joven de 22 años, nació en La Paz – Bolivia, es soltera, y vive con su pequeña hija que tiene un año de edad.
Wara nos cuenta que su vida fue difícil, pues a sus siete años sus padres decidieron separarse, ella y sus tres hermanas se quedaron a vivir con su mamá, posteriormente dos de ellas dejaron su hogar ya que quedaron embarazadas y decidieron vivir con sus parejas, situación que afecto mucho a su mamá por lo que se dedicó a la bebida y perdió su trabajo, poco después se vio afectada la economía de su hogar llegando incluso a acudir a centros de ayuda donde les proporcionaban alimento ya que no recibían mucho apoyo económico por parte de su papá, sin embargo al ver está situación él decide llevarlas a vivir con su nueva familia. 
Wara decidió vivir sola y comenzó a trabajar en una guardería y por las tardes se dedicó a estudiar la carrera de secretariado, fue mensajera, luego secretaria y actualmente es encargada de cobranzas, este crecimiento profesional ha hecho que Wara decida realizar un curso técnico en el área de seguros, ya que confía que con los nuevos conocimientos y herramientas adquiridas podrá obtener muchas más posibilidades de crecer y aspirar a un mejor salario, ya que actualmente sus ingresos solo alcanzan para cubrir sus gastos mensuales y los de su hija. 
Su sueño es salir profesional y mejorar sus ingresos para brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y ayudar a su mamá económicamente.
Wara agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán seguir estudiando y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Wara Cristina, a young 22 year old woman, was born in La Paz, Bolivia.   She is single and lives with her small one year old daughter.  Wara tells us that her life was difficult because her parents decided to separate when she was seven.  She and her three sisters were left to live with their mother.  Later, two of them left home because they got pregnant and decided to live with their partners.  This situation greatly affected her mother, who took to drink and lost her job.   Shortly after, the household economy was affected and they even had to go to aid centers where they provided food because they didn’t receive much financial support from their father.  However, seeing the situation, he decided to take them to live with his new family.
Wara decided to live alone and started working in a day-care center, and in the afternoons she studied for a secretarial degree.  She was a messenger, then a secretary, and now she is in charge of collections.  This professional growth made Wara decide to enroll in a technical course in the area of insurance.  She is confident that with the newly acquired knowledge and tools, she will have many more opportunities of growing and aspiring to a better salary.  Currently, her income is just enough to cover the monthly expenses for herself and her daughter.  Her dream is to become a professional and improve her income so that she can provide her daughter with a better quality of life and help her mother financially.  Wara is grateful to the people who provide her with the financial resources that will allow her to continue studying and fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced technical degree in insurance.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiqan is a 50-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, healthcare, and clothing. 

She has been in the business of carpet manufacturing for the past four years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she has become famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.  She is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively.  

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation, and currently has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She expects a boost to her earnings, and dreams of providing a better quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old, a Palestinian refugee and a married father of two kids. He lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Due to the difficult living conditions of the Palestinian refugees, especially those who live in camps, Mohammad was forced to quit school during the intermediate level and found his way in working in the fields to help his parents in covering their living expenses and needs. Nine years ago, he started learning the painting profession from his neighbor and he was able, in a short period of time, to gain the necessary experience which allowed him to become independent and work on his own. 

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a scaffold that will facilitate his work and accelerate the completion of his workshops in an attempt to increase his income and provide better living conditions to his beloved kids. 

Mohammad wants to improve his work as he hopes to get training courses that would help him realize new wall painting types and arts.

loans.use: to buy a scaffold that will facilitate his work and accelerate the completion of his workshops

loans.name: Enaya

texts.en:
Enaya is a 49-year-old, married woman. Her husband works in the aluminum business, but his income isn’t enough to cover their requested living expenses. Thus, seven years ago, she opened a convenience store in an attempt to help her husband and improve their living conditions. 

Today, Enaya is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise through buying special offer products that will increase her sales and net profit in a well-managed way. 

Enaya hopes to keep on expanding her business and increasing her income to cover their living needs and expenses and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise through buying special offer products that will increase her sales and net profit in a well-managed way

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old, married mother of three. She has been running her clothes-selling shop for three years in order to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Their combined incomes are barely enough to cover their increasing living needs and she has to keep her business up-to-date to make sure that she can stay capable of replying to her customers' needs and family's requests.

Thus, for this reason, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a special autumn, new-release collection to get ready for her customers' requests.

She hopes to continue developing and expanding her business in a well-managed way to make sure that she can provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a special autumn, new-release collection to get ready for her customers' requests

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза сельская жительница района Гиссар. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Ее муж рабочий, а дети еще школьники. Фируза работает уборщицей в районной больнице. Одновременно она при дворе дома держит скот. Вот уже 6 лет как она занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатых скотин. В основном Фируза покупает молодых бычков, в течение определенного времени откармливает их и затем продает по прибыльной цене. На сумму кредита Фируза хочет приобрести еще одного молодого бычка для дальнейшей продажи. Она нуждается в этом кредите для развития деятельности.
texts.en: Firuza is a resident of the Gissar district. She is 42 years old. She is married and raising three children. Her husband is a worker, and children are school students. Firuza works as a janitor at the district hospital. Concurrently, she keeps livestock in her home backyard. She has been involved in fattening up and selling cattle for 6 years already. Primarily, Firuza buys young bulls, fattens them up during a set period of time and then sells them at a profitable price. Firuza wants to use this loan to buy another young bull for subsequent resale. She needs this loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for subsequent resale

loans.name: Kambarbu

texts.ru: Камбарбу 61 год, разведена, есть взрослый сын, он помогает по хозяйству. У Камбарбу - высшее образование, работает педиатром в местной больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2005 году с покупки 3 коров. Благодаря упорному труду Камбарбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 18 овец, 8 телят. Также есть 0,8 ГА земельной доли, где Камбарбу выращивает люцерна. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камбарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Камбарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kambarbu is 61 years old, divorced and has an adult son, who helps her with the household. Kambarbu has a higher education and works as a pediatrician at a local hospital. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2005, initially starting with a purchase of 3 cows. Thanks to Kambarbu's hard work, today her business has 4 dairy cows, 18 sheep and 8 calves. She also has 0.8 hectares of land, where Kambarbu grows alfalfa. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, Kambarbu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy dairy cows to buy calves for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a higher price. Kambarbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and subsequent resale in order to expand her business

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 34-year-old, married woman. Her financial conditions are very bad.  Her husband used to drive a moto rickshaw, which did not belong to him. He wants to get rid of the daily fare, and has desired to buy his own moto rickshaw. He has his personal bike, which he wants to convert into a moto rickshaw, so he can easily generate income for his sibling. A moto rickshaw body has a cheap cost, but he does not have even a small amount of cash in hand. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body to convert his bike into a moto rickshaw. 

For the motivation of her husband, she has requested a loan so he can buy the new rickshaw body and can start driving. Shumaila thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, 24 years old, is married to a businessman. She has been selling rice for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice to sell. The profits will be used to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a mother who aimed to make her business profitable to generate sufficient income and sustain the family's daily necessities. She is 54 years old and has three children. She owns and manages a small retail store within the rural community. 

To make more improvements in her business, she would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sulma

texts.en: Sulma is a 31-year-old married woman. Ten years ago, she started her own business selling cloth. In order to bear her children’s expenses, she needs to help her husband financially. She buys fancy cloth from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. She counts a good client list. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business, and now she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of fancy embroidered cloth in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of fancy embroidered cloth in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia lives in Lahore. She is 37 years old and is a housewife. She is a mother of three children. Her husband runs a small restaurant near their house. He is the sole earner in the family. He has eight years of experience in this business. He is observing an increase in customers every day due to his good food taste and the increase in population in their community. He therefore wants to enhance his business by buying more items to avoid any shortages. Fouzia, as a supportive wife, has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help her husband with his business.

loans.use: to increase her husband's small restaurant business

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 28 years old and married with four children, between the ages of 8 and 10. All of them go to school. She sells shop items such as soup, salt, rice, and sugar. With the loan, she would like to buy more soups, sugar, and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more soups, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Leonor Maria

texts.es:
Leonor es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. 

Leonor es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que su esposo la abandono hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante.
 
Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo como lociones, cremas, y maquillajes, cuando su esposo la dejo, le tocó incrementar sus ventas para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y para lograrlo le tocó trabajar muy fuerte y luchar durante muchos días fuertemente. 

Actualmente Leonor tiene unos grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como lociones y maquillaje para asi responder a los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Leonor is a very hard-working person who has succeeded in moving her two children forward thanks to her daily effort, giving them a good quality education.

Leonor is a single mother and head of household because her husband abandoned her some time ago. This has made her economic situation very difficult, but with her business she has had a great strength and she has been able to move forward.

A long time ago, she started selling personal products through a catalog such as lotions, creams, and makeup. When her husband left her, she had to increase her sales in order to be able to cover all of her household's expenses, and to achieve it she had to work very hard and fight strongly for many days.

Currently Leonor has some big orders from her customers, and since she does not have a lot of capital she is looking for a loan to buy personal products such as lotions and makeup in order to be able to respond to the orders she has from her customers.

Her greatest dream is to move forward with her business and from this be able to offer her 2 children a good quality of life and better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a supply of lotions, creams, and makeup to provide for her work and increase her sales

loans.name: Bartolo Jose

texts.es:
Bartolo es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en zona rural del municipio de Montería.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 2 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Bartolo is very pleasant and always has a smile for the clients who visit his grocery store in a rural zone of the municipality of Montería. Thanks to his charm and good mood, he has been able to win the heart and recognition of the local people who always prefer to visit his store to buy their products.

He works every day in order to offer a good quality of life to his two children. He strives to give them an excellent future.

Presently he is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of basic food products, such as grains, groceries, candy and beverages, among others, in order to give a significant boost to his business. 

He continues to hope that he can keep the business going, and in this way make a difference in the life of his clients through his good service.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products for his store, such as groceries, grains, beverages and other food items.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine, 40 years old, is married with six children, between the ages of 2 and 20. All of her children go to school. She has been selling shop items such as sugar, rice, salt, and biscuits for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, rice, and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more salt, rice, and biscuits for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is now applying for a loan of 800 USD to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital of $100.  She earns a good income from her business. She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as wheat, bananas, oils, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 11 years. She wants to make her business bigger and to improve her living conditions in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, bananas, oils, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta to sell.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 22-year-old, single lady. A year ago, she started her beauty parlor business in her town to earn a good amount of income. She is eager to support her family, as her father’s income is not sufficient to bear their household expenditures. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her best provided services she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies such as wheat, bananas, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and rice. 

Natalia started her business in 2003 with her own working capital of $100. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. This will help her increase her business.

loans.use: To buy wheat, bananas, oil, vegetables, tomatoes and rice.

loans.name: Maricela Fabiola

texts.es: Maricela es una jovencita de 19 años de edad, ella trabaja de vendedora en un almacén de electrodomésticos, adicional a esta actividad también se dedica a criar chanchos, ella vive con sus padres  y termino sus estudios secundarios  pero por falta de recursos económicos no puede asistir a la universidad, Maricela va a invertir su crédito en la compra de chanchos que los cría en unos pedacitos de hierba que están abandonados, comenta que su madre le da juntando los desperdicios de comida y es esto lo que les da para que se alimenten sus chanchos, el sueño de Maricela es seguir trabajando y también mejorar su negocio para obtener algo de ganancias que le permitan pagar lo que implica entrar a estudiar.
texts.en: Maricela is a 19-year-old young woman. She works as a salesperson in a household appliance store. In addition to that work, she raises pigs. She lives with her parents and finished secondary school, but due to a lack of economic resources she cannot go to college. Maricela is going to use the loan to buy pigs that she raises on some little pieces of grass that are abandoned. She says that her mother collects the food scraps and gives them to her and this is what she gives the pigs to feed them. Maricela's dream is to continue working and also to improve her business in order to obtain some profits that would allow her to pay what it costs to get into school.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Jania Marisol

texts.es: Jania es una joven emprendedora con espíritu de superación, tiene la edad de 24 años y soltera, que se dedica la compra-venta de muebles en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sillas mecedoras, mesas, comedores, roperos y chineros. Es el segundo ciclo que solicita el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una socia responsable.
texts.en: Jania is a young entrepreneur with a spirit of self-improvement. She is 24 years old and single, and she works buying and selling furniture. She runs her business from home. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase rocking chairs, tables, dining sets, wardrobes and china cabinets. This is the second loan cycle in which she has requested funding for her business and she has proven herself to be a responsible member.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to re-sell.

loans.name: Prima Ahorros Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Prima Ahorros” está conformado por cinco integrantes, todos son compañeros de puesto, pero con el tiempo se han hecho muy buenos amigos. Cuando escucharon hablar de VisionFund México decidieron solicitar un préstamo para comprar más mercancía y así mejorar su negocio. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque las integrantes del grupo son primas. 
Geovanna tiene 32 años de edad y está casada con el señor Rubén desde hace ya 10 años. Juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella platica que su experiencia como comerciantes inició con la venta de lonas, guantes, abrigos, y poco a poco ha ido agregando más productos.. Nunca había tenido un negocio, pero se animan por la falta de empleos en su municipio. Geovanna explica que hay tanto buenos como malos días en las ventas, pero en general, el negocio va avanzando poco a poco. Le encantaría tener un puesto fijo pues actualmente vende sus artículos en un puesto ambulante. Su plan a futuro es que al tener dos puestos, uno que atienda ella y otro su esposo, sus ganancias aumentarán y es precisamente la meta que quiere alcanzar a mediano plazo. Como meta máxima, Geovanna trabaja para asegurar la educación de sus pequeños. En esta ocasión utilizará su préstamo para comprar gorras, lonas, abrigos, etc. 
Los demás integrantes y e inversiones son: J. Guadalupe, Julieta y Rosalba invertirán en frutas y verduras, mientras que Brijida invertirá en productos para el hogar y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Prima Ahorros Group is made up of five members.  They're all kiosk mates, but over time they have become very good friends.  When they heard about VisionFund México they decided to request a loan to buy more merchandise to improve their businesses.  They chose the name of the group because the members are cousins.

Geovanna, 32, has been married to Rubén for 10 years.  Together they have formed a family with three children, who are attending school.  She said her experience as a merchant began with selling shoes, gloves, and coats, and little by little she has added more products. They were motivated to start their own business by the lack of jobs in their town.

Geovanna explained that there are good and bad days in sales.  In general, though, her business is moving forward little by little.  She would love to have a fixed space, because currently she sells her articles in a movable stand.  Her plan for the future is to have two stands, one that she will run and another for her husband.  Her profits will increase, which is precisely the goal she wants to realize in the medium term.  As an ultimate objective, Geovanna works to secure her children's education.

She'll use this loan to buy caps, shoes, coats, and so on.

The other members and investments are J. Guadalupe, Julieta, and Rosalba, who will invest in fruits and vegetables, and Brijida, who will invest in household products and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy caps, shoes, coats, etc.

location.town: San Pablo Tlachichilpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nirupa

texts.en:
Nirupa hails from Dhupguri. She is married and a mother of one son. She is 40 years old and married to Bishwanath. Both she and her husband attended school until eighth standard. They live in Palpara in Jalpaiguri district. Their only son is a student and is in college.

She operates her own tailoring business to financially help the family. She makes ladies’ garments, such as frocks, petticoats, blouses and other garments, and sells these to the local garment shops as well as to her neighbors. Her husband runs a sweetmeat shop with a low income, so her business is most important for the family. She works from home, adding to their income and helping to meet their needs. She has always enjoyed her work and hopes that she will be able to one day open her own workshop.

For now, she needs a loan to replace her machine that she has destroyed by using it so much through the years. So, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS. She wants to utilize the amount to purchase a new sewing machine. She would like to be able to also purchase some material for her work, so that she can stitch more clothing. She hopes the loan will help her increase her profit and work more effectively and efficiently.

She dreams to buy a cow with the profit and start a milk-selling business in the future for additional income.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Franklin Jhony

texts.es:
Franklin es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia. Desde hace más de 4 años trabaja como brindado servicios de transporte (colectivos) a través de la ciudad y le va muy bien porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los clientes y respeta mucho las señales de tránsito.
Franklin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá apoyar a su madre en algunos pagos del hogar que tiene que realizarse. De esta manera vivirán con mayor bienestar y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder comprarse un carro propio y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Franklin is a young man with a lot of desire to move ahead. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in Parcona with his family. For more than 4 years, he has worked as a transportation service provider (taxi) through the city and it is going very well for him because he is always concerned with the well-being of his customers and has a lot of respect for traffic signals. Franklin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to help his mother with some household payments she has to make. In this way they will live with greater well-being and he will continue working hard in order to be able to buy his own car and have more income.

loans.use: to help his mother with the household expenses

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has a 2-year-old child. He has two additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  

In 2011, Gibrilla established his Internet café and design business. He began his business because he wants to maintain his home. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are the general public. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Gibrilla requires a loan in order to buy more materials like ink cartridges and computer accessories for use and for sale. He hopes that this loan will support him through proper use. 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to establish a bigger shop for more service delivery. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more materials like ink cartridges and computer accessories

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine de 22 años de edad, desde hace  6 años,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de mochilas y carteras, pues desde muy niña le gustó tejer, aprovechando en el colegio donde estudió,  la enseñaron a hacerlo. Poco a poco entre las personas mas cercanas a ella,  le fueron encargando gorros, llaveros, y desde hace 3 años, agregó  a su oferta mochilas y bolsos, los cuales hoy  vende a su principal clientela de vecinos, compañeros de la universidad donde estudia y a familiares, que le encargan, pues conocen la calidad con la que trabaja y los tiene exhibidos en la tienda de sus padres. Su meta es tener un taller bien organizado en un local y continuar sus estudios profesionales, para salir adelante con su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como lana e hilos, y una vitrina, para proteger y guardar los productos e insumos. Con ello logrará mejorar la presentación de sus productos y hacer que su credikiva sea una buena inversión para su negocio y lo impulse.
texts.en:
Katherine is 22 years old, and for six years she has worked making and selling backpacks and wallets. Since she was a little girl she liked to sew, and she took advantage of the college where she studied as they taught her how to do it.

Little by little between the people closest to her, they began ordering hats and keychains, and three years ago, she added backpacks and bags to her merchandise, which today she sells to her main customers who are neighbors, friends from the university where she studies, and family members. They order them, as they know the quality of the products she makes, and she has them on display in her parents' store. 

Her goal is to have a well organized workshop in a store and to continue her professional studies in order for her and her family to get ahead. 

Currently she is asking for a loan from Kiva, her first funding from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy raw materials, such as wool and thread, as well as a display case to protect and hold her products. With this she will achieve a better presentation of her products, making her Kiva loan a good investment for her business and boost it.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool and thread, and a display case.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es: Yaqueline es una mujer de 44 años de edad , que habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijas en las edades de 10, 13, 16 y 22 . Desde el año 1990 en compañía de su esposo  inició en otro municipio del departamento del Atlántico, su idea emprendedora con una tienda de ranchos y víveres. Al mudarse a la ciudad volvió a emprenderla  en uno de los barrios más populares del sur de la ciudad y hoy en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se encargan de este negocio. Los principales productos en la oferta de Yaqueline son el arroz, el azúcar, la carne, sal, pollo, café y en general, artículos de la canasta familiar que las familias compran en pequeñas cantidades para satisfacer la demanda alimentaria de los suyos.  Yaqueline da apertura a su negocio desde las 6 de la mañana y cierra a las 10 de la noche vendiendo de contado a sus principales clientes que son sus vecinos en el barrio. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su oferta vendiendo variedades para mejorar su negocio, aunque su mayor desafío sea lograr recursos suficientes para alcanzar sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento no que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará productos lácteos y carnes frías principalmente, con esta inversión mejorará su negocio, pues sus ventas se incrementarán porque el surtido será aun mayor.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is 44 years old. She lives with her husband and four daughters aged 10, 13, 16, and 22 in the south part of the city. In 1990 she and her husband started a business in another municipality in the department of Atlántico. Their idea was to open a store selling provisions. When they moved to the town, they started the store once again in one of the busiest neighborhoods in the south of the town. Now she, her husband, and their children run the store.

The most important items that Yaqueljne sells are rice, sugar, meat, salt, chicken, coffee and other basics. Local families buy these items in small quantities to feed their children. The store is open from 6am and closes at 10pm, selling goods on account to her customers who come from the neighbourhood.

Yaqueline's goal is to improve the business by offering a wider variety of merchandise. Her greatest challenge is having enough money to achieve her dreams. She is now seeking a loan, her first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy mostly milk products and cooked meats. In this way she will improve her business as sales will increase as a result of the larger amount of stock for sale.

loans.use: to purchase milk products and cooked meats

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 46-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for the last many years. She has two cows in milk and sells their milk to many of the neighbors. She also looks after buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, selling it at different places on a daily basis. In this way she is able to obtain a good profit. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. 

She is happily running the business to support her family. She has 4 children. She needs to earn much more to meet the household expenditures, including food, clothing and health. In order to make more profit, Perveen has gotten her 7th loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more cow in order to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Luis Ramiro

texts.es:
La vida para el señor Luis en varias circunstancias se volvió muy difícil pues paso por un tiempo que no tuvo empleo y estaba ya desesperado en su hogar, con la ayuda de prestamistas como los encontrados en la página que le dieron la mano cuando más lo necesitaba logro montar un carro de venta de comidas rápidas y gracias a este ha logrado mantener a su familia constituida por su esposa y 3 hijos todavía muy pequeños con 13, 8 y 2 años de edad que depende exclusivamente de él. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su carro de comidas rápidas como lo son carnes, vegetales y frutas para realizar ensaladas, papas, panes, etc. también quiere realizar adecuaciones a su carro de comidas. 

El cliente pide que nuevamente confíen en su proyecto que le permitan progresar que le presten para el mejorar y devolverá con resultados y puntualidad en pagos la confianza que quieran depositar en él
texts.en:
Life for Sr. Luis in many ways turned out to be very difficult as for a time he had no work and was desperate. With help from lenders who gave him a hand when he most needed it, he began selling fast food from a cart. Thanks to this job he has managed to support his wife and three young children aged 13, 8, and 2 who are totally delpendent on him.

Now Luis is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for the fast food he sells from his cart such as meat, vegetables, and fruit. With these items he will make salads, potatoes, and sandwiches. He also wants to make some repairs to his cart. 

Luis is asking once again for you to trust in his project so he can make progress and lend him money to make improvements. In return for the trust he will provide good results and pay back the loan money punctually.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the fast food he sells from his cart (meat, vegetables, and fruit)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn flour, corn, meat, potatoes, vegetables, chicken and a fryer to make empanadas to distribute to stores.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 31 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 10, and all of them go to school. She has been selling food stuffs for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, sorghum and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, age 37, is married with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 17, and all of them go to school. Jacqueline has been selling rice for 10 years. With the loan she would like to buy more rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children and to increase their savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is an old client of BRAC, and this is her sixth loan. She is taking the loan for her husband; in fact, he drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years and using petrol, which is very costly. Due to the increase in the cost of petrol, he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy new CNG (compressed natural gas) rickshaw. 

With the contribution of savings and the selling price of the old rickshaw, he is still some amount short to buy a new CNG rickshaw. Therefore, Kaneez has contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a CNG rickshaw so he can minimize the fuel expense and can grow his income as well.

Kaneez seems very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new CNG rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu, who is 39 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 21, 9, 8, and 3. 

In 2008, Kadiatu established her fish-selling business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband take care of their home. Her business is located on the outskirts of Freetown, and her main customers are people from the general community. Working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day, Kadiatu earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leones (SLL) every month from her business. 

She needs a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish to sell, and would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to develop her business, educate her children, and build a house car for her children . She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 69-year-old Marie. She is a widow and has no children. In 2011, Marie established her drinks and rice business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in solving some domestic home problems. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are the general community people.

Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL (Sierra LeoneS) a month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more soft and hard drinks ie beer, stout, etc. to sell. She hopes that this loan will support her through proper use. 

In the future, Marie plans to open a bigger shop and build her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo una persona que desde pequeño sus padres le metieron el pensamiento de ser emprendedor, razón por la cual hace 7 años tiene un puesto de venta de productos congelados para restaurantes y tiendas como lo son empanadas y condimentos. 

Adolfo quiere oficializar su negocio y poco a poco va adquiriendo insumos para en un futuro no muy lejano constituir un local de venta de condimentos. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina selladora que le urge pues sus clientes ya le están solicitando sus productos sellados con máquina y no manual, también necesita comprar insumos para la fabricación de empanas. 

Adolfo es soñador pero no de esos que solo tiene su sueños en el aire y está comprometido a montar su negocio en un periodo máximo de un año y poder contratar gente por eso pide la ayuda de un préstamo que le permita crecer y seguir juntando ingresos para consolidar su local de condimentos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a person who from the time he was little was taught by his parents how to think like an entrepreneur. That is why for 7 years he has had a sales stall where he sells frozen products for restaurants and stores such as empanadas and seasonings.   

Adolfo wants to formalize his business and little by little acquire materials so that in the future he can build a locale to sell seasonings.
