He is asking for a loan to buy a sealing machine that he really needs because his customers are asking for products sealed by machine and not manually. He also needs to buy ingredients to make the empanadas.  

Adolfo is a dreamer but not one of those who only has dreams in the air. He is committed to opening his business within a year and being able to hire people. That is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to grow and keep earning income to consolidate his condiment locale.

loans.use: to buy a sealing machine and ingredients to make his empanadas, such as meat, dough, corn, chicken, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Kyakudupa Tweterane Group

texts.en: Mary is a member of Kyakudupa Tweterane Group, where each member guarantees the others. She is a farmer growing crops like maize and beans for selling. She faces hardships of inadequate capital; however, she hopes to expand her business to new areas. Mary needs a loan to buy beans and g-nuts (peanuts) for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and g-nuts for selling.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak lives in Armavir with her husband and two children. For 11 years, Arusyak has been selling food and different housing products in her small store. She works with various grocery distributors on credit sales. As her clients' demands are growing each day, Arusyak is willing to increase the assortment of goods in her shop (food and home appliances), as well as buy some shop shelving to better present her goods. The requested loan is very important for Arusyak and her family and they hope for lenders' support. 

Arusyak has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family faced difficulties. However, thanks to their recent hard work, Arusyak is able to run her business in a way that ensures that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The lenders will provide great support to Arusyak and her family by giving them an opportunity to receive the loan and to maintain their business.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for the shop (food and home appliances) and also shop shelving to better present her goods.

loans.name: Alexander Andres

texts.es:
Alexander es un mecánico de 27 años de edad que tiene su negocio ubicado en la única bomba de gasolina del municipio, se enfrenta a muchos problemas del sector como lo es la fuerte competencia, pero más que esto es la competencia desleal, personas que bajan sus costos solo pro atraer personal desvalorando el profesionalismo de un mecánico. 

A pesar de todo esto la gente sigue confiando en sus servicios, su experiencia y profesionalismo a la hora de hacer un trabajo y el está muy agradecido con estas personas y es por ellas que se encuentra laborando. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de herramienta manual, como lo son: llaves, destornilladores, martillos, tuercas etc. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito tendrá herramienta manual para atender cualquier eventualidad que se le presente, también podrá desplazarse a la zona de emergencia y brindar un buen servicio en el lugar que ocurre. 

Sueña con que su negocio crezca y juntar ahorros para comprar una casa propia o ir pagándola, recoger dinero para esa cuota y tener un hogar donde vivir y tener hijos con su pareja
texts.en:
Alexander is a 27-year-old mechanic who has a business located in the only gas station in his municipality. He faces many problems in the sector such as the strong competition, but more than this, is the disloyal competition, people who lower their costs only to attract people, devaluing the professionalism of a mechanic. 

Despite all of this, people continue trusting his services, his experience, and professionalism when they have a job to do and he is very grateful to these people and it is because of them that he is working.

He asks for a loan to purchase hand tools such as wrenches, screwdrivers, hammers, nuts and bolts, etc.

With the help of this loan, he will have the hand tools he needs to take care of any situation that presents itself, and also he will be able to go to the location of the emergency and offer his quality service where it happens. 

He dreams that his business will grow and to save up to purchase his own house or to pay for it over time, to earn money for these payments and have a house to live in and have children with his partner.

loans.use: to purchase hand tools such as wrenches, screwdrivers, hammers, nuts and bolts, etc. to be able to go to any location to take care of an emergency.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larvicides, pesticides and fungicides to erradicate a plague that afflicts his crops.

loans.name: Walter Dario

texts.es:
El señor Walter inicio hace 24 años con el negocio del comercio, monto una relojería siendo uno de los  primeros en el sector, logro reconocimiento y fidelizo algunos clientes por lo que en ese entonces su vida marchada muy bien. 
Debido a la remodelación y a los nuevos tiempo hay mucho comercio y mucha competencia donde el precio es el plus para comprar algún producto por lo que Walter no se puede descuidar y debe comenzar a competir con los precios si quiere sobrevivir en el mercado y no acabar una tradición de 24 años.
Solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía todo ella invertida en relojes de hombre, dama, niño y niña innovando con nuevos estilos y tendencias que ha visto en otros lugares que ha visitado y quiere traerlos a Medellín.
Walter centra sus sueños en su familia a sus 42 años de vida tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18, 14 años de edad, lucha por su futuro y sus estudios y sueña con volver a ser una relojería llena de clientes.
texts.en:
Walter began 24 years ago with his commercial business, opening a watch store which was one of the first in the area. He achieved recognition and loyalty from some customers, so that since then his life has been going very well.

Due to renovation and the new times, there are many business and competition where the price is the key to purchase a product, so that Walter can't let it slide and has to start competing with prices if he wants to survive in the market and not end the 24-year tradition.

He asks for a loan to purchase merchandise, investing in men's, women's and children's watches, innovating in new styles and trends that he has seen in other places that he has visited and which he wants to bring to Medellín. 

Walter focuses his dreams on his family. At 42 years old, he has 3 children, ages 20, 18, and 14 years old. He fights for their future and their schooling and dreams of being a watch store full of customers again.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's and children's watches to compete with the other watch stores who, to attract customers, are reducing their prices a lot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Magruba

texts.en:
Magruba comes from a rural area. She is married and brings up three children. She is 33 years old. She is a responsible mother to her children. 

Magruba has been busy with growing wheat and potatoes. Her husband helps her to grow agricultural products. She works hard on her land. Magruba’s main family income is from the agriculture business, so they live poorly. 

She must buy school uniforms and school supplies for her children, as her children go to school. She is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Tenneh. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 10. In 2007, Tenneh established a restaurant business, serving rice and stew, rice and cassava leaves, couscous, fried rice, and drinks, but then she changed her business to selling provisions and clothing materials. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband, and to help with the smooth running of the home. She opens her business 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. She earns about Le 1,325,000 from this business every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

She also caters for parties and workshops. She opened a shop at the east end of Freetown, selling different provisions and clothing materials while her sister runs the restaurant.

Tenneh requires a new loan in order to buy provisions and cooking condiments for her shop and restaurant. In the future, Tenneh plans to be her own proprietress for the restaurant and for the provision and clothing material business.

loans.use: to pay for some raw food items.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 44 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 21. All of them go to school. Dative has been selling food stuffs for 1 year. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum, rice and millet to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum, rice and millet to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, biscuits, mayonnaise, milk, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is age 27, and she is married with one child who goes to school. She has been farming for seven years. She will use Kiva`s loan to buy more fertilizers for rice. With the profits from her farming, she would like to buy cement for building a store for her productivity.



The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional poultry.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is 47 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 26. All of them go to school. Selaphine has been farming for 11 years. She will use Kiva`s loan to buy fertilizers to use during rice production. With the profit from her farming, she would like to buy some land for expanding her business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to use during rice production.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik lives in Aygestan village with her parents, grandmother and brother. Her grandmother is retired and her mother works at a local municipality. All of the members of the family, including Nazik, are involved in farming. They cultivate cabbage, and grow different fruit trees (apricot, peach, pear, plum and apple). Nazik's father and brother sell the gathered harvest in the local markets to earn income for the family.

The requested loan of USD 1,500 is very important for their farm to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, cabbage seeds and to cover watering costs. Nazik and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and they will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain her small business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, cabbage seeds and to cover watering costs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Un toque femenino es lo que identifica la señora Luz quien ha estado operando hace 5 años con un salón de belleza el cual le ha dado buenos resultados y a pesar del divorcio con su esposo ha sabido levantarse de 0 y demostrar fortaleza y dar ejemplo a sus 2 hijos. 

Cuando hablamos de un toque femenino es que Luz quiere remodelar su negocio comprarle sillas nuevas y pintar el negocio con otro atrevido y llamativo estilo(ver foto) para atraer clientes y siempre darle un toque de elegancia y estilo a su negocio demostrando aseo y preocupación hacia el cliente. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar sillas de motilas nuevas y pintura para mejorar su negocio, buscando destacarse entre la competencia. 

Sueña con poder tener un negocio grande con varios empleados en el cual se destaque el estilo y la belleza de sus instalaciones.
texts.en:
A feminine touch is what identifies Luz, who has been operating a beauty salon for the past 5 years, which has given her good profits and, despite the divorce with her husband, she has been able to lift herself up from 0 and show strength and be an example to her 2 children.

When talking of the feminine touch, it means that Luz wants to remodel her business, purchasing new chairs and painting the business with another daring and attention-getting style (see the photo) to attract customers and always provide a touch of elegance and style to the business, showing care and concern for the customer.

She asks for a loan to purchase adjustable chairs and paint to improve her business, looking to stand out from the competition.

She dreams of being able to have a large business with several employees in which her style and the beauty of the space stand out.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and paints to give a daring and attention-getting touch to the shop, looking to attract new customers.

loans.name: Tarpuy Group

texts.es: Flora de 53 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo independiente. La Alcancía Comunal “Tarpuy” está conformada por 09 socias responsables que cada día mejoran en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados deportivos y de vestir. Hace más de 25 años que viene desempañándose en dicho rubro en un puesto de mercado. Su último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de zapatillas, sandalias, botines y calzados de vestir. El deseo de flora es de ampliar su negocio con un nuevo puesto de venta. El grupo “Tarpuy” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.  Flora se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior,  es la tercera del lado izquierdo,  viste chaleco negro. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Eva la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: Flora, 53 years old, is separated and has 1 independent son. The "Tarpuy" communal bank is made up of 9 responsible members who improve their businesses each day. She sells sport and dress shoes. She has been doing this work for more than 25 years at a market stall. She will use the last loan she requested to buy tennis shoes, sandals, boots, and dress shoes. Flora's desire is to expand her business with a new stall. The "Tarpuy" group thanks the people who made this loan possible. Flora is standing in the back; she is the third from the left side and is wearing a black vest. Eva, who could not arrive on time due to work, is in the front on the right side.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes, sandals, boots, and dress shoes

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly, 44 years old, is a single mother of three children. She lives in a small village in the Prey Chhor District in the province of Kampong Cham. To support her family, she works as a chef in a job that pays around USD 5.00 a day. She has been in this career for six years so far.

Chhunly is applying for a loan to dig a well for her family household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes that it will be easier and less time consuming than before for her family to get water to use. She would like to thank the lenders for their financial support of people living with poverty.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Fatmata. She is married and has one child, aged 1 year and 5 months. She has one additional dependent, her cousin, living with her. 
In 2005, Fatmata established her business to help her husband take care of the home and for her personal development. 

Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to purchase dry cotton, wax cotton, and black wax cotton. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise profits. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to see her business become a very big shop and to educate her child to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for dry cotton, wax cotton, and black wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 44 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo y se dedica al comercio da la hoja de coca.
Él es emprendedor, tranquilo, humilde, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en el municipio de batallas caracterizado por la altura del lugar (4000metros sobre el nivel del mar) y su cercanía al lago Titicaca.
Julio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, manos duras por el trabajo en la tierra, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el trabajo. Su negocio es el comercio de coca; una costumbre milenaria desde los tiempos preincaicos e incaicos. Para realizar su labor él debe viajar constantemente grandes distancias hasta encontrar la hoja para después comercializarla. Julio tiene metas y necesidades; el sueño de su vida es realizar la compra de un lote de terreno para la producción de la hoja de coca en su pueblo natal, y necesidades como; pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo y también refaccionar su vivienda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Julio solicita un préstamo para la compra de tierras y con los beneficios pagar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Julio is a 44 year old man, married and the father of one son. He makes a living off of the coca leaf. He is enterprising, gentle, modest, patient, responsible and hard working. He started his business in a municipality characterized by the harsh conditions brought on by high altitude (4000 meters above sea level) and its proximity to Lake Titicaca. 
Julio has a dark complexion, short black hair, he is of medium height and has strong hands from working the land. His native tongue is Aymara and he uses Spanish at his work. His business is the buying and selling of coca. It is an ancient practice that dates back to Incan and pre-Incan times. In order to do his work, he needs to constantly be travelling large distances so he can find product to sell. Julio has goals and needs; one of his dreams is to purchase a lot of land in order to grow his own coca in his native town and he needs to pay for the education of son and also to repair his home in order to improve his quality of life. 
And so, Julio is asking for a loan in order to purchase land and to pay for his son's education.

loans.use: purchase land and pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pig and vegetables

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo dependiente, él vive con su hijo y su conyugue en el centro poblado de Piquijaca, distrito de san Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Peru; en dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de lima el de mayor producción, así como al comercio.

Lucinda se dedica al comercio cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, la cual esta a orillas de la carretera, siendo esta una buena ubicación para su negocio; cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela la mayoría son de su caserío y de los alrededores, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, solvencia moral y económica. Ella desea el crédito para invirtirlo en su negocio comprando una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos, para asi poder diversificar su stock y tener mucho más que ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir poder captar a un número mayor de clientes, adquirir mayores ingresos y por ende una utilidad acéptale que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 35 years old, she lives with her unmarried partner and they have a son together. They live in the town of Piquijaca in the district of San Felipe, in the province of Jaen, the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru. The population here is dedicated primarily to agriculture and cultivates the lima bean as its most important crop. 

Lucinda runs her own grocery store that is also located in her home next to the highway and is well positioned to take advantage of the traffic. She has more than 4 years of experience and offers good service. Her experience counts when it comes to the number of customers she has in town and in the surrounding areas. She has many good personal, moral and financial references. She would like to invest this loan in purchasing a larger quantity and wider variety of products for her store so she can diversify her stock and have more to offer her customers. She also hopes to attract new customers, earn more money and be able to provide a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase a larger quantity and wider variety of products.

loans.name: Brayan Jhaicol

texts.es:
Brayan tiene 20 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, vive en casa familiar en el dsitrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, su comunidad es habitada por personas tranquilas, ambales y respetuosas; dedicadas básicamente a la agrícultura, comercio y ganadería.

Brayan se dedica al transporte de mototaxi. Él ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, para la compra de una nueva mototaxi, y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que podrá alquilar a una tercera persona esta nueva moto, generandole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brayan is 20 years old, he is single and lives with his family in the district of Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeqye on the northern coast of Peru. His community is inhabited by gentle, friendly and respectful people. They make their living from agriculture, business and livestock. 

Brayan makes a living driving a mototaxi. He is asking for a loan of $725 in order to purchase a new mototaxi. This will help him grow his business because he will be able to rent it to a third party and generate more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a new mototaxi.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 42 years old and she is married with five children, aged between 4 and 18. Four of them go to school. She has been selling sorghum for 18 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Alchamandi Ibrahim

texts.en:
Hussan, 38, is single, and has no children. In 2002 he started selling spare parts for bicycles. He began doing this because he was working for a fishing company that went out of business. Working eight hours a day, seven days a week, he earns about 3,000,000 SLL every month. Competition and the rainy season are his challenges in the business.

Hussan is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan through ARD to buy more spare parts for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to enhance his earnings and profit margins.

In the future Hussan plans to become an importer of these spare parts. He is looking forward to funding, as he requires more capital to improve his business. He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is a thirty-five-year-old, hardworking, married man with four children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a bar/shop as his main source of income and also runs a butchery to earn more income. He started this business to look after his family. 

Damazo has personal goals of educating his children and becoming a prominent businessman. His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. He intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell. He has hopes of having a wholesale depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Lenathe

texts.en:
Lenathe, 31, is married with three children ranging in age from one to nine. Two of them go to school.

For the past five years Lenathe has been farming. She is applying for a 1,281,389 RWF loan through UOB to buy fertilizer for her rice fields. She plans to use her profits to increase her fields’ future production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans as of 2009. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Aregnazan

texts.en: Aregnazan lives in Berdik village of Ararat region. She is an experienced farmer. Her family consists of her three sons. All the family works hard to earn a living. Aregnazan is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding sheep and pigs, and in cultivation of corn, potatoes, grass, cherries, plums, apples, pears, and walnuts. Her eldest son sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Aregnazan needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and forage for feeding the livestock. Aregnazan and her sons rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Narciza Del Rocio

texts.es: Narciza es una señora separada de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de zapatos desde hace 12 años, Narciza vive con una hija y una nieta en una casita por la que paga arriendo, ella comenta que le va bien en su negocio ya que ella es muy amable con sus clientes, ella saca su mercadería a las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas de donde ella vive, comenta que  trae su mercadería desde partes muy lejanas donde puede comprar más barato y que así  le quede algo de ganancia, Narciza va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cosméticos y zapatos para mejorar su negocio e incrementarlo, de este negocio aspira obtener una buena rentabilidad y de ser posible algún momento comprar una casita y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y nieta.
texts.en: Narciza is separated from her husband. She has sold cosmetics and shoes for 12 years. She lives with a daughter and granddaughter in a small home which she rents. She says that her business is going well since she is very kind to her customers. She brings her merchandise to the markets in the cities nearest to her home. She says that she brings her merchandise from very far away where she can buy it more cheaply and make a profit. Narciza will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics and shoes to improve her business and expand it. She hopes to get good profitability and to one day buy a little home and improve her daughter's and granddaughter's lives.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Muhammad Qadir

texts.en:
M. Qadir is 53 years old and has been running a general store for the past 36 years in Karachi. He has a good name in his community. Given his experience and hard work, he has carried out his business well. He has a good customer base. His customers are content and satisfied with his services. His sales have grown over the years and made it possible for him to cover his expenses well. 

He wants more growth in his business. Therefore, he is planning to buy different varieties of materials for his general store. He hopes that with the additional stock, his sales will increase, and he will be able to earn more. For this reason, he has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy additional items for his general store.

loans.name: Grupo Pajoca 3 Group

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 26 años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y decidida por poder superar en la vida, ella no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino ella alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, ella tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (Ella se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una blusa de color azul).
	
Ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde ella vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 18 años, ella realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para ella es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que ella cuenta.

Ella es un buen ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, una de las grandes aspiraciones de ella es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 26 years old. She is an enterprising woman and is determined to overcome in life. She does not stop winning due to the obstacles life puts in her way, but rather she reaches all of her goals and dreams. She has three children to support. The first already works in order to help with the family's economic resources, and the last two are excellent students at the community school. (She is the 1st from left to right and is the one wearing a blue blouse.)

She obtains her income through banana plant production in the community where she lives. Her parents taught her this work 18 years ago. She sells her produce in the market and in the areas surrounding her community, and in this way she has an income to improve her family's living conditions.

She will use the loan to maintain banana plants, since it is very important for her that her banana plants produce top-quality fruit so as not to lose the customers she counts on.

She is a good example in her community and that is why a group of women have decided to undertake the business with her and thus improve their family's living conditions. One of her great aspirations is to plant more banana plants and watch her children grow educationally and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to maintain banana plants

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 10 años se desempeña como maestra de educación básica en una escuela de su localidad aportando sus conocimientos a los niños de su comunidad por medio de su trabajo. Zoila desea realizar varias reparaciones en su vivienda ya que esta necesita repello de paredes colocación de puertas y ventanas ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía no cuenta con ellos por lo que solicita a FUSIA un crédito para comprar: puertas, balcones, cemento y arena para repellar las paredes y colocar las puertas y ventanas en su vivienda.
texts.en: Zoila, 42 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and her 9-year-old daughter. She is a tenacious woman who has been a primary school teacher at a school in her town for 10 years, bringing her knowledge to the children of her community through her work. Zoila wants to make several repairs to her house, since the walls need plastering and the doors and windows need to be put in. As can be seen in the photograph, it does not have them, so she is asking FUSIA for a loan to buy doors, balconies, cement, and sand to stucco the walls and put door and windows in her house.

loans.use: to buy doors, balconies, cement, and sand to plaster the walls and put the doors and windows in her house

loans.name: Bernardine

texts.en:
Bernardine is 55 years old, and she is married with two children.  They have completed their studies. She has been farming for 31 years. She will use Kiva`s loan to buy fertilizers during rice production.  The profits from her farming will be used to buy machines such as tractor for better production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and glass to make furniture for his customers, looking to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee seeds, sacks for packaging his products, compost, and pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Maria es casada y tiene en total 7 hijos,  niñas de 7 y 10 años y los niños de 3, 9, 13, 14 y 17 años mismos de los cuales 6 están estudiando y también le ayudan a trabajar a su madre en lo que puedan, María vive en el campo y comenta que se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, su esposo trabaja de albañil pero tiene una enfermedad en los huesos por lo que en su trabajo  rinde solo lo que le es posible y así mismo le pagan poco, el crédito va a invertir comprando cuyes para criarlos y comercializarlos para tener algo de dinero para alimentación y educación a sus hijos, lo que María aspira  es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: At 33 years old, María is married and has 7 children in total, girls aged 7 and 10 years and boys aged 3, 9, 13, 14, and 17. Of them, 6 are in school and also help their mother to work as much as they can. María lives in the country and says that she works as a day laborer and raises small animals. Her husband works as a construction worker, but he has a bone disease, so in his work he only does what is possible for him and so they pay him little. She is going to use the loan to buy guinea pigs to raise and sell in order to have some money for food and education for her children. What María aspires to is improving her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 8. Two of them go to school. Clementine has been selling items such as soup, candles, rice, and sugar. With this loan, she would like to buy more soup, sugar, and candles for resale. The profits from her business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more soup, sugar, and candles for resale.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester de 74 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 40 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, además elabora atoles y tamales, lo que le ha permitido tener un ingreso extra en la economía de su hogar. Ester desea comprar tela metálica para reparar la granja y el corredor de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, tela metálica, madera y clavos para reparar la granja y el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ester is 74 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She is an enterprising woman, who, for 40 years, has earned her living raising and selling chickens. She also makes atole ( corn-based drink) and tamales which provides her with a little extra income. 

Now she wishes to buy wire mesh to repair the chicken run and the corridor of her house so she has approached FUSAI for a loan to buy corrugated sheets, wire mesh, wood and nails.

loans.use: Buy corrugated sheets, wire mesh, wood and nails to repair her chicken run and corridor of her house.

loans.name: Vilma Nelly

texts.es: Vilma de 44 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que demuestra su actitud emprendedora  por medio de su trabajo dedicándose desde hace 7 años a la venta de antojitos típicos tales como: empanadas, yuca frita, pasteles de carne, etc. actividad que realiza frente a su vivienda. Vilma desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de teja y lamina deteriorada por lo que necesita hacer el cambio lo antes posible.
texts.en: Vilma, 44 years old, lives with her life partner and her 4 children aged 11, 16, 18, and 20. She is a woman who demonstrates her enterprising attitude through her work, having sold typical snacks such as empanadas, fried yucca, meat pies, etc. for 7 years. She does this work in front of her house. Vilma wants to replace the roof of her house. Therefore, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of her house, since as can be seen in the photograph it is currently made of tile and deteriorated sheet metal, so she needs to replace it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero desde hace 2 años, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. Juan desea instalar energía eléctrica  en su vivienda motivo por el cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, interruptores y una caja térmica, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 19 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and his 1-year-old son. He is a young worker who has made a living as a day laborer for 2 years, a profession which allows him to cover the daily costs of his family.

Juan wants to install electrical energy in his home, and for this reason he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box, and to pay the labor costs for installing electrical energy in his home.

loans.use: to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box, and to pay the labor costs of installing electrical energy in his home.

loans.name: Cansilde

texts.en:
Cansilde is 51 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 9, all of whom go to school. Cansilde has been farming for 21 years. She will use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for rice. With the profits from her farming, she would like to buy a tractor for improving her business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
Fortune is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. Fortune has been farming for seven years. She will use her loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers for rice production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Johanna  Marisol

texts.es: Johanna de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hermano de 30 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Johanna desea comprar láminas galvanizadas para cambiar las paredes de su vivienda que como se observa en la fotografía es de dicho material, pero se encuentra deteriorada por lo solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar las láminas de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Johanna, 28, lives in her own house with her parents and brother, 30.  She's an enterprising woman who earns a living providing housekeeping services in homes.

Johanna wants to buy galvanized metal sheets to change the walls of her house.  As seen in the photograph, the house is made of that material, but it's worn.

She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the metal walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester de 51 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 21 años de edad. Ella es conocida como una mujer luchadora que todos los días presta sus servicios domésticos para apoyar económicamente a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar. Ester desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda aprovechando un proyecto comunal por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: alambre, interruptores y caja térmica para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ester is 51 years old and lives with her partner and her 21-year-old daughter. She is known as a hard-working woman who lends her domestic services daily in order to help her partner economically with the household expenses.

Ester wants to install electrical energy in her home, taking advantage of a communal project, and for this reason she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box for this installation.

loans.use: to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box for the installation of electrical energy in her home.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús de 55 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su yerno y su hija de 21 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 30 años se gana la vida como vendedora de verduras de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal, actividad que le permite aportar a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Jesús desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda razón por la cual solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, interruptores y caja térmica para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesús is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her son-in-law and her 21-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who has earned a living for the last 30 years selling vegetables in the local market, a profession which allows her to contribute to the family income through her job.

Jesús wants to install electrical energy in her home, and for this reason she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box for this installation.

loans.use: to invest in wires, switches and a thermal box for the installation of electrical energy in her home.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca  de 38 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 17 y 16 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Rebeca desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: alambre, interruptores y una caja térmica, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
38-year old Rebecca lives with her husband and two daughters aged 17 and  16 in her own house. She is a determined woman who earns her living as a servant.

Now she wishes to install electricity in her home so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy wire, interrupters, an electric box, and pay for someone to install it.

loans.use: .buy wire, interrupters, an electric box, and pay for electricity installation in her home

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace 8 meses trabaja en un Fundo Agrícola y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y labora con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá remodelar el cuarto que sus padres le cedieron, como pintarrajear las paredes y comprarse una cama. De esta manera sentirá mayor comodidad, mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para sacar adelante a su familia y pueda estudiar en poco tiempo una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old, is single, and lives in Ica with his family. He is the type of person who wishes to progress in life, and for the last 8 months has worked in an Agricultural Foundation. It is going very well for him because he consistently reinforces his skills in everything that he is doing, and works with a high level of effort and dedication. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have given him, he will be able to remodel the room his parents gave him by painting the walls and buying a bed. Through this he will be able to live more comfortably, improve his quality of life, continue fighting for progress for his family, and one day, be able to study in university for a career.

loans.use: Pintarrajear su cuarto y comprarse una cama

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 24 years old. He is married and has two children, ages 2 and 3. They do not yet go to school. He has been farming for three years. He will use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 34, is married with three children aged between five and nine years old; all of them go to school. She has been farming for seven years.

Rachel is applying for a 1,286,535 RWF loan through UOB to buy fertilizer to increase her rice fields’ yield. She plans to save her profits so that she can buy tractors and other farm machinery in the future.

As of 2009 the agriculture sector has accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plastic tank, tubes, sand, cement, gravel, and labor to place a plastic water collection tank in her house

loans.name: Cinthia Vanessa

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su pequeño hijo en el distrito de Morropón, vive en una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, la cual está ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, en la región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Cinthia brinda el servicio diario de la venta de refrescos y comidas al paso fuera de la posta médica de Morropon, y adional a ello también ofrece el servicio de lavado de ropa ya sea a sus vecinos o gente que viene de otros lugares por fiestas, ella tiene buen comportamiento de pago, se propopne atenderla ya que se le a visto que ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida poco a poco. Citnhia solicita el crédito para arreglar una habitación de su casa, para así tener mayor seguridad y comodidad en la misma mejorando de esta manera, su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 26 years old and lives with her young son in the district of Morropón. The local people earn their living from agriculture, commerce, and animal raising. The community is located in the province of Morropón, in the region of Piura on Peru's north coast.

Every day Cinthia sells soft drinks and food on the steps outside Morropón's medical centre. She also does laundry for her neighbours or people who come to town for fairs. She has a good record of repayments, and lending her money is recommended as she is gradually improving her standard of living.

Cinthia is seeking a loan to make repairs to a room in her house so that it is safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: Make repairs to a room in her home so that it is safer and more comfortable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain the land where he feeds his livestock.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence, age 30, is married and has three children, between the ages of 3 and 10, two of whom go to school. Clemence has been selling beans for 12 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans for resale. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Pemzashen village in the Shirak region. She lives there with her husband, three children (all three of whom are attending a local school), and sister-in-law. To take care of her family, Hasmik is engaged in cattle breeding and cultivation of barley, potatoes, and garlic. Her husband and sister-in-law assist her greatly in her daily activities related to farming. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the family's main source of income.

To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hasmik needs a loan of US $2,500 to pay for an ox and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will help her run her agribusiness in a productive way. Hasmik and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the requested loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for an ox and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 26 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 2 years. Jeannette has been selling food stuffs for the past three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more food stuffs such as sorghum and millet for resale. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food such as sorghum and millet for resale.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is aged 50 years. She is married and has four children, aged between 5 and 17. All of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina is a farmer from the village of Hovtashen, in the region of Shirak. Alina lives alone and is engaged in cattle breeding, pig breeding, and the cultivation of wheat and grass. She realizes the sale of the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. She currently needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase barley seeds, forage, and some piglets. She relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount, to enable her to maintain and develop her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, forage, and some piglets.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera lives in the village of Tufashen. She is a widow, and together with her two sons works hard to sustain a living.

To be able to meet the needs of her family, Vera is engaged in a variety of endeavors: raising and breeding cattle, sheep and poultry, and cultivating wheat, barley, potatoes and garlic. With the help of her elder son she sells her products in the local market, taking it there in their own truck. The results of these efforts are the main source of the family's income.

In order to meet the growing needs of her family, Vera wants to expand her farm a little bit. She needs a loan of 3000 USD to pay for feed for the livestock and tires for their truck. Vera and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support when her needed loan is funded.

loans.use: to pay for feed for the livestock and tires for their truck.

loans.name: Pranati

texts.en:
Pranati lives in Dhupguri, located in the Jalpaiguri district in West Bengal. This area is known for its agriculture, especially its paddy rice farming, as the climate and soil there are very much suitable for paddy cultivation.

She is a 38-year-old rural housewife who is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). As Pranati and her husband are illiterate and can sign only their names, they are determined to provide a higher education to their children.  Their education is Pranati's first priority.  One of their children is in grade 10 and the other is in college.

Pranati's husband is a land cultivator.  He has worked in agriculture since he was small. He mainly grows paddy, a crop in high demand in the region. He wakes up very early to go to the fields near his house to work. He sells his produce at his locality. But, his income is so scant that it is hardly possible for him to cover the expenses of his family along with his children's educational expenses. He lacks the capital to expand his business.

Pranati has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) because her husband is a farmer and needs to expand his business. She plans to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her husband.  In this way, he can offer quality products to his customers at harvest time. He emphasizes that his goal is to increase his income through his farming activities so that he can develop his business, succeed as a person, and have a decent life and better economic situation for himself and his family.

Pranati dreams of acquiring land with the profit generated.

Pranati thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies related to cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Magrate, 51 years of age, is a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kapsowar. It is a remote town, with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married, and together with her husband has four lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in, to make ends meet. Magrate is a tough woman with tough skin, and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Kapsowar area has conditions that favor dairy farming, and Magrate has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow, but a lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a breed that produces between 10-20 litres of milk a day. With this cow she will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Kapsowar area is so high, but the supply is low. So, through this loan Magrate is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Magrate to provide a secure future for her school-going children, by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. His vision is to keep even more dairy cows, so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose, 56, is married and has four children aged between ten and 25 years. All of them go to school. For the past fourteen years she has been a farmer.

Speciose is applying for a 1,312,266 RWF loan through UOB to cover labor costs and fertilizer for her rice fields. This should result in an increase in yield. Speciose wants to save her profits for the future when she will be able to buy farm machinery and tractors to further increase her fields’ productivity.

As of 2009 the agriculture sector has accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to cover labor costs and fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 34 years old. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 1 and 18, three of whom go to school. Clemence has been selling food stuffs for eight years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum, and rice for resale. The profits from her business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Emelance

texts.en:
Emelence is 28 years old. She is married with three children, aged between 7 months and 4 years. One child goes to school.

She has been selling from a restaurant for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment for using in the restaurant and food such as beans and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for using in the restaurant and food such as beans and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Rasana

texts.en:
Rasana hails from Dhupgur. She is a very active young lady, 20 years of age. She lives with her husband, one son and one daughter. She has a primary education but her parents could not provide her with further education due to the lack of money.  Her husband Mafizul, age 27 with an education until eighth standard, is a farmer by profession. They live in a small village named Kholaigram in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband has a vegetable cultivation farm on his own land. Rasana and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger, onions, etc. on the farm. They sell the products to the traders from the nearest town who come to take the vegetables from her farm. Now they have decided to cultivate paddy to increase their income, as paddy is very profitable and in demand in West Bengal.

Rasana wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs such as paddy seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Rasana dreams of constructing a concrete and mortar-made house. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other necessary things to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Salka

texts.en:
In a village called Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri, Salka lives with her husband and three daughters.  She is 33 years old and an illiterate woman, but knows how to sign her name. The area where she lives is known for its agriculture since most of the inhabitants are involved in vegetable and paddy farming. Salaka's daughters are students in different standards in secondary school.

Her husband, 38-year-old Khokan, works in agriculture. He has ancestral land where he grows vegetables like eggplant, beans and different types of gourds such as bottle gourd, bitter gourd and ribbed gourd. He is a very diligent and honest man who supplies good quality vegetables at reasonable prices to his customers. So his customers like him.  Salka also helps her husband in his agricultural activities. To meet the growing demands of his customers and at the same time, make a better earning for his family, he wants to cultivate more ribbed gourds.  The vegetable is in good demand as it is cheap. So he needs financial support.

To help her husband continue working, Salka has asked for a loan from BJS.  She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate ribbed gourds. Her dream is to improve the family's finances and to secure her children's career with the profit generated from this business, which she hopes will be fulfilled through this loan.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs for ribbed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in the village of Qarahunj with her two sons. Her second son is an army officer and will have a pension. To sustain her family's living, for eight years Marine has been running a farm upon which she keeps eight cows and four calves. The requested loan of USD 3000 will enable her to purchase a calf and forage for the livestock. Marine and her family members will highly appreciate lenders' support.

Marine took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to an ultra poor family. Her husband owns a small costume jewelry workshop, the only source of income for his family. He manufactures varieties of costume jewelry, including bangles, necklaces, earrings, and rings in the shop. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase metal wire coils for making rings, bangles and necklaces. 

Nasreen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy metal wire coils for making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Dios Es La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Yeny is the group coordinator for Dios es la Esperanza (God is the Hope) 2 Group. This group is located in the city of El Seibo. Her home is a compound for her three children. She is taking care of them together with her long-term partner. The other members run different businesses, selling miscellaneous products such as clothes and food.

This is Yeny's 13th loan. She runs a food stall from her home. She sells fruits (oranges, bananas, papayas), vegetables, meat and charcoal. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to attract more customers and sell more products. 

Yeny says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to have a successful business. She started the business with her first Esperanza loan almost seven years ago, and she has reinvested and increased her sales over time. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, meat and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods like rice, beans, meats, and cooking pots and pans

loans.name: Elizaphan

texts.en:
Elizaphan, 55, is a smallholder farmer in a village near Chuka, which is a market centre in the Central Province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and they have three children. His primary income sources are milk, tea, other crops, and other personal businesses. Elizaphan has 20 years of experience in mixed farming.
 
Elizaphan is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He has aspirations to expand his dairy farm. However, he lacks the finances needed to do so. This is because the milk price in Chuka is very low. The only way to achieve this is through loans

Small dairy farmers in Kenya work dawn to dark to produce high-quality milk at roughly the same price they received a decade ago, while the cost of feed, fuel and most other foods have steadily increased. These rural farmers are facing growing pressure to keep their farms running.

With your loan, Elizaphan will be able to purchase a high quality cow. Typical hybrid cows in this region produce from 10 litres to 15 litres of milk, while taking the same amount of money to feed and treat as the less productive traditional breeds.

The increase in milk volume will earn Elizaphan more income to cope with the hard times. He is very dedicated to paying his children’s education and your loan will be of great benefit towards this goal.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne, 35, is married and has two children yet to be school-aged. For the past seven years she has been a farmer.

Jeanne is applying for a 1,266,809 RWF loan through UOB to buy fertilizer in order to increase her rice fields’ yield. She plans to save her profits so that she can buy tractors and other farm machinery in the future.

As of 2009 the agriculture sector has accounted for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generated 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employed approximately 90% of Rwandans Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique, age 36, is married with five children between 1 and 15 years old. Three of the children go to school. She has been farming for 11 years. She will use the Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is an experienced agronomist from the village of Hovq. She lives with her husband, 12-year-old daughter and 2-year-old son. To take care of her family, Valentina is engaged in farming. She breeds cattle and cultivates vegetables and fruits. With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As the family’s needs are increasing with time, Valentina is thinking of expanding her agribusiness to be able to make ends meet. To reach that goal Valentina needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of $1,500 USD to pay for a calf, and forage for feeding the livestock. Valentina and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 50 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 24 and 27. They have completed their studies. 

She has been selling foodstuff for the past 7 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and millet for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and millet for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco, 30 years old, is married with three children between 2 and 8 years old. All of his children go to school. He has been selling clothes and shoes for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en:
Ezira is a 52-year-old, hard-working, married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in agriculture and he grows bananas as his main source of income, although he also earns a monthly salary from being a head teacher. He started this business to have a better standard of living after realizing that the delayed salary payment would not allow him to meet his family's basic needs on time. He faces a challenge of pests and diseases, though he has a vision of practicing commercial farming. 

Ezira is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: floor brick, cement, sand and gravel to lay brick floor in Ana's home.

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group. 
She deals in selling human medicine and farming. She lives in Fort Portal-Uganda. 

She faces the challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to expand her business. In spite of this, she dreams of having a stable family income.

Doreen needs a loan to buy drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in her drug store.

loans.name: Zochilt Guadalupe

texts.es:
Zochilt tiene 30 años de edad, logró culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a manejar una moto-taxi en el municipio donde ellos residen, como fruto de su matrimonio han procreado 3 hijos los cuales dos están estudiando y el otro pasa con ella en casa ya que está muy pequeño para ir a la escuela.

Los oficios domésticos, es la actividad a la cual Zochilt se dedica Y alrededor de 6 meses inicio con una pequeña tienda, fue para eso que el crédito anterior fue solicitado porque en el lugar donde ella vive no hay tiendas cercanas y fue así como tomó la iniciativa ya que la dueña del moto-taxi que maneja su esposo, la motivó para que abriera la tienda, Zochilt ha visto que el negocio es bueno ya que en la colonia donde ella vive no hay tiendas cercanas, y por lo tanto ahora está facilitando a las demás personas que puedan comprar en un lugar cercano, y además ella obtiene ingresos económicos para su familia. Solo ella se dedica a esta actividad pues nadie más de su familia se involucra.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una computadora a su hija, ya que va viendo que el negocio le va dando ganancias y su hija ya no tendrá que salir a buscar un cyber, mas hoy en día no es muy confiable que los niños anden de noche o por las tardes haciendo tareas,  así lo hará en la casa y ella le ayudara mucho porque la hija se les va a llenar de conocimientos sanos, ya que ellos estarán muy atentos de lo que ella haga.

El sueño de Zochilt es seguir con su negocio pues desde muy pequeña le ha gustado esta actividad y confía en la oportunidad que le brindan los préstamos, además desea superarse y sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa para que juntos puedan darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar y que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Zochilt is 30 years old. She succeeded in completing high school, and she is currently married. Her husband makes a living driving a motorcycle taxi in the municipality where they live. They have three children, two of whom are attending school. The other child stays at home with her because he is too young to go to school.              

Zochilt is a homemaker. Where she lives, the stores are far away. For this reason, and encouraged by the woman who owns the motorcycle taxi that her husband drives, Zochilt took the initiative to take out a loan to open a small store about six months ago. She has noticed that the business is good. Since there are no other stores nearby in her neighborhood, she is making it easier for people to do their shopping closer to home. Moreover, she is earning income for her family. She is the only one running the business. No one else in her family is involved.

The business is generating profits; therefore, the loan she is requesting is to buy a computer for her daughter so that she will no longer have to go out looking for a cybercafe. It is not safe, especially nowadays, for children to go out in the evenings or at nights to do their homework. In this way, her daughter will do hers at home, and she will help her a lot. The daughter will be able to fill her mind with wholesome information since they will be extra vigilant about her online activities.

Zochilt’s dream is to continue with her business because she has enjoyed this occupation since she was very young. She relies on the opportunities that the loans give her. Moreover, she wants to better herself, get her family ahead, and help her husband with the home expenses so that together they are able to give their children the opportunity to study and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Ramatu. She is married and has three children, who are 25, 17, and 13 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sales assistant.  

In 1996, Ramatu established her plastics sales business. Specifically, she sells goods such as plastic/rubber bowls, buckets, and spoons. She began her business because she wanted to help take care of her home and family. By working seven days per week and 10 hours per day, she is able to earn approximately 900,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from her business. She explains that she is very hardworking.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ramatu would like this loan in order to buy more rubber, buckets, and spoons in a very large quantity for resale purposes. In the future, Ramatu plans to build a house and to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g., rubber, buckets, and spoons) in bulk for resale purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase music production equipment.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a forty-nine-year-old, hardworking, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes as her main source of income.
