The main Gladys ventured into this business was to supplement her husband's income, which was not enough for their family. Though she faces the challenges of competition and seasonal markets for her clothes, she has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique and educating her child.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kabata Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Wilson is a member of Kabata Kweterana, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Wilson sells produce, mainly maize and beans. In his business he usually complains of price fluctuations, even though he has hopes of building a permanent house for his family.

Wilson needs a loan to buy stock of maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en: Zhanna is a farmer from Arshaluys village, in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and three school-age children (two daughters, 19 and 18 years old, and a 12-year-old son). Zhanna's husband works in the private sector, providing transportation services. He is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the family's needs. To help her husband earn a living for the family, Zhanna is engaged in cultivation of flowers (Gladiolus), potatoes, cucumbers, and tomatoes. With the help of her husband she sells her products in the local market, the main source of family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Zhanna needs to make some investments. Therefore, she has requested a loan of USD 3000. She will use the loan funds to purchase pumps for the greenhouse, cucumber seeds, and pesticides. Zhanna and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in this matter.

loans.use: to purchase pumps for the greenhouse, cucumber seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Carlos Sigfredo

texts.es:
Carlos es un señor de 55 años, vive separado hace mucho tiempo, actualmente vive junto a un hijo mayor en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país, con un clima agradable y con un sector muy productivo en ganadería y agricultura.
Carlos es un señor muy sencillo y humilde, un hombre trabajador, desde hace más de 10 años él se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de frutas del sector, recorre todos los días en una pequeña camioneta que un cuñado le cedió al ver en él el esfuerzo y amor que le pone a su negocio.
Un señor que ha superado varios obstáculos en su vida, el más fuerte comenta es haberse separado de su esposa, recién se está recuperando de aquella separación, pero por un lado le consuela tener a un hijo que le apoye y comparta con él.
Carlos con el crédito de Fundación Alternativa y de Kiva va a comprar plátano, naranjas y mandarinas para incrementar sus ventas y seguir recorriendo con su negocio. Desea crecer mucho más para en un futuro también poder ayudar a alguien más con su trabajo.
Se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55 years old and hase been separated for a long time. Currently, he lives with the oldest son in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is a city characterized as the bridge connecting the different regions of the country. It has an agreeable climate and produces livestock and agriculture. 

Carlos is a simple, humble, hardworking man who has bought and sold fruits for more than 10 years. He travels his sales route everyday in a small truck that his brother-in-law gave him after seeing the effort and love her puts into his business. He has overcome many obstacles in his life, the largest of which was his separation from his wife. Currently, he is recovering from it and his consolation is that he has a son who supports and shares with him. Carlos is going to buy plantains, oranges, and clementines with the loan from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva in order to increase his sales and continue moving forward with his business. He hopes it grows a lot more so he will be able to help someone else with his work. He feels very happy for the support that has been brought to him.

loans.use: to buy fruit to stock his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Tejedoras Group

texts.en:
Eight women from the town of Santa Catarina Palopó, which is located on the shores of Lake Atitlan and is a popular tourist destination in the Highlands of Guatemala, began their first micro-loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Their new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group is called “Mujeres Tejedoras,” meaning “Weaving Women,” because of the beautiful and exquisitely woven huipiles (blouses) they make and wear with great pride. Each of the women in “Mujeres Tejedoras” has a small business that makes or sells textiles.

Catarina, who is 18 years old, married to a boat driver, and has a child, is the Trust Bank secretary. Because her parents felt Catarina’s main role was to be a wife and mother, she was only allowed to go to school through the 4th grade. Although she only had a 4th grade education, Catarina overcame the lack of respect given women without an education and began a small handicrafts and commercial textile business. She buys from three local community women and then resells the products - including huipiles, fajas (belts), purses, bracelets, and other handicrafts - in different markets. There is a great deal of demand for Catarina’s products. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a larger variety of products to offer to her customers.

Catarina is eager to learn about the subjects the Friendship Bridge Officer provides that are called “Microcredit Plus.”  At the monthly Trust Bank meeting, educational topics include a variety of subjects like health, hygiene, and nutrition, as well as self-esteem and violence against women. Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education yields very positive results.

The “Mujeres Tejedoras” are very grateful for the Kiva lenders’ support, which helps them become empowered women.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of textile products

loans.name: Julyano

texts.en:
Julyano worked with granite in Brazil. When he moved to the United States with his wife and son, he used this experience to provide for his family. He started Granite Countertop Pro three years ago. 

“I had the experience and the drive, and I believe I can offer one of the best services in the region.” 

Julyano needs to purchase a router polish granite machine. However, Julyano has found it impossible to get a loan from a bank because his credit history is new. With this loan, he will be able to purchase the equipment he needs to improve his services and grow his business. He will also begin building his credit so that he will be able to increase his access to capital. 

He hopes to one day receive a Bachelors degree in business administration.

loans.use: to purchase a router polish granite machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Y Hombres Avanzando 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of the group "Mujeres y Hombres Avanzando (Women and Men Going Forward) 2, 3, 4 & 5." Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Rosa makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been establishing a successful business. Rosa is also raising her children alone. This is the reason why she is accessing loans in this group from Esperanza.

This is Rosa's fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully grown her business and repaid her previous loan. She has been running her business for around five years. From the beginning, she started with the savings she had. Rosa will use this loan to increase her inventory by buying more shoes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to provide her children with all that they need. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years now, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially her children's needs. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. Petra now also operates her own food stall business, just adjacent to her house and store.

To improve her profits, Petra would like to apply for a new loan. She will use it to buy products in larger quantities, including meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. With PHP 14,000, she could purchase more quantities of raw materials needed in her food stall, and she could purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her variety store. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation, in advance, for this assistance.

In the future, Petra aspires to improve her business and expand soon. She desires to provide the best education for her children. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona trabajadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha siempre para poder ofrecerles un futuro mejor. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a sus padres a quienes ayudaba en las chacras tiene amplios conocimientos en este rubro, se dedica principalmente al cultivo de maíz y hoy ofrece productos de excelente calidad a sus clientes y le va muy bien.
Carlos en estos momentos necesita cubrir algunos costos de riego, echar abono orgánico a las plantas , control fitosanitario y pago a los jornales, es por ello que está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá realizar todos los pagos necesarios para obtener una buena producción en la etapa de cosecha. De esta manera sus ingresos incrementarán y en poco tiempo podrá cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Comprarse una casa"
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working person who is 38 years old, single, and lives in Nazca along with his family.
He has 3 children who are in school. They are his pride and joy and he fights for them always to be able to offer them a better future. He has worked in agriculture for several years. Thanks to his parents, who he helped on their farm, he has wide knowledge in this area. He principally works growing corn and now offers products of excellent quality. This is going very well for him.

At the moment Carlos needs to cover some irrigation costs, use organic manure on the plants, carry out plant health measure, and pay the wages. For this he is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him he will be able to carry out all the necessary payments to obtain a good production in the harvest season. In this way his earnings will increase and in little time he will be able to achieve one of his biggest dreams - buy himself a house.

loans.use: to buy organic supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, such as rice and bananas, to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Tikal Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge “Tikal” group is located in a rural area near Chichicastenango, in the Highlands of Guatemala. Chichicastenango is known for its cultural traditions, as well as its beautiful and colorful clothing. The eight ladies of “Tikal” have concluded their first loan cycle thanks to the support of Kiva lenders. Due to this support, the ladies were able to expand and/or maintain their small businesses.

Tomasa, a 39 year-old widow, was our featured client in the previous loan cycle. With her loan, she was able to buy 20 more chickens, two pigs, and feed for all of the animals she raises. Tomasa is very grateful for Kiva lenders’ support, because it enabled her to create more income for her family’s well-being.

The ladies of “Tikal” are applying for a new loan cycle they hope can be funded by Kiva lenders. In this loan cycle, we want to introduce Maria, the new Trust Bank treasurer.  She is 53-years-old, married to a field worker, and has four children whose ages are between 17 and 11. Three of them are currently in school.  

Like many of the women in rural Guatemala, Maria is a weaver. She also raises chickens and goats. Her business is doing very well, but she needs more financial capital in order to keep expanding. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of good quality silk and wool thread. She also plans to buy feed for her animals.

In addition to the loan, Maria is looking forward to the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” training where she can learn about topics related to good health practices for both her and her family, along with the topics of hygiene, self-esteem, leadership, and empowerment.  Friendship Bridge has found these “Microcredit Plus” programs are motivational, providing a very supportive environment where the ladies can discuss issues freely, which increases their self-esteem.

The ladies of the Friendship Bridge “Tikal” group are extremely grateful for the support they have had from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of good quality silk and wool thread for her textile business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a resident of Intramuros, Manila. At the age of 53, she manages her own household while operating her business with the help of her husband. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Josephine owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Josephine gets her products from a wholesaler at a low price, and then she sells it by the piece for a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Josephine is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store. Josephine hopes to improve her business and her family's general living conditions. She also desires to give the best education for her child. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and has been married for the last 27 years. She has been selling clothes for more than 20 years. She started selling in flea markets and now she sells both in flea markets and in her store. She has two sons, who no longer depend on her. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more products and increase her sales. She describes herself as creditworthy and says that her biggest achievement has been being able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy hosiery and corsetry for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment for the lawns he services

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. At the age of 34, she manages her own household while operating her business with the help of her husband. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Joanna is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and resells them by the container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. She also earns additional income by selling peanuts. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Joanna is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of mineral water to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Joanna hopes that her business will continue to operate and prosper. She wants her children to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of mineral water to increase her product inventory

loans.name: Unidos Para Progresar 2 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the group coordinator for Unidos Para Progresar 2. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for herself, her husband, and their two children. She lives with her husband in their simple rural home.

Altagracia has successfully completed eight years of loans with Esperanza, and this is her 16th loan. She sells cacao, to people who produce chocolate and other products. She would like to continue expanding her business, by increasing her inventory. This would enable her to satisfy more customers and sell a larger quantity. She will use this loan to grow more cacao trees and to purchase cacao, dry and process it. She will sell it to customers that need this product.

Altagracia says she enjoys doing business, and her most important dream is to produce enough income to provide for all of her family's needs and to buy some land to grow more cacao trees. She has been saving her profits since she started her business, with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to grow cacao trees and to buy cacao for processing

loans.name: Gullanpugro  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Gullanpugro está formado por 7 mujeres y 1 hombre, se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura ya que les gusta el trabajo del campo. Viven por el cantón de Nabon lugar que tiene un clima muy frió, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es típica al igual que las vestimentas de su población las mismas que la lucen muy orgullosas de aun mantener viva su cultura. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Luisa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, dos de ellos ya están casados y viven independientes, uno trabaja y estudia en el colegio, dos solo están estudiando en el colegio y tres de ellos están en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Luisa se dedica a las tareas del campo, actividad que aprendió de sus padres como es la crianza de animales, tiene borregos, ganado, pollos, cuyes y cerdos, siembra hortalizas las que vende en otra parroquia, también se dedica a la siembra y venta de plantas forestales. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono. Su meta es de continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Gullanpugro is made up of 7 women and 1 man, who mainly work rearing animals and in agriculture, as they like working in the countryside. They live in the Nabon district, a place with a very cold climate and various places to enjoy nature. Their gastronomy is typical, as is the dress they wear, proud to keep their culture alive. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Luisa,who is 42 years old, and married with 8 children. Two of these are already married and living independently, one works and studies in school, two are only studying in school and three are in a local primary school. Her husband works in agriculture and they own the house they live in.

Doña Luisa works in the countryside, doing things she learned from her parents such as rearing animals (she has sheep, cattle, chicken, guinea pigs and pigs) and growing vegetables which she sells in another parish. She also works growing and selling forest plants. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of seeds and manure. Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Yani

texts.en: Yani, her husband, and their only child live in Garut, a city located 75 km southeast from Bandung. To support their family, Yani and her husband manage a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and remote utility bill payment services. Yani joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Melier

texts.en:
This is Melier, 28, resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ken Ric and is a mother. She, along with her husband and children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Melier operates an ice cream business. She has her own ice cream cart which she and her husband are using to peddle their flavoured confection. They normally carry three flavours like local chocolate, purple yam and cheese.  They roam around their community ringing their bells. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials like milk, milk powder, sugar, cream, butter and other supplies which are needed in her business.

Melier dreams of improving her business as she hopes to give her children a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elizabeth has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elizabeth has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elizabeth is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her native basket weaving business. She has been a member of NWTF since 2001 and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.



With your help, Emma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 41 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Wilma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Wilma is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Wilma has been an NWTF borrower since 2002 and plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Wilma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juminten

texts.en: Juminten, her husband, and their two children live in Depok, a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. To support their family, Juminten and her husband manage a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and remote utility bill payment services. Juminten joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Munif

texts.en: Munif lives with his wife and their child in West Bandung, a regency area in West Java. Munif runs a small stall, where he sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. He joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, Munif can process about 75 transactions per day. He has seen improvements in his shop, as he's gotten support and assistance from Ruma's staff. Because the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and, consequently, support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: A loan of $625 helps Munifto process more mobile phone airtime sales during weekends

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Proposito 3 Group

texts.en:
Yanilsa is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas con Proposito (United Women with Purpose) 3. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a general store. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying sharing with her children and long-term partner.

Yanilsa is excited to be taking her twelfth loan with Esperanza. She is starting her business with this loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, shoes and accessories. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. She dreams of running a successful business.

She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products such as shoes, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a 46-year-old, married woman with six children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods and ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of frozen foods and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Maria Leda

texts.en:
Maria Leda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready to wear in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell for her business selling ready to wear.

Maria Leda has been in this business for two years. Maria Leda earns more income from direct selling Fullerlife products.

Maria Leda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Danaya est constitué de cinq femmes  tous mariées majoritairement et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de condiments, des habits, du jus, des céréales, des œufs et du lait. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariétou (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits à Badialan III. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 80 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako. La revente s’effectue à Badialan III au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariétou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en: This Danaya group consists of five women who are all married and mostly live in polygamous households.  They have an average age of 43 and 5 children.  They all live in Badialan III, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They met through savings groups in the neighborhood and their income-generating businesses. The group members operate businesses such as selling condiments, clothing, juice, cereal, eggs, and milk.  To increase their working capital, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan.  Ms. Marietou, the woman standing third from right to left in the photo, has a great reputation for selling clothing in Badialan III. She plans to use this loan to buy 80 pieces of pagne cloth. She buys her supplies in Bamako and resells in Badialan III for credit to a clientele of mostly women.  Ms. Marietou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA that will be used to meet the small needs of her children and the remaining amount will be invested in her businesses.  Ms. Marietou depends a lot on the Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goal of expandng her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 41-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marife has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
En Suchitepéquez existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente. Es la actividad que realiza Manuela casada de 28 años de edad que cuenta con dos hijos los cuales son buenos estudiantes en la comunidad.

Manuela mujer emprendedora que se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Manuela lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio y esa es la actividad principal que ella realiza.

La razón que le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo es para  ampliar su negocio de abarrotería con la compra de mercadería de abarrotería,  porque  la cantidad de clientes que le buscan requieren de todo tipo de productos para su consumo a diario.
 
Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y mejorar las condiciones de vidas de su familia en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
In Suchitepéquez there exist a variety of businesses where the people can choose where to purchase their daily necessities. But that which is important is not the quantity of consumables but rather the quality of service provided to the customer. This is the activity that Manuela performs. She is married, 28 years old, with two children who are good students in the community.

Manuela is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living, with her grocery store, serving the public with a high quality of service. Manuela has a special vocation because she is one of the most sought-after businesswomen in her business and that is the main activity that she performs.

The reason that they have motivated her to apply for a loan is to grow her grocery store business with the purchase of grocery store merchandise since the large quantity of customers who search for her require all types of products for their daily consumption.

One of her aspirations is to see her children grow and become professionals in life and to improve her family’s living condition in the not-very-far future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Diantoyerela  2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec ROKIA 2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of Diantoyerela 2 Group are married women with an average age of 31. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Kouen, in the commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Rokia, standing second from right to left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs,seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of farming of 2.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 150,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, seeds, and labor costs.

loans.name: Diantoyerela  3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le mais et l’arachide avec SITAN ADAMA 2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 250 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of Diantoyerela 3 Group are married women with an average age of 38. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Kouen, in the commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan; the previous loans were fully repaid. Sitan Adama, standing second from right to left in the photo, grows corn and groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and to pay for the labor costs of farming of 3.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 250,000 FCFA that will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs, seeds, and labor costs.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un señor de 29 años, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Juan es un señor sencillo y trabajador, junto al apoyo de su esposa han salido adelante, viven en una humilde y cálida casa construida en terreno de familiares.
Mientras su esposa cuida de sus pequeños por las tardes, Juan recorre en la ciudad vendiendo ropa interior, sale desde muy temprano y regresa por la tarde con la venta; incluso cundo no le va bien viaja a pueblos aledaños a vender.
Juan vino recomendado por un excelente cliente de Fundación Alternativa, ahora con este crédito el podrá comprar boxers, medias y camisetas, además un coche para poder trasladar su mercadería con más comodidad, con ello espera mejoren sus ventas y pueda seguir mejorando su casa.
Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por el crédito ya que con ello podrán mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a 29-year-old man. He lives with his wife and three children in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city on the coastal region with a pleasant climate. It is a very commercial city, and is considered a land port that unites the mountains and the coast. Juan is a simple and hard-working man. Along with the support of his wife he has succeeded. They live in a humble and warm home constructed on family members’ land.

While his wife takes care of the little ones in the afternoons, Juan goes all over the city selling underwear. He goes out very early and returns in the evening with the sales. Even when it does not go well for him, he travels to adjacent towns to sell.

Juan came recommended as an excellent client of Fundación Alternativa. Now, with this loan, he will be able to purchase boxers, socks, and t-shirts, as well as a car to be able to transport his merchandise more comfortably. With it, he hopes to improve his sales and be able to continue improving his home.

He is thankful to the Kiva institution for the loan since with it they will be able to improve their incomes and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a small car to be able to transport himself with the clothing items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, seasonings, etc., for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 19 years now.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like pork, chicken, seasonings, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an iron gate to install on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his work.

loans.name: Josel April

texts.en:
This is Josel April, 31, resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Dave, her business partner, and is a mother of two children. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Josel April operates a food house. She caters snacks and typical Filipino meriendas like cake, pasta, noodles, fruit shakes, burgers, made-to-order lumpia, salad and other similar delicacies. She also cooks and sells affordable meals and viands in their community. Her regular customers are their neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help her business continue, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.

Josel April dreams of having a food cart version of her business. She also desires to buy a house and lot for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed for her restaurant.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Felisa requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Felisa has been in this business for 39 years now.

Felisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Menihaha

texts.en:
Menihaha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Menihaha requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional materials and gears for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

loans.name: Jose Absalon

texts.es:
Alonso es un señor de 45 años, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa.
Alonso vive separado de su conyugue varios años, incluso sus hijos viven con su madre en otra ciudad, pero el hecho de no convivir juntos no se ha descuidado de sus hijos, Alonso siempre está apoyándolos.
Él se dedica a la venta de material eléctrico y de artículos de ferretería, recorre en recintos aledaños a la ciudad, además de este negocio cuando la temporada está buena vende mariscos, ya cuenta con clientela fija. Ofrece sus productos tres veces a la semana.
Alonso necesita un crédito para la compra de material como cables, bombas de agua y sopletes, pero por falta de capital no lo ha podido realizar; acudió a Fundación Alternativa y se le pudo ayudar. Alonso se siente enormemente agradecido con la institución y con Kiva por ayudarle a incrementar y mejorar su negocio. En un futuro sueña contar con su propio local.
texts.en:
Alonso is 45 years old, and lives with his parents in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city of the coastal region with an agreeable climate.  Santo Domingo is very much a business city, considered to be a terrestrial port linking the mountains and coast.  Alonso has lived apart from his partner for several years, and his children even live with their mother in another city.  However, the fact of not living together has not led him to neglect his children.  Alonso is always supporting them.

Alonso earns his living selling electrical and hardware items, going around  neighborhoods near the city.  Besides this business, when the season is right, he sells shellfish, since he has faithful customers.  He offers his products three times a week.  Alonso needs a loan to buy materials such as cables, water pumps and blow torches.   Because of lack of capital, he couldn't get these; he turned to Fundación Alternativa, and they could help him.  Alonso feels immensely grateful to the organization and to Kiva for helping him grow and improve his business.  He dreams of having his own place of business in future.

loans.use: to buy material such as cables, water pumps and blow torches

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 58 years old and married. Concordia works very hard to provide for them.

Concordia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Concordia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Concordia has taken a 9,800 Philippines Peso (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Concordia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Yomaira Paola

texts.es: Paola en madre soltera que vive con su hija de 4 años que se encuentra estudiando, Paola tiene 23 años,  trabaja vendiendo juguetes y zapatos en las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas, Paola vive con sus hija y su madre en una casas por la que pagan arriendo,   el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en zapatos y juguetes tener más variedad en los productos que ofrecen, lo que Paola aspira es seguir trabajando y si en algún momento reúne algo de dinero le gustaría hacerse tratar la enfermedad que tiene en su mejilla derecha.
texts.en:
Paola is a single mother who lives with her four-year-old daughter who can be found studying. Paola is 23 years old and works selling games and shoes in the fairs of the closest cities. 

Paola lives with her daughter and her mother in a house for which they pay rent. She will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise of shoes and games to have more variety in the products offered. 

Paola aspires to continue working and, if she ever gathers some money, she would like to treat the illness in her right cheek.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 43 years old and married with two small children. She works doing the cleaning in a sushi restaurant and, with her husband, has a small business making plastic shoes. She helps her husband sell the shoes. She is asking for the loan to buy inputs to make shoes. She says that they want to increase sales in order to save for her son's education. They have been producing shoes for more than 20 years.

loans.use: To buy equipment to manufacture shoes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been a member of NWTF since 2002. She is now requesting a PHP 9700 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Teresita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Glinda

texts.en:
Glinda is 38 years old and married with two children who are attending school. Glinda works very hard to provide for her children's needs. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional items such as detergent, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, and soft drinks to sell.

Glinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as detergent, shampoo, canned goods, cooking oil, and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Glinda

texts.en:
Glinda is 36 years old and married with two children in school. Her family survived super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November but her business and family home were destroyed.

Glinda is taking out a housing loan for 10,000 PHP to build a house for her family. With this money, she will purchase building materials and pay for labor costs. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and labor to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Ma. Lilia

texts.en:
Ma. Lilia is 45 years old and has three children. Ma. Lilia is married and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lilia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ma. Lilia is taking out a housing loan amounting to 8,700 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ma. Lilia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Ma. Lilia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Belgica Alexandra

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Bélgica, una señora de 38 años, separada, tiene dos hijitas, una estudia aun el colegio y al mayor le ayuda por el momento ayuda a su madre pero tiene planificado seguir los estudios universitarios.
Bélgica a pesar de no tener un esposo a lado ella ha salido adelante sola, ha trabajado mucho por darles la educación a sus hijas, trabaja todos los días vendiendo ropa, recorre por su sector y también visita recintos donde ya tiene clientela fija. Además de este ingreso, en un terreno de su papá tiene sembrado maíz y maní para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar.
Bélgica es una clienta nueva en la institución, acudió a ella por la oportunidad que brindan al ayudar al microempresario a través de créditos. Se siente feliz ya que con el crédito recibido ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos ya que su hija va a la universidad y necesita para poderle dar la educación; con el dinero va a comprar más mercadería: pantalones, blusas, carteras, zapatos para así seguir recorriendo e incrementando su negocio.
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city in the coastal region known in the country for being a very productive and commercial area. Just at this point, there is a lot of commercial trade to be the land port connecting the mountains and the coast. 

Here lives Bélgica, a 38-year-old woman, separated, who has two daughters. One is still studying in school and at most, she helps her mother for the moment, but she has plans to continue her university studies.

Bélgica, in spite of not having a husband at her side, has gotten ahead by herself. She has worked very hard to give her daughters an education. 

She works every day selling clothes, walking through her sector and also visiting places where she already has regular customers. In addition to this income, she has corn and peanuts planted on a piece of her father's land to help her with household expenses.

Bélgica is a new client to the institution, which went to her for the opportunity they give in helping microentrepreneurs through loans. She feels happy, as with the loan she's received, she will be able to improve her income so her daughter can go to university and needs it to be able to give her an education. 

With the money, she will buy more merchandise: pants, blouses, handbags, shoes, thus continuing to travel and increasing her business. She thanks all who are Fundación Alternativa, and Kiva especially, because credit delivery help many people to thrive in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a 9,500 Philippines Peso (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Marivic will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 34 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Melona works very hard to provide for them.

Melona's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Melona has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Melona has taken a 9,800 Philippines Pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Melona is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 36 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Odette works very hard to provide for them.

Odette's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Odette has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Odette has taken a 7,100 Philippines Peso (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Odette is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nelia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 33 years old and married. Aireen works very hard to provide for them.

Aireen's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Aireen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Aireen has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Aireen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is from the Pshatavan region of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. Hermine works as a teacher at the village local school. Her husband is employed in the private sector as a driver, and her son is engaged in farming. All the family works hard struggling for everyday living. 

With the help of her son, Hermine is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock of pigs and calves, and in the cultivation of tomatoes, potatoes and onions. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hermine needs a loan of 3,000 USD in order to purchase a grape orchard. The loan is very important for Hermine to make a deposit for the orchard, as she has an agreement with the seller to pay the rest of the money in autumn. 

Hermine and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for a grape orchard

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is an experienced farmer from Shenik village in the Armavir region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and two children. Roza works at a local kindergarten and her husband is a teacher at a local school.  

Roza has been in the agribusiness for more than 10 years. With the help of her family members, Roza breeds cows and sheep and sells the offspring in the local market. This is the main source of the family’s income. Roza’s agribusiness currently needs an investment for it to function sustainably and be productive. A loan of $3,000 will support this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to buy forage to feed her livestock during the coming season. 

Roza and her family members rely on the good will of the lenders and greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to buy forage to feed her livestock during the coming season.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Last November her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been a member of NWTF since 2012 and is now requesting a 9,000 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and labor to build a house for her family.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and labor to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as cereal, coffee, chocolate drinks, milk, and shampoo. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a married woman who has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and five of her children are currently in school.

Maria Theresa's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost in the storm. Maria Theresa is taking out a PHP 9,300 housing loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2012, in her pursuit of a rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more, in a new home. In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, to replace her house that was destroyed by the typhoon

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 29 years old and has two children. Virginia is married and has two children who are in school.

Virginia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Virginia is taking out a housing loan amounting to 4,900 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Virginia has been a NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Virginia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is an agronomist from Armavir, Armenia. She is a divorced woman and lives alone. Her daughter and son are married and live with their own families.

Larisa runs a small, rented store, where she trades in different fabrics and home appliances. Because autumn is very close, Larisa needs to prepare her business for winter. For that reason she needs a loan of USD 3,000. She will use it to purchase a new stock of goods to sell (fabrics, curtains, bed linens). The loan will help her sustain her business. Larisa highly relies on the goodwill of the lenders, and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount for her loan.

Larisa has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back, because the family faced difficulties. However, thanks to their recent hard work, Larisa is now able to run her business in a way that ensures that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. She has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new a stock of goods to sell (fabrics, curtains, bed linens).

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 40 years old and married with four children.

Maridel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, seasonings, cereals, coffee, and other items to sell.

Maridel has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Maridel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like noodles, soy sauce, canned goods, seasonings, cereals, coffee, and other items to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and has one child. Amalia is married and her child is in school.

Amalia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Amalia has been raising livestock for two years now.

Amalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 59 years old and married with three children. Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Angelina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Angelina has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Angelina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Patricia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Patricia is borrowing 9,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene tres hijos que mantener el primero ya trabaja para ayudar en los recursos económicos de su familia y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. (El se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha la que tiene puesta una playera de color verde).
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 38 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

El es un buen ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de hombres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a el y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias, una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 46, is an enterprising man who is determined to be able to improve.  He does not give in to life’s obstacles.  Instead, he reaches all of his goals and dreams.  He has three children to support.  The first one now works to help with the family’s financial resources.  The two others are excellent students in the community school.  (He is the first one on the left, and he is wearing a green t-shirt.)

He gets his income from producing bananas in the community where he lives.  His parents taught him this business activity 38 years ago.  He sells his product in the market and the areas around his community.  This way he has income to improve his family’s living conditions.

He will use the loan for maintenance of the banana crop.  It is very important to him that his banana plants produce first quality fruit.  This way he does not lose the customers that he has.

He is a good example in his community.  That is why a group of men have decided to undertake the business with him.  This way they will improve their families’ living conditions.  One of his biggest aspirations is to plant more banana plants and to see his children grow in the educational field and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his banana crops.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a farmer from the Sardarapat village of the Armavir region. Susanna works at a local village school as a teacher of physical culture. 

She is engaged in plant cultivation: cucumber, tomato, and eggplant. Susanna realizes the agricultural products at the local market, which is the most important source of her income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Susanna needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizer, cucumber seeds, pesticides, and fuel and to hire workers for land cultivation. 

Susanna relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain and develop her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, cucumber seeds, pesticides, and fuel and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for start-up costs for manufacturing and lab testing of her natural hair care products.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 35 years old and has four children. Beverly is married and her children are in school.

Beverly and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Beverly is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6600 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Beverly has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Beverly can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ana Mie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ana Mie works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ana Mie is borrowing 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, and other items for her tailoring business.

Ana Mie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, zippers, and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, sashes, cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Carmen es de la ciudad de Luque, tiene 16 integrantes, donde cada una de ellas esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo de manera unida.
Braulia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace pedidos. Quiere ir creciendo por medio de su trabajo y es por ello que se esta esforzando por salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen group is from the city of Luque.  It has 16 members, and each one of them is putting forth their best effort in order to get ahead and help their families by working in a unified way.

Braulia is one of the members of this group.  She is a seamstress.  She is a person who is very good at what she does.  That is why she has very good clientele who always place orders with her.  She wants to be growing through her work.  That is why she is putting forth great effort to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and the rest in order to be able to continue working and struggling for her family and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramics, cement, sand, and doors

loans.name: Mujeres De La Bahía  (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mujeres de la Bahía está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios que trabajan diariamente en el comercio, son amigas y compañeras de trabajo que se han unido para formar este hermoso grupo, son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma, que aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es muy especial ya que se encuentra inclinada por su situación geográfica, en lo más alto esta su catedral y desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad,  su gastronomía es variada que cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, hace varios años vive en esta ciudad. 
Diña María es oriunda de la provincia de Riobamba,  desde hace algunos años vino a la ciudad de Azogues en busca de trabajo, se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de ropa en especial ropa típica de la región, está en el negocio desde hace 11 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo ya que cuenta con un local propio. Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa. Su meta es agrandar  más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de la Bahía communal bank is comprised of eight women and two men who work in commerce every day.  They are friends and work colleagues who have united to form this lovely group.  They are kind, gracious, and charismatic people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  

They live in the city of Azogues.  This city is very special because of its geographic situation.  The city is located on a slope. On the highest point is the cathedral, and from there one can see a great part of the city.  Its cuisine is varied, and it captivates the palate of those who visit.

María, age 44, is one of the members of this group.  She is single, and she does not have children.  She has lived in this city for several years.  María is from the Riobamba province.  Some years ago she came to the city of Azogues looking for work.  She sells all types of clothes, especially clothing that is typical to the region.  She has been in the business for 11 years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule because she has her own place.  She will use the new loan to buy clothes.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Orlander

texts.en:
After years of working independently, subcontracting as a marketer for companies that repaired homes with storm and water damage, Orlander took a big leap and has big plans for a future in the fashion retail industry. Since February 2012, he has been the owner of Elegant Jewels Plus Fashion in Dallas, Texas. 

“My short-term goal is to become an LLC (Limited Liability Corporation) and open a new location next year,” Orlander said. “My long-term goal is to become a large franchise.”

His retail store offers both casual and dressy clothing, as well as accessories for both men and women. 

Having run marketing and project management departments, Orlander says he has experience in growing businesses, but is ready to build his brand and gain more exposure. He explains that his pricing is reasonable and that he picks clothes for the people in his neighborhood.

His store currently employs one part-time employee. He has two daughters and two sons who help him shop for store merchandise and also help out with day-to-day store operations. Orlander has built a street team that distributes flyers and is using search engine optimization to get more hits through search engines. 

Orlander came to Accion Texas Inc. seeking funding for advertising, working capital and equipment, such as shelving. 

“I want to build a legacy — something my family can have, well after I am gone,” he said.

loans.use: to pay for advertising, marketing, and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and hoses

loans.name: Richarth

texts.es:
Richarth tiene 22 años, vive en casa propia con su mama, son 2 que están luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
 Richarth emprendió su actividad como vendedor ambulante, luego de muchos años empezó a surtir para su propios productos, y hoy día ya tiene una muy buena clientela que le hace pedidos. Es un joven que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que está esforzándose. Richarth es trabajador y sacrificado, tuvo que pasar por varios obstáculos para logar todo lo que actualmente posee.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados, etc., y seguir creciendo en  su negocio.
texts.en:
Richarth is 22 years old. He lives in his own home with his mother, they are two who are fighting in order to grow and get ahead.

Richarth started his business as a traveling salesperson. Later after many years he began to stock his own products, and today he already has very good clientele placing orders. He is a young man who wants to get ahead, which is why he is struggling. Richarth makes sacrifices and is hard working and had to go through many obstacles to get all he currently possesses. 

He needs a loan in order to buy various products to sell, such as clothing, shoes, etc., in order to continue expanding his business.
