loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, etc., for his business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, aged 49 years, is married and has eight children. His children are aged 30, 28, 25, 23, 21, 19, 18 and 12 years. He is dealing in goats, having started trading in 2004. He started the business to have a clear source of income. In addition to the goat-trading business, Eric is a primary teacher. As a teacher, he earns a monthly salary to supplement his income, which he uses to meet his family's needs. He does the goat-trading business in his rural area of central Rushozi, in Kyangyenyi Sheema District. His customers are goat traders.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 (one million, two hundred thousand shillings) to buy more goats for trading. He is a very hard-working man, working seven hours a day and six days a week. Hard work has helped him greatly to thrive in the market, despite the stiff competition he faces from other businessmen dealing in goats. Despite the competition, he hopes to make more profits after buying more goats for trade using the loan money. He hopes to boost his business and, in the long run, fulfill his dream of educating all his children, for a better future.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras se llama este grupo, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres emprendedoras, que están luchando por sus familias, está en su ciclo número 29 del programa de comité, es un grupo antiguo muy unido. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pablina, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida que pudo montar poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su familia, es una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada, entregada a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para surtir su despensa, como bebidas, frutas, verduras y demás, de manera a seguir proveyendo a su clientela de productos frescos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres emprendedoras" because they are, as the name states, enterprising women who are fighting for their families. The group is in its 29th committee cycle program. It is a well-established, united group. They are in the program to eliminate poverty and each one puts forth best efforts.

One of the members is Pablina who has a well-stocked convenience store that she was able to open little by little thanks to her effort and support form her family. she is a hard-working and self-sacrificing woman, dedicated to her family. She asks for this loan in order to be able to buy items to stock her store, such as beverages, fruit, vegetables and other items. In this way she can continue providing fresh products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, fruit, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Sebastián es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está casado, vive con su esposa y comenta que se dedica al negocio de la venta de muebles ya hace más de 3 años.
Comenta que empezó este negocio junto con su señora, y con el tiempo fue formando clientes gracias a la buena atención, buenos precios y facilidad de pago que le ofrecía a los mismos.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de muebles variados, con lo que podrá seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes y cubrir los pedidos que día a día tiene. Agradece por el apoyo que recibe y promete cumplir con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sebastián is from Ybycuí city, is married, and lives with his wife. He has been selling furniture for more than 3 years. He began the business with his wife and over time has been gaining clientele thanks to the good customer service, good prices, and convenient payments that he offers his customers.

He seeks a loan to buy a variety of furniture, with which he will be able to continue supplying his customers and meeting the orders that he has day after day. He is thankful for the loan that he receives and promises to repay responsibly.

loans.use: to buy a variety of furniture to sell.

loans.name: Nohora

texts.es: Nohora de 52 años de edad, es una mujer viuda y madre de 4 hijos en edades adultas; ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos y refrescos, como los jugos naturales y las frituras; este negocio lo inició hace 4 años, cuando por la necesidad de generar ingresos emprendió sus propias acciones para lograrlo, atendiendo  que contaba con una gran aptitud por deleitar el gusto de los consumidores, con la comida que usualmente preparaba en su familia. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y desde los lunes hasta los domingos, con el fin de ganar cada vez mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una carpa y hará adecuaciones a su carro, vehículo en el cual traslada lo que produce, para ser vendido. Con su inversión mejorará la imagen del negocio y la calidad de su servicio, lo cual se constituye en una inversión de éxito.
texts.en: Nohora is 52 years old, a widow, and the mother of four adult children.  She makes and sells food and drink, like natural juices and fried foods.  She started this business four years ago when she saw the need to generate an income on her own.  She has a grand aptitude for meeting her customers’ likes, with the food that she usually makes for her family.  She sells for cash from Monday to Sunday and her goal is to earn more.  She is asking for her first Kiva loan, through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use the money to buy a tent and set up her car, which she uses to transport what she makes to sell.  This will improve her business image and quality of service, which will constitute an excellent investment.

loans.use: to buy a tent and set up her car.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been a member of NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Conchita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Norapat village, of Armavir region. She is a farmer with many years of experience. With the help of her mother-in-law, Narine cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, and peach trees. She also maintains a grape orchard. The gathered harvest, Narine's husband sells in a local open market, thus earning income for their family's living.

The requested loan of USD 2500 is very important for Narine. She will use the loan to purchase wires for the grape orchard and fertilizer, and to hire workers for gathering the harvest. Narine and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and their support.

loans.use: to purchase wires for the grape orchard and fertilizer, and to hire workers for gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is an old client, with a tailoring business that he started in 2006. He is a married man and has nine children, aged 26, 24, 22, 20, 18, 18, 16, 14 and 9. He is a hardworking man, who works eight hours a day and six days a week. He started his business to be able to have a sustainable source of income, to meet his needs and the needs of his family. In addition to his major source of income, he is also a primary teacher. As a teacher he earns a monthly salary, which supplements his monthly income. The tailoring business is done in Rwenkureijo, Sheema District, and his clients are all categories of people.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million shillings). He will use this amount to buy textiles for his tailoring business, so that he can make more profits and educate his children. His major challenge is competition from other businessmen who sell products like his. However, he is determined to outdo his competitors and achieve his targets, through his hard work. He is so grateful for the support from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 mujeres que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida, todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer e ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una.
La Sra. Isadora es una de ellas, quien es empleada y también se dedica a la venta de bebidas, es una mujer muy emprendedora y por sobre todo luchadora, que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y evitar que pasen por necesidades. Pide este préstamo, para que a través de el pueda comprar bebidas varias, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group consists of 20 women who strive for a better quality of life. each is putting forth her best efforts to be able to grow and improve her respective quality of life.

Isadora is one of them, she works and also has a business selling beverages. She is a very enterprising woman and above all hard-working. She wants to give her loved ones everything she couldn't have, and meet their basic needs. She seeks this loan in order to buy various beverages such as beer, wine, soda pop and other items so that she can continue with her sales and thus improving her quality of life. They are all grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, and it will be of much help.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soda pop and other items.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino niño Jesus 3 está en su primer ciclo, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar por crecer.
Una de ellas es la señora Daysi, quien es una señora muy trabajadora, que lucha por su familia y por sus seres queridos, comenta que con su trabajo da a su familia y a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Daysi se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, que siempre compra de ella sus prendas.
Pide este préstamo para que a través de el pueda surtirse y comprar prendas de invierno para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Divino Niño Jesus is in its first cycle, all of them a part of the program to eliminate poverty, that permits them to know the situation of each one and hence work to grow.

One of them is Daysi, who is a very hardworking lady, who fights for her family and loved ones. She says that her works provides her family and loved ones all they need to live a decent life. Daysi sells various garments and says that she has already gotten good customers who always buy clothing from her.

She is asking for this loan so she can stock and buy winter clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Don Alberto tiene 49 años, está casado hace mas de 10 años con la Sra. Amalia, Alberto desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la construcción como ayudante, luego se  casó y empezaron a trabajar juntos, montaron una pequeña despensa donde atiende la señora mientras el señor sigue en la construcción de obras como oficial.
Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos  pudo construir una linda casa con las comodidades necesarias. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas  y otros que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberto is 49 years old. He has been married for more than 10 years to Amalia. When he was very young, he started to work as an assistant in construction. Later, he married and they began to work together. They opened a little store where his wife works while he continues to work in construction as an official.  

Thanks to this work and both of their efforts, they were able to build a pretty house with the necessary comforts.  
He is asking for the loan to buy beverages and other things that a lot of his customers ask for at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy general beverages and other seasonal things.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa poty está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de eliminación pueden conocerse e ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha ido mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y por medio de su trabajo arduo en el copetín que tiene. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
La Sra. Maria  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para  su negocio como ser golosinas, comestibles, bebidas y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa Poty is in its second loan cycle in the committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to advance. They are also part of the program for the elimination of poverty, and through the survey on eliminating poverty they can understand their situations and continue improving. 

One of the members is Señora Maria, who in the last survey demonstrated a level of poverty within level three, that is to say, that she has been improving through her effort and continual work and the application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman. She is improving her situation of poverty, but at the same time she is conscious that this work and effort that she is making must be continual, and through her hard work in her snack bar. She is a very sacrificing and hard-working woman.

Señora Maria is applying for this loan to purchase supplies for her business, such as candies, foodstuffs, beverages, and other items, which will help her to concretize her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy candies, foods, beverages, and other items for her snack bar.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene una veterinaria Móvil y un local, comenta que está trabajando en lo que más le gusta, ya que puede ayudar a los animales que tanto ama.
Comenta que solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos que utiliza en su veterinaria como ser shampoo, acondicionador, vacunas, desinfectante, guantes, antipulgas etc., y así ofrecer buen servicios a sus clientes. Con todo el buen servicio y calidad en la atención de los clientes, le dará un mejor margen de ganancia, que lo ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Albina has a mobile veterinary service and an office. She comments that she is working in what she likes most, since she can help the animals that she loves so much. She comments that she is applying for this loan to purchase products that she uses in her veterinary, such as shampoo, conditioner, vaccines, disinfectants, gloves, anti-flea products, etc., to thus offer good service to her customers. With all the good service and quality in her attention to her customers, this will give her a better profit margin, which will help her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, vaccines, disinfectants, gloves, anti-flea products, etc.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité “Renacer” de Villa Elisa son 17 señoras, poseen diversas actividades comerciales, con las que quieren ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Gracias a la oportunidad que reciben pueden soñar por un futuro mejor. Una de ellas es Carmen, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que lo hace a muy buen precio, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The Renacer de Villa Elisa committee is made up of 17 women doing various commercial activities who want to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Thanks to the opportunity they receive they can dream of a better future. 

One of them is Carmen who works selling milk. She says that she has good sales, selling at a good price, and through this work she supports her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy milk in bulk, since this will permit her to continue her sales, struggling to improve.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Tesapeara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tesapeara; está formando parte del programa de comités, es una gran oportunidad para todas ellas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo en conjunto. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta quien tiene un taller de costura, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que demuestra en su trabajo la buena calidad de ellos, está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo en capacitarse y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar teas e hilos, lo que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo y cumplir con los diversos pedidos de sus clientes, para seguir ganándose la vida honradamente.
texts.en:
The Tesapeara group is part of the committee program. It is a great opportunity for all the members to be able to improve their living conditions through working together.

One of the members is Señora Mirta, who has a sewing workshop. She is a very hard-working woman who demonstrates the good quality of her work. She is putting her best effort into the training and being able to help her family through this work. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabrics and thread, which will allow her to continue with her work and complete the various orders of her customers in order to continue earning a living honorably.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: La Blanca Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Blanca” está en su 1º ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Rurales, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ellas luchan por sus familias y sus hijos.
Marina, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de panificados y también de mbeju, un alimento típico paraguayo. Marina está luchando por dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener, y día a día quiere ir mejorando, por un futuro mejor y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar panificados en cantidad mayor, y también de insumos para su mbeju, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The “La Blanca” communal bank is in their first cycle of the Rural Woman's committees where each member commits themselves to work and help each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey and fighting for their families and children.

Marina one of the members works selling pastries and also mbeju, a traditional Paraguayan food. Marina is striving to provide her family with everything she could not have, and day by day wants to improve to have a better future without hardships. She is requesting this loan to buy pastries in greater quantities and also buy ingredients for her mbeju. This way she can continue to work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy pastries for resale and supplies to make mbeju to sell.

loans.name: Marta Delmy

texts.es: Marta de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 15 y 13 años de edad. Ella es reconocida en su cantón por su carácter luchador ya que apoya a su compañero de vida con la economía del hogar prestando su servicio doméstico. Marta desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que actualmente les pasan la energía por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSIA para invertir en: alambre, interruptores una caja térmica  y el pago de mano de obra necesaria para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is 37 years old and she lives in her own home together with her life partner and her daughters, ages 15 and 13. She is recognized in her canton for her hard-working character, because she supports her life partner with the household finances through her domestic services work. 

Marta wants to install electricity in her home, since it is available. She is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy wires, switches, a thermal box, and to pay the labor costs necessary for the installation.

loans.use: to buy wires, switches, a thermal box, and to pay the labor costs needed to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Las Caseritas Group

texts.es: Milagros de 30 años es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Este es el grupo “Las Caseritas” constituida por 06 socios trabajadores que han demostrado ser personas responsables. Milagros se dedica a la venta de bebidas como agua de meza. Su mayor deseo es surtir sus productos con bebidas enlatadas y dulces como galletas. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de agua de meza y gaseosa. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos. El grupo “Las Caseritas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Milagros es la segunda del lado derecho y viste casaca negro.
texts.en:
This is Las Caseritas Communal Bank, made up of six hardworking members who have shown themselves to be responsible people.

Milagros, 30, is married and has two dependent children.  She earns a living selling beverages such as carbonated water and soda.  Her greatest desire is to stock her products with canned beverages and sweets, such as cookies.

Milagros requested the loan to buy carbonated water and soda.  Thanks to her effort she's able to give her minor children a better education.

Las Caseritas Communal Bank is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.  Milagros is the second one on the right; she's wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy carbonated water and soda

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Unsatisfied with corporate America, Rosita started her own business because she needed a livelihood. Rosita sells cosmetics and provides beauty consultations to women. “My business allows me to help women build confidence. I love encouraging other women to create the life they’ve always dreamed of,” explained Rosita.

Over the last 19 years, Rosita has experienced success with her business. Yet, for Rosita, her biggest success has been her personal growth. “It has shown my children how to follow their dreams,” said Rosita.

Recently, Rosita has experienced health issues that have drained her financially. She needs to purchase a computer to help her with record keeping and marketing. In addition, Rosita will use the computer to further her education. 

Help Rosita increase her sales by updating her technology!

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Barhambulira est trésorière de l’association de crédit Upendo. Agée de 47 ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et ensemble ils ont 4 enfants empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle exerce son activité de vente de savon de lessive depuis 2009 au marché central. Pour raison de croissance, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de savon. Son rêve est de devenir une grande commerçante. Au final, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir abondamment.
texts.en: Our client Barhambulira is the treasurer of the Upendo borrowers' association. She is 47 years old. Her husband is unemployed. They have four children attending school. She has been selling  laundry soap at the central market since 2009. In view of growing her business, she is applying for a new loan to buy four boxes of soap. Her goal is to become a major vendor. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima and prays to God for an abundant blessing.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of soap.

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya has been involved in farming for many years. She lives with her husband in Daval Village in the Ararat region. They are involved in aviculture (keeping hens and three turkeys) as well as in cultivation of tomatoes. The greenhouse where they cultivate tomatoes is damaged and needs to be renovated. The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Lidya and her husband to renovate the greenhouse. Additional money from the loan will be spent on purchasing some fertilizer, and two oxen. 

Lidya hopes for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse, fertilizer, and two oxen.

loans.name: Beneface

texts.en:
Beneface is a 58-year-old married man with ten (10) children and all of them attend school. He does farming and keeps cattle where he works three (3) days and ten (10) hours in a week.

Beneface is also earning an extra income from cattle trading and started his business in 2007. His business is located in a village in Kibanda sub county. The reason why he started this business was because of the experience the he had in this field.

He says that he wants to use the money to boost his cattle trading business. His main clients are the fellow traders. He says that he faces challenges of poor weather, limited market, lack of capital and pests which affect the cattle.

He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man and he appreciates the services offered by Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ralph Ian

texts.en: Ralph Ian wants to finish his studies to support his parents in the future. He recently lives with his family and helps them farm for a living. To pay his tuition for the first semester, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC. He is thankful for the chance to improve their lives through better education.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Joycie

texts.en:
Joycie is single and has seven sibling living with her family. She studied in the university, for she believes that better education will bring a better future for individuals. Her parents are earning money with their business.

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to pay school tuition fees for the semester. In the future, she hopes to become successful and able to support her family.

loans.use: to pay the semester school tuition fee.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: To have a business is what May Joy wants in the future. She lives with her family and is single with five siblings. Her parents were earning money by selling fish in the market and she helped them on weekends. To pay the school tuition fees for the first semester, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC, where she recently joined.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Glenroy

texts.en:
Glenroy has always been obsessed with fashion. As soon as he was old enough, he packed his bags, left Jamaica and headed to the fashion capital of the world: New York City. Glenroy worked hard learning the ins and outs of the fashion world and finally developed his own line – House of D’Marsh. 

His couture line was a huge success. He was invited to show his collection at the White House. “It was a dream come true for me,” said Glenroy. However, like many young entrepreneurs, finding access to capital to build his business has been difficult. Glenroy wants to launch his own body creme. In order to do this, he needs to purchase the materials to produce this new product.

Help this ambitious entrepreneur fulfill his dream!

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to develop a body creme

loans.name: Trevor

texts.en:
“I have a passion for building unique items and making my creations come to life,” Trevor said. 

Trevor is a former salesman with a background in jewelry merchandising. He was making a great living, traveling and selling jewelry pieces to other major stores. The traveling for work and sales grew tiring. In 2012, Trevor and his wife made the move to Texas to embark on their new journey in the custom furniture business. Together they created Industrial Envy, LLC. 

Based out of Austin, Texas, Industrial Envy is a company that specializes in crafting custom handmade furniture for residential and commercial applications. “I am not great at drawing, but I am great with creating unique concepts,” he said. “I enjoy coming up with things that no one has ever done before and making it happen.”

Since starting the company in 2013, Industrial Envy has picked up 100 clients online and another 100 clients offline through networking. They are currently working on crafting custom furniture pieces for a local wine and spirits store. Industrial Envy is giving the store a “rustic, upscale, moonshine-themed” makeover. 

Trevor currently employs three part-time workers. One employee specializes in glass blowing, another is skilled in creative design and the third employee is a carpenter. 

“We have a real passion for working with other creative entrepreneurs,” Trevor said. “There are tons of creative people making things out of their garage just looking to get into the market.”

Trevor has a plan to recruit other artisans to help grow his business. His dream is to turn the furniture retail world upside down. He understands that there are struggling artists trying to break into the custom furniture retail business. He wants to give them the chance to have their creations recognized. 
Business is doing well for the young Austin business. He is seeking working capital from Accion Texas to further grow his business. 

Trevor said he and his wife learned about Accion Texas when they read an article about microlending in Entrepreneur Magazine. They had been researching loan options for months. Trevor saw that Accion was at the top of the list and began looking for a Texas location. He is now using the funds to hire a fourth employee and to buy more inventory and materials for his business

loans.use: to hire an employee and pay for more inventory and materials

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid de 56 años habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad donde se dedica a la actividad comercial, vendiendo ropa, accesorios, calzado etc. Su negocio inició cuando se vinculó a una empresa que ofrece sus productos mediante guías especializadas o catalogos, para generar ingresos y apoyar el gato familiar; con esta actividad logró generar un mercado doméstico que le refirió una nueva clientela que hoy son sus compradores fijos. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y tiene planes de mejorar sus inventarios para hacer crecer su cartera de clientes y con ello el tamaño de su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, accesorios femeninos y perfumería, con lo cual aumentará el potencial de clientes teniendo nuevos inventarios de artículos que rotan facilmente.
texts.en: Astrid is 56 years old and lives in a metropolitan part of the city.  She sells clothing, accessories, shoes, etc. and started the business when she joined with a company that sold her products via specialized guides or catalogs, in order to generate an income to support her family.  She was able to create a domestic market this way and created new customers who now buy from her regularly.  She sells on credit and plans to improve her inventories to grow her customer base.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothing, and woman’s accessories and perfumes.  This will increase her potential for customers because she will have new inventory of high turnover items.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nohelia Margarita

texts.es:
Un libro de inglés, las ganas de aprender y el apoyo de su familia, han sido los ingredientes perfectos para que Nohelia haya logrado aprobar hasta el decimo nivel en los cursos de inglés. Tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, uno tiene cuatro años y otro viene en camino. Estudió la carrera de Administración Turística y Hotelera, razón por la que  decidió estudiar inglés. Ella ha trabajado en pequeños hoteles donde se brinda servicio a extranjeros y por no dominar bien el idioma perdió varios clientes, desde entonces reconoció la importancia de saber un segundo idioma.  
Nohelia solicita el crédito para pagar los cursos de inglés, le hace falta cursar cuatro niveles para obtener su titulo. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que al tener su titulo de inglés, obtendrá mejores ofertas de trabajo. Su objetivo principal es  volver a trabajar en los hoteles y brindar un servicio personalizado y de alta calidad, de manera que pueda obtener mejores ingresos y así poder brindarles a sus hijos salud y educación de calidad para que sean personas de éxito. Al mismo tiempo agradece el apoyo de su esposo, quien ha sido su mano derecha, trabaja en un call center y le ayuda en todo lo que necesite. Uno de sus planes futuros es estudiar una maestría en Marketing Turístico.
texts.en:
An English book, the will to learn, and the support of her family have been the perfect ingredients so that Nohelia could succeed in passing the tenth level of the courses in English. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two children. One is four years old, and the other is on the way. She studied in the program in Tourist Administration and the Hotel Industry, the reason for which she decided to study English. She has worked in small hotels where service is offered to foreigners, and because she didn't have a good command of the language, they lost some customers. Since then, she recognized the importance of knowing a second language.

Nohelia is applying for the loan to pay for the English courses. She has four more levels to complete to obtain her degree. She places her confidence in the financing since when she has her degree in English, she will obtain better job offers. Her principal goal is to return to work in the hotels and offer personal service of high quality, so that she can obtain better income and thus be able to offer her children health and a quality education so that they can be successful people. At the same time, she is grateful for the support of her husband, who has been her right hand. He works in a call center and helps her in everything that she needs. One of her future plans is to study for a master's in tourist marketing.

loans.use: to pay for English courses

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is married with nine adult children. She has been growing and harvesting rice to sell in town for many years. This is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income she was able to sustain their needs. Patricia took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. Patricia is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar is 43 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Edmar manages and operates a general store. Edmar has been engaged in his business for ten years. He successfully repaid his previous business loan.

In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC. He is now taking another loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is an experienced agronomist from Ararat town of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, in-laws and four-year-old child. It has been more than 15 years since she began cultivating tomato, cucumber, eggplant, haricot and growing apricot, apple and pear trees. With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of their income.

Armine’s agribusiness currently needs some investment in order to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 2,500 will greatly help her. This will enable her to pay for two oxen, forage, fertilizer, and seeds. As this is Armine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Armine and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support greatly.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, forage, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Jemvel

texts.en: Jemvel is the only son of the two farmers living in Zamboanga del Sur. He studies automotive mechanics for he wants to help his parents in the near future. He joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a new loan to pay the school tuition fees. In the near future, Jemvel wants to find a career that earns better income to help the entire family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees.

loans.name: Kalimurhima Group

texts.fr: Madame Mawazo, vice-présidente du groupe de crédit Kalimurhima est âgée de 43ans.  Elle est mariée à un charpentier de la place et ensemble ils ont 10 enfants dont seulement 7 étudient. Vendeuse de farine manioc depuis 2002, elle sollicite ce  nouveau prêt pour lui permettre de s’approvisionner en 550kg de farine de manioc. Son objectif est de prospérer dans son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima du  soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: Ms. Mawazo, the vice-president of the loan group “Kalimurhima”, is 43 years old. She is married to a local carpenter, and together they have ten children, of whom only seven are students. A vendor of cassava flour since 2002, she is requesting this new loan to enable her to stock up with 550 kg of cassava flour. Her goal is to prosper in her enterprise. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to stock up with 550 kg of cassava flour

loans.name: Ananta

texts.en:
Ananta is a 30-year-old differently-abled man living with his mother and his two brothers in a village called Gajapatinagar in the Ganjam district of Odisha, India. He owns a bicycle repair shop where he fixes broken bicycles so they are in good condition again. This requires hard work and patience and Ananta is capable enough to do this work. He says, "I like this work because this work gives me shelter and food".

He has requested a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase bicycle repair parts to maintain his quality service. He is very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush is a farmer from Goravan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, in laws, and two children. Haykush's son is a farmer and her daughter is school age. To assist her family members to earn a living, Haykush is engaged in keeping hens and cultivating tomatoes. Haykush also grows apple, apricot, pear and peach trees. All the family works hard to be able to make ends meet. Haykush sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. As life is getting more expensive day-by-day, Haykush wants to expand her agribusiness a little to more effectively meet the family's needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will help her greatly, enabling her to pay for an ox, forage for the livestock, fertilizer and renovation of the barn. Haykush and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the loan amount.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, forage for the livestock, fertilizer and renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven dedicado a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentan. 

Desde hace muchos años ha trabajado en el área de la soldadura y la venta de comidas rápidas, pero hoy en día desea iniciar con un negocio que le permita está pendiente de su familia y que al mismo tiempo de de la oportunidad de sobrevivir.

El desea iniciar con un Spa de Uñas y Salón de Belleza, afirma que le gustan mucho los servicios dirigidos al público femenino, se siente muy seguro de poder sacar este negocio adelante y poder ayudar a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de sillas para el arreglo de uñas, insumos como esmaltes, limas, corta uñas, vitrinas para la exhibición de productos de belleza, pintura para el arreglo del local, publicidad y el pago del primer mes del arriendo del local.

Con este préstamo podrá cumplir un sueño que ha venido contemplando desde hace algún tiempo y que le permitirá salir adelante con gran empeño y dedicación.

Apoya a un emprendedor colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man, dedicated to his family and work.

His tenacity and perseverance have allowed him to get ahead, overcoming various obstacles that have gotten in his way.

For many years he has worked as a welder and selling fast food, but now he wants to start a business that will allow him to care for his family and also provide him the opportunity to survive.

He wants to start a nail and beauty salon.  He says that he likes services aimed at women and feels certain that he will be able to get this business ahead and help his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy chairs, supplies such as nail polish, files, nail clippers, display cases to show his beauty products, advertising, and to pay the first month’s rent on the shop.

This loan will allow him to achieve the dream he has had for a long time, and allow him to get ahead with great effort and dedication.

Help this Colombian entrepreneur with a loan!

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay rent.

loans.name: Tsaghkanush

texts.en:
Tsaghkanush is from Mrgavet village in the Ararat region. She lives with her mother, brother and sister. The family receives a pension as their father was killed at the Karabakh war.

Tsaghkanush's brother works in the private sector, but his salary is not enough to fully cover the increasing needs of the family. To be able to meet those needs, Tsaghkanush, with help from her mother and sister, is also engaged in agribusiness. They cultivate cabbage and tomatoes and sell the agricultural products at the local market. The latter is an important source of their income. Tsaghkanush currently wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 3,000 will support this young hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, onion seeds and some fertilizer. Tsaghkanush and her family rely highly on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support in raising the needed amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, onion seeds and some fertilizer.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from Araqsavan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, in-laws and three sons (ages 5,3 and 1 years old). 

With the help of her family members, Alina has a business cultivating beans, potatoes, cucumbers, beets, peaches, apricots, and apples. Her husband assists her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Alina needs a loan of 3,000 USD to pay for renovation of the barn, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn, fertilizer and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Joan works hard to support her family. She sells firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Joan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yesu Ni Jibu Group

texts.fr: Madame Zawadi est présidente du groupe de crédit Yesu ni jibu à l’âge de 43 ans. Mariée à vendeur des divers articles, elle est mère de 7enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle est vendeuse des chaussures au marché central depuis 2003. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 83 paires de chaussures hommes en vue d’agrandir son entreprise et au fil de temps acheter une parcelle. Elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes.
texts.en: Ms. Zawadi is the president of the loan group “Yesu ni jibu”. She is 43 years old and married to a vendor of various goods. And she is the mother of seven children, all pursuing an education. Ms. Zawadi has been a vendor of shoes at the central market since 2003. She is requesting this loan to purchase 83 pairs of men’s shoes to expand her enterprise and over time to purchase a parcel of land. She thanks Hekima for supporting women.

loans.use: to purchase 83 pairs of men’s shoes

loans.name: Tuvumiliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Konkwa est présidente dans le groupe de crédit Tuvumiliane. Mère de 8 enfants scolarisés, elle est âgée de 48 ans et mariée à un homme d’affaire. Vendeuse de clous depuis 1994, elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de clous. Son objectif est d’agrandir son entreprise et supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur. Elle remercie Hekima pour les activités en faveur des femmes démunies économiquement actives.
texts.en: Our client Konkwa is the chair of the Tuvumiliane borrowers' group. She is the mother of eight children attending school. She is 48 years old and married to an entrepreneur. She has been selling nails since 1994. She is seeking this loan to buy two bags of nails. Her goal is to grow her business and cover the school fees of her children through high school. She is thanking Hekima for its work in support of low-income women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy two bags of nails.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells nipa roofing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell. Fely has been in this business for seven years. She also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Munezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Générose fait partie du groupe  Munezerwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. C'est une veuve de  45 ans . Elle a 2 enfants âgés de 16 à 24 ans dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes  depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Générose is part of the group Munezerwe and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 45-year-old widow and has two children, 15 and 24 years old, of whom one is a student. 

Générose has been doing commerce in bananas for ten years.

She is on her first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Sasmita

texts.en:
Sasmita is a 34-year-old differently-abled unmarried woman living with her parents and two brothers in a village in the Ganjam district of Odisha, India. Sasmita has two brothers. One of her brothers is older and engaged in vegetable cultivation and one is younger and is engaged in a fruit-selling business. Sasmita owns a grocery/general store where she sells rice, flour, edible oil, spices etc. Her parents help her in this business.

Sasmita has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase grocery items such as edible oil, sugar, spices, biscuits, flour, rice etc. in bulk so that she is able to make more profit. She is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as edible oil, sugar, spices, biscuits, flour, and rice in bulk

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Artik town where she lives alone. Her husband is a migrant worker and their only son serves in the army.

Susanna sells clothes in her shop. The assortment of clothing she sells in the store is not that big. It needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to be productive and compatible. Susanna currently needs a loan of USD 2,300 to buy new stock of clothing for the store. She strongly relies on the goodwill and support of lenders.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Familia A Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Familia A” está conformado por tres integrantes que son familiares, dedicados y muy trabajadores. Entre ellos hay mucha comunicación y su intención es continuar de esa manera para sacar adelante su préstamo sin ningún problema. 
Rubén tiene 38 años de edad y está casado desde hace 16 con la señora Silvia, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños. Tienen un negocio muy exitoso que es la elaboración de las mochilas, el cual comenzaron desde hace 15 años. Rubén decidió seguir la misma línea de trabajo de su padre, pues desde pequeño estuvo en contacto continuo con las actividades e incluso de joven trabajó para su papá. Sin embargo, Rubén decidió independizarse pues ya tenía su propia familia y quería trabajar para ella. Explica que tiempo atrás inició con muy poco material y tan sólo contaba con una máquina de coser, pero al paso de los años y con ayuda de los préstamos de VisionFund México su negocio comenzó a crecer. Actualmente, los lugares de venta son los municipios más cercanos, pero una de sus metas es tener una microempresa y ayudar a otras personas a mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Una buena temporada de ventas está a punto de comenzar (inicio de un nuevo periodo escolar) y Rubén quiere aprovechar para hacer una mayor inversión en material y fabricar más mochilas para los niños que van a estrenar.  La materia prima que comprará es tela, cierres y accesorios. 
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Roberto quien también elabora y vende mochilas y Petra quien elabora y vende ayates (herramienta indígena utilizado en las cosechas).
texts.en:
The “Familia” group is made up of three members who are very dedicated and hardworking relatives.  There is much communication between them and their intention is to continue this way to repay their loan without difficulty.

Ruben is 38 years old and has been married to Silvia for 16 years.  Together they formed a family with their three children.  They have a very successful business making backpacks, which they started 15 years ago.  Ruben decided to continue the same line of work as his father, and was in constant contact with the activities and worked for his father as a boy.  However, Ruben decided to go out on his own because he had a family of his own and he wanted to work for them.  He says that he had started out with few supplies and only one sewing machine, but over the years and with the help of loans through VisionFund, Mexico, his business began to grow.  Now he sells in the nearby cities, but one of his goals is to have a small company and help others improve their quality of life.

A good sale season is about to begin (the school year has begun) and Ruben wants to take advantage of it to buy supplies and make more backpacks for the children going to school.  He will buy fabric, zippers, and accessories.

The other members are Roberto, who also makes and sells backpacks, and Petra who makes and sells “ayates” (indigenous tools used in the harvest).

loans.use: to buy supplies.

location.town: La Concepcion de los Baños, Ixtlahuaca

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is an experienced farmer from Tufashen village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two sons (her little son is in the photo). Both Gohar and her husband are extensively engaged in the agricultural business to be able to take care of their needs. For more than 10 years, they have been engaged in breeding cows, sheep, calves and pigs and in the cultivation of wheat and barley. Gohar and her husband sell the agricultural produce in the local market and that is the only source of their income. Gohar's agricultural business currently needs some investment in order for it to function in a sustainable way and to be productive. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge help to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to buy an ox, fertilizer, wheat and barley seeds, and forage for the livestock. Gohar and her husband greatly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, fertilizer, wheat, barley seeds, and forage

loans.name: Luardo

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luardo works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Luardo is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more materials and gear for her fishing/fish vending business.

Luardo has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Diego Milan

texts.es:
El éxito es un trabajo de constancia, de método  y de organización, asegura Diego, un hombre generoso y trabajador que desde hace trece años se dedica a la carpintería. Inicio en el negocio con una máquina pequeña, la cual lo obtuvo al crédito. Gracias al trabajo constante y de buena calidad que realizaba ganó muchos clientes, lo que le generó buenos ingresos y le permitió incrementar el número de máquinas. En la actualidad sigue laborando en lo que le apasiona, tiene 37 años, está casado y tiene tres hijos de 13, 12 y 4 años de edad. Todos sus hijos asisten a clases puesto que desea garantizarles un futuro próspero. 
Diego solicita el crédito para la construcción de servicios higiénicos en su hogar, ya que  sólo cuenta con una  letrina en vez de inodoro, lo que resulta muy riesgoso para él y toda su familia puesto que están expuestos a diferentes enfermedades. Por esta razón deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, anhela brindarle a su familia salud de calidad, de manera que logren tener un excelente desarrollo en la sociedad. Planea seguir trabajando para poder realizarle mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar, quiere que su familia viva en un ambiente seguro y estable.  Una de sus metas es establecer diferentes sucursales de carpintería en diferentes comunidades y así poder seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Success is a work of determination, method and organization, according to Diego.  Diego is a generous and hard-working man who, for the last thirteen years, has made his living in carpentry.  He started the business with a small machine, which he got through a loan.  Thanks to constant and high-quality work, Diego got a lot of customers.  This generated a good income and allowed him to increase the number of machines he had.  Diego is currently still working in his passion.  He is 37-years old, married and has three children, who are 13, 12 and 4-years old respectively.  All of his children go to school, as he wants to guarantee them a prosperous future.  
Diego is requesting the loan to build a bathroom in his home.  Right now he only has a privy instead of a toilet, which is very risky for him and his whole family, as they are exposed to various diseases.  And so Diego is placing his confidence in the loan.  He hopes to provide his family with good health, so they can achieve solid progress in their community.  He plans to keep working toward making improvements to his home's infrastructure.  Diego wants his family to live in a safe and stable environment.  One of his goals is to establish different carpentry branches in different communities, and thereby be able to keep earning money.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Tuendelee Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chikwanine est  présidente au sein du groupe de crédit Tuendelee. Mariée à un homme d’affaire de la place, elle est âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle tient un restaurant de basse classe au marché central depuis 2009. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter  2 sacs de riz, 2 sacs de pomme de terre, 2 sacs de haricot, 2 sacs de farine et 10kg de viande. Son objectif est de construire une maison. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour toutes les actions de crédit en faveur des femmes.
texts.en: This client, Chikwanine, is the president in this loan group “Tuendelee”. Married to a local businessman, she is 40 years old and the mother of six children, all in school. She has had a low-level restaurant at the central market since 2009. She is requesting this loan to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of potatoes, 2 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of flour, and 10 kg of meat. Her goal is to build a house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for all its lending in favor of women.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of potatoes, 2 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of flour, and 10 kg of meat

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 41 years old. She is married, has three children and lives in Lahore with her family. Her son owns a vegetable shop in the nearby market. He is a hardworking and polite person. He is fair in his dealings with the customers. He sells good quality vegetables to his customers at reasonable prices. Due to this, he has created goodwill in his community and his customers are satisfied. He also supports his family. But as their expenses usually exceed their earnings, it is difficult for him to save money. Therefore, his mother has requested a loan to help her son in his business. Through this loan, he will be able to buy more vegetables to sell, thus increasing his sales and eventually getting more earnings. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetable for her son's vegetable shop

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a funeral service business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials and tools for her business.

She has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: Madame Luhinzo presidente du groupe de crédit Tuchukuliane est vendeuse de souliers en plastique au marché central depuis 1997. Agée de 44 ans, elle est mariée  à un agent de l’Etat congolais et ensemble ils ont 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 600 paires de souliers. Les revenus de ce prêt lui permettra de rehabiliter sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur  de son œuvre grandiose en faveur des femmes.
texts.en:
Ms. Luhinzo, the president of the loan group “Tuchukuliane”, has been a vendor of plastic shoes at the central market since 1997. She is 44 years old and married to a representative of the Congolese government. Together they have eight children, all in school.

She is requesting this loan to purchase 600 pairs of shoes. The revenues from this loan will enable her to renovate her house and provide education to her children. So, she thanks Hekima from the bottom of her heart for its magnificent work in favor of women.

loans.use: to purchase 600 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Analisa works very hard to provide for them.

Analisa's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Analisa has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Analisa has taken a PHP 9,100 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Analisa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and married with four children.  

Carmen and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Carmen is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Carmen has been an NWTF borrower since 2008.

With your help, Carmen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Editha's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Editha is taking out a PHP 9,300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Editha has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer de 41 años de edad la cual encontró en el microcrédito la mejor manera de progresar y es que gracias a los créditos que ha tenido en la corporación ha podido crecer con su negocio, comprando neveras y congeladores para vender productos lácteos e incluso ampliar la oferta de venta a sus clientes. 

María es una cliente con un excelente habito de pago y es que sabe que tiene que devolver la confianza que han puesto en ella prestadores que le han permitido crecer en su negocio por tal razón quiere solicitar otro crédito para la compra de surtido en lácteos, abarrotes, productos lácteos, gaseosas, grano y productos de aseo para tener un bien inventario y que su tienda se ve siempre surtida. 

Con el crédito podrá consolidarse cada vez más y seguir con esta tradicional tienda que una vez empezó su padre y se la cedió a ella.
texts.en:
María is a 41-year-old woman who found microfinance to be the best way to progress. It is thanks to the loans that she has had in her partnership that she has been able to grow her business by buying fridges and freezers to sell dairy products, and expand her product offerings to her customers.

María is a client with an excellent payment habit, and that is because she knows she has to return the trust that the lenders have put in her since they have allowed her to grow her business. For this reason she is requesting another loan to buy an assortment of dairy products, groceries, grain, and cleaning products to have a good inventory so her store always has a good variety.

With the loan, she will be able to bolster her store yet again and continue with this traditional store that her father started and passed down to her.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of dairy products, groceries, grain, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Tatiana Paola

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven de 18 años de edad, soltera y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, estudiar y progresar. 

Desde muy joven siempre se intereso en la actividad comercial, inició laborando con un familiar en un almacén, y desde allí decidió iniciar con su propio negocio buscando ser independiente.

Comenzó a vender mercancía como productos para el cuidado personal (cremas, acondicionadores, lociones, perfumes, entre otros, con esta actividad tiene la oportunidad de estar al frente de su hogar y ayudar con los gastos de su hogar. 

Es una mujer  muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita un préstamo, el cual desea invertir en la compra de mercancía y productos al por mayor (cremas, acondicionadores, lociones, etc.) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas. 

Tatiana sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en un almacén, que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tatiana is an 18 year old, single young woman with many desires to get ahead, study, and progress.

She has been interested in being a merchant since she was young.  She started working with a relative at a store and there she decided to start her own business.

She began selling personal care products (creams, conditioners, lotions, perfumes, and other things), which allowed her to help with the household expenses. 

She is a very enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead, so she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and products in quantity (creams, conditioners, lotions, etc.) to take advantage of volume discounts.  This way she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers and increase her sales.

Tatiana dreams of growing her business and turning it into a store that will generate income with which to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been a member of NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 9,200 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Flora will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future Flora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: Ramzana lives in Lahore. She is 54 years old and married with four children. Her son has a vegetable shop. He buys vegetables from the local market and resells it at reasonable profit margins. He has a shop near to his house. He is a responsible person and tries to contribute to his family and fulfill the needs of his family members. He is an honest and hardworking person and is known for selling quality vegetables to his customers. In order to attract more customers, he needs to enhance his business and buy more vegetables to sell. To help her son in the business, Ramzana has requested a loan from BRAC, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for her son's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Norma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Norma has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Norma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Benkelema   1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA   1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLOBALA, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, le mais et l’arachide avec SANATA 3ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 225 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 1 group are married women who on average are 39 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golobala, in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crops are rice, maize and groundnuts featuring Sanata, the third person standing from right to left in the picture. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain three hectares (about 7.4 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects profits of 225,000 CFA francs which will enable her to pay off her loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Rosita is taking out a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rosita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help she will be able to start once more in a new home. Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Felipa Yesenia

texts.es:
Felipa de 40 años de edad, realiza los oficios domésticos,  estudio hasta cuarto grado de nivel académico.  El esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en esta relación han procreado 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están en la escuela y una en la universidad.  

Felipa se encarga de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa  y apoya al esposo en la agricultura,  desde que se acompañó ejercen este trabajo. El lugar en donde desempeñan sus labores les queda cerca,  decido a que en el terreno de la casa les queda donde siembran el maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, para la milpa de verano, ya que la de invierno hubieron perdidas.  Espera cultivar en estas postreras para recuperar los gastos que se tuvieron en la otra cosecha, esto los ayudara mucho ya que van a comprar más insumos para preparar la milpa y esperan que sea mejor el tiempo para sacar los cultivos.

Desea seguir adelante luchando, sacando adelante a los hijos y seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios se lo permita y luego seguir cultivando para ganarse el alimento diario y seguir ayudándole a su esposo para que juntos puedan brindarle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felipa is 40 years old and a housewife.  She has a fourth grade education and her husband is a farmer.  They have three children, two of whom attend school and one in university.

Felipa cares for the home and helps her husband with the farming.  They have been doing this since they were married.  Their farm is nearby and they have more room to plant corn on the land where their home is located.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn seed, compost, pesticides, herbicides, and pay for labor for the summer corn crop, since the winter brought losses.  She hopes to cultivate this set to recover the cost of the other crop.  This loan will be very helpful so they can buy more supplies and they hope for better weather for the crops.

She wants to continue ahead, getting her children ahead, and continuing to work to where God will permit, and then continue farming to earn the daily sustenance, while continuing to help her husband so that together they can provide an education for their children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her only son, who is 16 years old, in Aregnadem village of the Shirak region. She is a widow and works hard to provide appropriate living conditions for her son. 
Anna runs a farm. She is involved in breeding cows, and also grows plum and cherry trees.  She utilizes the gathered harvest locally and earns income from it. 
Now, Anna's farming business needs more funds. She has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a cow and to cover cultivation costs (hire workers to gather the harvest). She hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to cover cultivation costs (hire workers to gather the harvest)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sheep, forage, and fuel

loans.name: Emilio Jose

texts.es:
El éxito nunca llega solo, hay que trabajar arduamente para conseguirlo, manifiesta Emilio, un joven emprendedor que se dedica a la venta de medicina  para enfermedades cotidianas como lo es un dolor de cabeza o un dolor de estomago. Tiene 27 años de edad, está soltero y tiene tres hijos de dos, tres y cinco años de edad, por el momento solo el mayor asiste a clases. Inició a trabajar desde muy joven puesto que su familia no contaba con los recursos económicos para pagarle los estudios universitarios, su primer trabajo fue de ayudante en una tienda de ropa usada, luego en venta de agroquímicos y ahora se dedica a la venta de medicamentos. 
Emilio solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar medicina, pastillas para el dolor de cabeza, tales como panadol y diclofenac; también suero, cremas antiinflamatorias, entre otros. Uno de sus objetivos principales es expandir su negocio, razón por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, su mayor deseo es cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y así poder generar mejores ingresos. Todo esto con la finalidad de proporcionarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, quiere brindarle salud y educación de calidad. Entre sus planes futuros esta seguir trabajando para lograr comprar una casa propia, no descansará hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Success never comes alone, one must work arduously to obtain it, says Emilio, a young entrepreneur. He sells medicine for daily maladies such as headaches or stomach pain. He is 27 years old, single, and has three children who are two, three, and five years old; at the moment only the oldest attends school. He began to work at a very young age. He did not have the economic resources to pay for university studies. His first job was as an attendant in a used clothing store, and later in the sale of agrochemicals; now he sells medications.

Emilio is asking for the loan to increase the production of his capital. He needs to buy medicine: headache pills, such as Panadol and Diclofenac. He also needs serum and anti-inflammatory creams, among others. One of his principle objectives is to expand his business, which is why he places his trust in the financing. His big dream is to fulfill his client’s needs and to, therefore, generate better income.  All this is for the goal of providing better conditions for his children: he wants to give them health and a quality education. Included in his future plans is the goal to keep working to be able to buy his own house, and he will not rest until he achieves this.

loans.use: to buy medicine: headache pills, such as Panadol and Diclofenac, serum, and anti-inflammatory cream, among others.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Saralanj Village in the Shirak region. Her only son has migrated to the Russian Federation with the hope of finding a job and supporting his family financially. Anahit lives with her daughter-in-law and little grandson (in the photo). 

To cover daily living expenses and meet her family's needs, Anahit runs a small farm. She keeps a livestock of cows, calves, and chickens and cultivates barley, potatoes, and carrots. The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Anahit to purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for the livestock and to develop her farm. 

She hopes for lenders' goodwill and relies on their support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for her livestock and to develop her farm.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik is from Aghavnatun village of Armavir region. She lives there with her husband; their children are married and live separately with their families.
Goharik is an experienced farmer. She keeps a cow and four calves, and also cultivates wheat, greens and apricot trees.
Goharik and her husband also keep a grape orchard. They take care of their farm with great pleasure and hope to develop it. The requested loan of 1,500 USD is very important for Goharik to improve the farm. She plans to use it to purchase 100 wires for the grape orchard and forage for feeding livestock.
She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase 100 wires for her grape orchard and forage for feeding her oxen

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a farmer from Dprapark village. She lives there with her husband and daughter, and her son currently serves in the army. 
Tamara runs her farm where she keeps 19 goats and cultivates wheat, haricots (beans), potatoes and cucumbers.
