This is her second loan from Kiva. The first loan was very helpful for Tamara to purchase seven goats and increase her livestock. Now, after successfully paying back the first loan, she asks for another one to increase her livestock by 17 more goats.
She hopes for lenders' support once more.

loans.use: to purchase 17 goats.

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLOBALA, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz le mais et l’arachide avec FATOUMATA 1ère personne assise à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2,5 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 175 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 2 group are married women who on average are 32 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golobala, in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crops are rice, maize and groundnuts featuring Fatoumata, the first person sitting on the left in the picture. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain 2.5 hectares (about 6.2 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects profits of 175,000 CFA francs which will enable her to pay off her loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Benkelema 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLOBALA, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, le mais et l’arachide avec ANTOU 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 3 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with three children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golobala, in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crops are rice, maize and groundnuts featuring Antou, the first person standing on the right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects profits of 150,000 CFA francs which will enable her to pay off her loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is from Masis town, where she lives with her husband and three school-aged children. Nune is an experienced agronomist. With the help of her husband, she is engaged in land cultivation; she cultivates greens and cucumbers. The family sells the produce in the local market, and that is the most important source of their income. 

As the autumn is coming, Nune needs to make some investments in her agricultural business in order for it to develop in a sustainable way and to be more productive. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to hire workers for land cultivation. Nune and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Benkelema 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLOBALA, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide avec ABI 1ère personne assise à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 4 group are married women who on average are 36 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golobala, in the Kolondieba municipality, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crops are rice and groundnuts featuring Abi, the first person sitting on the right in the picture. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in Kolondieba to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects profits of 150,000 CFA francs which will enable her to pay off her loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay plowing costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. She has been providing hairdressing services from her house for ten years. Susanna works hard to meet her clients' needs and provide them with good service.

Susanna has applied for this loan to be able to rent a small space in Vedi town, where she lives, for providing hairdressing services. Susanna also needs to purchase some supplies (chairs and accessories) to increase the quality of service she provides. 

Susanna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renting a salon and to purchase hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Nare

texts.en:
Nare is an English-language teacher living in Vedi town with her father and brother. She works at a local school and also provides individual classes to students from her house. In the small work room in her house, Nare receives students who want to learn English. She is a very nice and hardworking teacher for her students.

The requested loan is highly important for Nare to be able to renovate her work room and to purchase chairs and a table. As the new academic year starts, Nare wants to improve her room and provide better conditions for her students. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the work room and to buy chairs and a table

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Goris town with her husband and two children (a 9-year old son and an 8-year-old daughter). Lusine is a hairdresser with four years of working experience. She rents a small space in one of the beauty salons in Goris town. 

Now, realizing increasing demand for the service she provides, Lusine needs some funds to be able to purchase needed supplies for improving the quality of her service. Lusine needs this loan to be able to purchase a chair, a sink, and a professional hair dryer. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a chair, a sink, and a professional hair dryer

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Gyumri Town with her husband. She is a nurse working at a local military school. She also provides medical services from her house and greatly helps locals in her town. 

The requested loan is very important for Marine and the whole school. She has requested the loan to be able to purchase a medical bed for providing nursing services at the local military school. This is very important for her work and Marine hopes for lenders' support.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a medical bed for providing nursing services at a local military school.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Junto con su hermana La señora Claudia logro montar un restaurante en el sector rural de san pedro, comenzaron con un capital muy bajo pero suficiente para operar donde la humildad y el amor depositado en cada plato son las claves del éxito de este restaurante. 

Claudia tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad y debido a que no encontraba trabajo opto por la idea del restaurante y ahora se encuentra ante una gran expectativa de  la posibilidad que un crédito para completar su restaurante.  

Gracias a la corporación que le dará la mano podrá solicitar un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una nevera que le está haciendo mucha falta pues no puede comprar cantidad de productos pues no tiene donde guardarlo y le sale muy costoso comprar por unidad, comprara cubiertos, platos, vasos, e insumos para elaborar comidas. 

Claudia se compromete a pagar el crédito muy puntual por eso pide una ayuda a los prestadores para que confíen en su proyecto.
texts.en:
Along with her sister, Claudia was able to set up a restaurant in the rural area of San Pedro. They began with a small but sufficient amount of capital to operate a place where the modesty and love served on each plate are keys to the success of this restaurant.

Claudia has a 1-year-old son. As she could not find work, she opted for the idea of a restaurant. Now she finds herself before a great expectation: the possibility of a loan to complete her restaurant.

Thanks to the corporation who will give her a hand, she will be able to ask for a loan. She will use it to invest in a new freezer, which she really needs, as she is unable to buy a large quantity of products; she does not have anywhere to keep them and it is expensive to buy food in small quantities. She will buy silverware, plates, glasses, and ingredients to make food.

Claudia commits herself to paying back the loan in a very punctual fashion. She asks for the lenders’ help by having faith in her project.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, silverware, glasses, dishes, and ingredients to make food; these items are still needed in the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour to make bread

loans.name: Mario Serafin

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Chimbote junto a su familia.
Es una persona que siempre ha luchado y se ha esforzado por alcanzar los objetivos trazados. Desde hace más de 1 año se dedica a brindar servicios de lavado de auto en la Plaza de la zona donde vive y le va muy bien porque los clientes ya lo conocen, saben que brinda un excelente servicio. Es una persona muy amable, responsable, trabajadora y honesta.
Mario quiere comprar un televisor para su domicilio para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y pueda pasar tiempo con su familia. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar lo que necesita para amoblar su casa, así seguirá esforzándose para poder más adelante terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mario is a very hardworking man.  He is 55 years old, single, and lives Chimbote with his family.

He is a person who has always strived and made an effort to reach his goals.  He has been washing cars in the plaza where he lives for more than a year and things are going very well for him because the customers know him and know that he provides excellent service.  He is friendly, responsible, hardworking, and honest.

Mario wants to buy a television for his home so that he can improve his quality of life and spend time with his family.  He is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  He will be able to furnish his home and continue to strive to complete its construction in the future.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Josefa María

texts.es: Josefa es una microempresaria emprendedora, que tiene la edad de 23 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, quienes la han motivado para progresar, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras, siendo sus principales clientelas ciudadanos de los países de Honduras y Costa Rica, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosecha de aguacate y mamón, debido a que estos son los principales productos que se demanda en esta temporada, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado mantener su negocio y sobre  todo brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Josefa is a small, entrepreneurial businesswoman.  She is 23 years old, married, and mother of two children who have motivated her to get ahead.  She sells fruits and vegetables to her main customers in Honduras and Costa Rica.  She is asking for this loan to buy a harvest of avocado and mamon (a tropical fruit) because these are the products in highest demand during this season.  The previous loans have helped her maintain her business and above all provide better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Irsan

texts.en: Irsan lives with his wife and their three children in Bogor, a city located about an hour from Jakarta. Irsan runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and by processing bill payments. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business, and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Nanang

texts.en: Nanang lives with his wife and their daughter in Tasikmalaya, a small city located about an hour from Bandung. Nanang runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and includes a utility bill payment service. Nanang joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association KANKELETIGUI de KARAKO. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de fruits à l’image de NOUTENE qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KARAKO dans la  Sous-Préfecture de DIALAKOROBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : pommes, ananas et banane.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
NOUTENE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KARAKO, excelle dans la vente de fruits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15kg de banane.  Elle s’approvisionne à MARAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses fruits à KARAKO, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de fruits.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group belonging to the Kankeletigui association in Karako. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 48 years old, married with five children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling fruit, like Noutene, the first person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Karako in the Dialakoroba sub-prefecture (which is part of the Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities selling condiments: apples, pineapples and bananas.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their fourth group loan.

Noutene, who is the group's president and is well known in Karako, excels in selling fruit. She will use her loan to buy 15 kilos of bananas. She resupplies in Marako and with local wholesalers, and retails the fruit in Karako, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her fruit-trading activity.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA  est un groupe de l’association KANKELETIGUI de KARAKO. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de DIARATOU qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KARAKO dans la  Sous-Préfecture de DIALAKOROBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
DIARATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KARAKO, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate et une quantité importante condiments alimentaire de différentes sortes (poivre, oignon et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à MARAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group belonging to the Kankeletigui association in Karako. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 34 years old, married with three children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling condiments, like Diaratou, the first person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Karako in the Dialakoroba sub-prefecture (which is part of the Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities trading condiments: pepper, tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Diaratou, who is the group's president and is well known in Karako, excels in selling condiments. She will use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes and a large quantity of various culinary condiments (pepper, onions, and cabbages). She resupplies in Marako and with local wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her condiment-trading activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Adriano is a 30-year-old man with one child aged two years. He deals in transport and is also a chef. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and high fuel prices. However he hopes to have multiple transport businesses. Adriano needs a loan to buy a vehicle for transport.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for transport

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association BADENYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de SALI qui est la première  personne assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire. 
SALI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU   auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group belonging to the Badenya association in Ouelessebougou. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 34 years old, married with three children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling condiments, like Sali, the first person sitting from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Bamananking in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (which is part of the Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities trading condiments: tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their sixth group loan.

Sali, who is the group's president and is well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in selling condiments. She will use her loan to buy ten baskets of tomatoes and a large quantity of various culinary condiments (pepper, onions, and cabbages).

She resupplies with wholesalers in Ouelessebougou, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her condiment-trading activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association DEME de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la deuxième  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 paniers de tomate et une quantité importante condiments alimentaire de différentes sortes (poivre, oignon et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group belonging to the Deme association in N'Tentou. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 40 years old, married with three children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling condiments, like Fatoumata, the second person sitting from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in N'Tentou in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (which is part of the Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities trading condiments: pepper, tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are on their eighth group loan.

Fatoumata, who is the group's president and is well known in N'Tentou, excels in selling condiments. She will use her loan to buy 15 baskets of tomatoes and a large quantity of various culinary condiments (pepper, onions, and cabbages).

She resupplies in Ouelessebougou and with local wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 50,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her condiment-trading activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine to cut tea trees.

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en: Nasur is a 28-year-old man who operates a restaurant and tea room. Furthermore, he earns from a retail shop. He faces a challenge of high rental costs, but he hopes to have a well-established hotel. He needs a loan to buy foods and drinks for the tea room and restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foods and drinks for the tea room and restaurant.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 45 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Arceli works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Arceli has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Arceli would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Saibaba Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group's loan will go to Juli, a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives with her parents and two children in a small village in the state of Odisha, on the eastern coast of India. Juli is pictured and is the lady standing with her raised hand in the image above. 

She owns a stationery shop in the village and would like to expand her shop by buying more items such as paper, envelopes, pens, and pencils. With her portion of her group's 135,000 rupee loan, she can buy these items in bulk at a cheaper price and earn a higher profit. Her father works alongside her, and all of their family income is mostly dependent on the shop. This is Juli's first loan, so she is excited and hopes that with the increased stock, they will be able to save more money. 

Most important, she wants to be able to support her children's education as they grow. As a child, she was only able to study until the second standard, but now she is working hard to send her children to a good school, and hopes they will become engineers. 

The other women in Saibaba SHG are planning to use their loans for their own small shops or agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to purchase paper, envelopes, pens and pencils for her stationery shop

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is 64 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, spices, etc., to sell.

Bienvinida has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Bienvinida would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, spices, etc., to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Erlinda has been farming corn for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Gina is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 42 years old and a widow with six children who are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mercedita is borrowing 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercedita has been pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from rice farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 36 years old, married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Pilar requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase rice barns and feeds for her pigs.

Pilar has been pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pilar would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice barns and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc., for her general store business.

Ruby has been in this business for 10 years. Ruby earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BADENYA du quartier BAMANANKING de la ville de  OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne sept enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de MINATA qui est la première  personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING dans la  Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grain de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
MINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grain de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne à  OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses produits à BAMAKO par sac de 100kg, au comptant et crédit à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group belonging to the Badenya association, which is based in the Bamananking area of Ouelessebougou. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 46 years old, married with seven children.

They conduct various activities such as buying and selling néré beans (African locust tree), like Minata, the first person sitting from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Bamananking in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (which is part of the Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are in high demand for their activities trading néré beans.

To satisfy their customers' growing demand, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second group loan.

Minata, who is the group's president and is well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in selling néré beans. She will use her loan to buy 10 bags of néré beans.

She resupplies in Ouelessebougou and retails her product in 100-kilo bags in Bamako, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in her business activity.

loans.use: buy néré beans

loans.name: Brisas Del Mar # 4 Group

texts.es:
AGRIPINA vive con su compañero sentimental. Padre de 5 hijos. El trabaja en la montaña- es motosierrista y labora de lunes a sábado en la tala de arboles - cortar en tablones -  vigas – y además realizan jornadas de reforestación de bosque.
Los 5 hijos de AGRIPINA asisten con normalidad a la escuela y son felices de tener padres trabajadores- que se esfuerzan por ofrecerles lo mejor en estudio- alimentación y salud.
AGRIPINA se dedica a la compra de concha a sus amigos que día a día realizan la captura de este crustáceo. Luego la comercializa con negociantes de Ibarra y Quito quienes venden el producto a restaurantes y hoteles.
Con el crédito anterior – ella pudo fortalecer su negocio – comprando mas concha y vendiendo un numero mayor de este crustaceo
En un futuro- AGRIPINA  aspira poder llevar el producto a entregarlo en las cadenas de restaurantes de Ibarra y Quito. Obtener mayores ganancias y poder ofrecer empleo a jóvenes de la localidad ya que en la actualidad no existen fuentes de empleo.
Le agrado el trabajo de FODEMI porque es una institución  muy ceria que no solicita muchos documentos para poder obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
AGRIPINA lives with her romantic partner.  He is the father of five children.  He works in the mountains--he is a lumberjack and he works Monday through Saturday felling trees and cutting them into boards and beams, and they also do reforestation work.  

AGRIPINA's five children attend school regularly and they are happy to have hardworking parents who make an effort to offer them the best in education, food, and health.  

AGRIPINA buys shellfish from her friends who catch this crustacean day after day.  She then sells them to businessmen from Ibarra and Quito who sell the product to restaurants and hotels.  

With her previous loan she was able to strengthen her business by buying more shellfish and selling a greater number of these crustaceans.  

In the future AGRIPINA hopes to be able to take her product and deliver it to the restaurant chains in Ibarra and Quito, to achieve greater earnings, and to be able to offer employment to young people in the area, as there are currently no job opportunities.  

She liked FODEMI's work because it is a very serious institution that does not require a lot of documents to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy shellfish from her neighbors, which will allow the people who catch shellfish for a living to have a close-by place to sell the fruit of their daily labor at good prices

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es soltera y no tiene hijos Ella vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tien luz y agua Lourdes se gana la vida como productora de leche  y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera que incremente su produccion aunque su padre le ayuda, Lourdes necesita de su colaboracion para levantar su negocio
texts.en: Lourdes is single and does not have children.  She lives in the community of Chijipina Chico in an adobe house that she owns; the house has electricity and running water.  Lourdes earns her living as a milk producer and she needs a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her production.  Though her father helps her, Lourdes needs this contribution to build her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 23 года, замужем, двое детей дошкольного возраста. Гулжамал в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 2012 году начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 корова, 18 овец, 1 лошадь. Дом, в котором живет Гулжамал со своей семьей, она построила в прошлом году, одну комнату оборудовали под магазин, где продают продукты питания. Выручка от торговой и животноводческой деятельности составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, 10,000 сомов (KGS) направит на увеличение ассортимента товаров в магазине. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и постройку сарая для скота, так как на сегодняшний день Гулжамал содержит его в сараях свекра.
texts.en: Gulzhamal is 23 years old, married, and she has two children who do not attend school yet.  In search of a source of income for her family, Gulzhamal started her own animal-husbandry business in 2012.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns one cow, 18 sheep and one horse.  Last year, she also built the house in which she currently lives with her family, turning one room into a shop where she sells food products. She now makes close to 8,000 som (KGS) from the sale of food products and from her animal-husbandry activity.  In order to further develop her business, Gulzhamal has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of  30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock.  She will use 10,000 som (KGS) of this loan to increase her inventory of food products in her shop.  She plans to use her earnings to further develop her business and also to build a barn for her livestock (she currently uses her father-in-law's barn).

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and increase her inventory of food products in her shop, which will allow her to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Hace 5 meses llego a Colombia este ingenioso Emprendedor procedente de la hermosa ciudad de Madrid España, su profesión es muy particular fabrica juguetes, gimnasios, colchonetas, casas para perros y gatos un ejemplo de su creatividad y calidad de productos la podemos ver en la foto. 

Llego a Colombia debido a la crisis que existe en Madrid y en busca de una mejor vida y poder tener recursos para mantenerse recala en Colombia con este innovador proyecto que es poco visto en el Medellín.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera, tela, y pegantes, para él crédito es de mucha importancia pro el gran motivo que es nuevo en el país y le agradece enormemente a la corporación pro apoyarlo y darle la mano para aventurarse en una aventura totalmente nueva para él.
texts.en:
Five months ago, this clever entrepreneur arrived in Columbia from the beautiful city of Madrid, Spain.  His profession is very specific; he makes toys, gymnasiums, beds, and houses for dogs and cats.  We can see an example of his creativity and the quality of his work in the photo.  

He came to Columbia because of the crisis going on in Madrid and in search of a better life and so he could have the means to support himself in Columbia with this innovative project that you don't see much in Medellín.  

He is requesting a loan to buy wood, fabric, and glue.  This loan is very important to him for his big project, which is new in this country, and he is incredibly thankful to the corporation for supporting him and giving him a hand in branching out into an adventure that is totally new to him.

loans.use: to buy wood, fabric, and glue to make his beautiful works of art for animals

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer divorciada y tiene 3 hijas Ella y su familia viven en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Teresa se gana la vida como artesana, elabora cuadros de instrumentos musicales en miniatura, a la larga el trabajo podria perjudicar su vista y su columna, por eso Teresa pide un credito para comprar tela de awayo (un material parecido a tela pero mas duro) para realizar sus trabajos, pues la demanda ha crecido Teresa es la unica fuente de ingresoe en su hogar pero es una mujer de buena salud que necesita ayuda
texts.en: Teresa is a divorced woman with three children.  She and her family live in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to her family.  Teresa earns her living with craftwork, making miniature designs of musical instruments.  In the long run this work could take a toll on her vision and her back, which is why Teresa is requesting a loan to buy awayu fabric (a material similar to canvas, but stronger) to carry out her work, as demand has increased.  Teresa is the only source of income in her household, but she is a healthy woman who needs help.

loans.use: to buy awayu fabric (a material similar to canvas, but stronger) to carry out her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and rebar and to pay for the labor she needs to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association KOTOGNONTALA de  OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de DEBI qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING  dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivres, tomates, choux et oignons.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. 
DEBI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is a member of the Kotognontala association in Ouelessebougou.  It is made up of women who know one another through family and neighbourhood ties.  The women are all married and are, on average, 36 years old and have three children.  They live in large traditional families in Bamananking in the Kati prefecture of the Koulikoro district (Republic of Mali).  They have been buying and selling various different products such as peppers, tomatoes, cabbages and onions for several years, and are very popular retailers.

In order to satisfy the growing demand of their customers, the group members began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, six years ago.  This will be their eighth group loan.  

Debi (sitting on the far right in the photo) is the president of the Benkadi group, she is well-known in Ouelessebougou, and sells food ingredients.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of various foods (peppers, tomatoes, onions and cabbages), from Bamako and local wholesalers.  She will then retail the produce, for cash or on credit, to both men and women in Ouelessebougou.

Debi hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay her loan and reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association SARAMAYA II  de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de AMINATA qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
AMINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is a member of the Saramaya II association in N'Tentou.  It is made up of women who know one another through family and neighbourhood ties.  The women are all married and are, on average, 37 years old and have three children.  They live in large traditional families in N'Tentou in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro district (Republic of Mali).  They have been buying and selling various different products such as tomatoes, cabbages and onions for several years, and are very popular retailers.

In order to satisfy the growing demand of their customers, the group members began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago.  This will be their fourth group loan.  

Aminata (standing on the far left in the photo) is the president of the Benkadi group, she is well-known in N'Tentou, and sells food ingredients.  She plans to use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes, from Ouelessebougou and local wholesalers.  She will then retail the produce, for cash or on credit, to both men and women in Ouelessebougou.

Aminata hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay her loan and reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée le 16 décembre 2013. Il est constitué par des femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier  et qui vivent de bonnes relations. Elles font principalement du commerce, de l’embouche et la couture comme activités génératrices de revenus.
Oumy debout à droite de la photo et levant la main pour se faire distinguer, est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère d’une fille.
Elle envisage de faire du commerce. Elle a une boutique dans le quartier où elle vive. Avec le prêt elle va acheter un sac de riz, à 13500f pour revendre le kilo à 275f. Elle achète un sac de sucre à 21000f pour vendre le kilo à 600f, un bidon d’huile à 15500f pour vendre le litre à 1000f.
Elle utilise les bénéfices pour renforcer son épargne et aussi réinvestir dans son commerce.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was created on 16th December 2013, and is made up of women who get on with one another very well, and all live in the same neighbourhood.  Most of them work in retail, raising animals or dress-making.

Oumy (standing on the right, with her hand raised, in the photo) is 27 years old.  She is married and has a daughter.  She runs a shop in her neighbourhood, where she plans to sell rice, sugar and oil.  She will buy a sack of rice for 13,500 francs CFA and resell it for 275 francs CFA per kilo, a sack of sugar for 21,000 francs CFA and resell it for 600 francs CFA per kilo, and a drum of oil for 15,500 francs CFA and resell it for 1,000 francs CFA per litre.

Oumy will use her profits to increase her savings and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various food products for resale.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 16 juin 2013. Ce dernier regroupe des femmes commerçantes qui habitent dans le même quartier. Un lien de parenté, de voisinage ou d’amitié les unis.
Aissata debout sur la photo et levant la main pour se montre en tant que vedette, est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire de l’embouche ovine pour l’opération de la Tabaski prochaine. Elle compte aussi vendre du pain.
 Elle va acheter avec le prêt 2 moutons à 40000f l’unité pour revendre après élevage à 70000f chacun.
Les bénéfices serviront à assurer ses besoins personnels et contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group of twenty women are all part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on 16th June 2013.  They are all retailers who live in the same neighbourhood, and are united by family, neighbourhood and friendship connections.

Aissata (standing with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 42 years old, married and has five children (of whom two are boys).  She plans to raise sheep for the next Tabaski festival.  Aissata plans to buy two sheep for 40,000 francs CFA a head, fatten them up and then resell them for 70,000 francs CFA a head.  She will also use her loan to buy bread.

The profits will be used to provide for her personal expenses and help with her family's costs.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es: José de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad. Él es reconocido por su tenacidad para ganarse la vida, ya que se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado central, además se dedica a la agricultura para tener un ingreso extra. José desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, lo que causa que se filtre el agua, y eso está causando que sus pocas pertenencias se deterioren. Por lo anterior José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: duralita, hierro, cemento, pines y pagará mano de obra necesaria para el cambio de techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 52 years old and lives a house that he owns with his partner and two children, who are 16 and 14 years old. José is known for his tenacity in earning a living. He makes a living selling fish at the central market. He also works in farming in order to earn an extra income. José wants to replace the roof of his home as the current one is in bad condition, allowing the rain to leak in. The incoming water is damaging José's family's few belongings. In order to replace the roof, José is applying for a loan from FUSAI, which he will use to buy roofing material, iron bars, cement and fasteners, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy roofing material, iron bards, cement and fasteners, and to pay labourers to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Las Limonarias Group

texts.es:
En una zona cañera se consolidó un grupo solidario al cual los integrantes decidieron ponerle como nombre “Las Limonarias”. Dicho grupo está conformado por 7 personas trabajadoras quienes día a día buscan el bienestar de su familia. Para lograrlo, cada una de ellas inició en su momento una actividad económica productiva. 

Uno de los mejores atributos de la localidad es la fiesta patronal que se lleva a cabo cada 24 de noviembre con motivo del festejo de Cristo Rey, el santo patrono de la localidad. Ese día se cantan las mañanitas a las 6:00 am, a las 10 :00 am se celebra la misa y se llevan a cabo los bautismos de los niños de la comunidad. Por la tarde-noche la celebración continúa con un evento folclórico social,  juegos pirotécnicos,  juegos mecánicos y baile. Son momentos donde todos se divierten sananamente en compañía de su familia y amigos.

Los integrantes del grupo son:

María - Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo
Josefina - Venta De Carne
Juan - Venta De Abarrortes
María de los Ángeles – Venta de Antojitos
Rita - Venta De Pollo
Atanacia - Venta De Antojitos
Humberto - Servicio  De Molino

Doña María es una señora alegre, trabajadora, amable, quien durante 12 años se ha dedicado a vender refrescos, dulces, chicharrones preparados, elotes y esquites en un estanquillo (tienda transportable) que tiene ubicado  en el parque de la comunidad. “Me agrada acudir todos los días por la tarde a mi puesto pues me distraigo y obtengo mis ganancias” son las palabras de doña María, quien inició su actividad pues en casa se sentía sola. Estando en su negocio tiene contacto con muchas personas que llegan al parque a jugar voleibol, a correr, caminar o simplemente a platicar.

El préstamo lo ocupará para surtir su negocio con chicles, paletas, totis, papas, chicharrones, refrescos, jugos, galletas, agua, salsa, queso, mayonesa, etc. 

Las integrantes agradecen a Kiva y a VisionFund México la confianza y oportunidad que representan recibir un préstamo. 

*En la imagen: doña María viste de color rosa.

loans.use: to buy chewing gum, ice-lollies, pork scratchings, soft drinks, juices, biscuits, water, sauces, cheese, mayonnaise and more

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMDEDIO ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Luz Nelly

texts.es:
Luz una madre cabeza de hogar muy trabajadora y preocupada por el futuro de su hija de 14 años, viven solas y puede mantener el hogar gracias a un taller de confección que logro montar y consolidar, el oficio lo aprendió empíricamente y es ayuda por su hija en sus ratos libres. 

Su sueño es seguir progresando y salir adelante, buscando que su hija tenga buenas herramientas para el futuro, que pueda aprender a hablar inglés y tenga buenas bases para el futuro.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recibidora que le hace falta para agilizar sus trabajos, entregarlos de mejor calidad y poder acoger más pedidos y pensar en contratar una persona para que le ayude.
texts.en:
Luz is the head of her household. She is very hard-working and preoccupied with the future of her 14-year-old daughter. Mother and daughter live alone and Luz is able to support the household with the dressmaking workshop that she managed to set up. Luz learned this trade empirically and her daughter helps in her spare time.

Luz' dream is to continue progressing and to get ahead. She wants her daughter to have the tools she will need, to learn to speak English and to have a good education to prepare her for the future.

Luz is applying for this loan in order to buy a coverstitch sewing machine that will allow her to improve the production process and deliver better quality products. She wants to take on more orders and is thinking about taking on somebody to help her with her work.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine that will allow her to improve the production process; to be able to contract a worker; and to have more stock for sewing work.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Jenny has been in this business for 7 years. Jenny earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Susan has been farming vegetables for 7 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es soltera pero ya tiene un hijo, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento y se dedica a la venta de fruta  con su padre en forma ambulante por distintas zonas de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de fruta, puesto que ya se acerca el cambio de temporada Beatriz vive en casa propia Beatriz es el unico soporte de su familia y el desgasge fisico diario que sufre por cargar las cajas pesadas llenas de fruta podrian perjudicarla, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Beatriz is single but has one son. Beatriz lives in a house made of brick and cement in El Alto; she makes a living selling fruits as a street vendor in different areas of the city. She works with her father. Beatriz needs this loan in order to buy fruits as the new season is approaching. Beatriz lives in a house that she owns and is the only one supporting her household. The physical and daily exhaustion of carrying heavy boxes of fruit could be a risk to Beatriz and so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy fruit as the new season is approaching.

loans.name: Annecia

loans.name: Annie Jane

texts.en:
Annie Jane is 26 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Annie Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Annie Jane's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Annie Jane has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Annie Jane has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Annie Jane is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from bamboo weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ayesa

texts.en:
Ayesa is 39 years old and has four children. Ayesa is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Ayesa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ayesa is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9,100 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ayesa has been an NWTF borrower since 2008.

With your help, Ayesa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making/selling dried fish.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like a net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like a net and gasoline.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bebelyn is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Bebelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Bebelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Bebelyn has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Bebelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:

She has restarted her food vending business. She has been a member of NWTF since 2011 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Carlota will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Carlota would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Rovelie has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future Rovelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

Edina has taken a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

Edina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like dozens of egg, sacks of rice, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Maribel has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns an income from her buy and sell of charcoal business.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Nenita

Nenita has borrowed and paid back 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

loans.name: Abbul

texts.en:
Meet Abbul. Abbul is single and he lives with five of his family members in Tangerang, a city located south of Jakarta. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment service for his customers. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income. 

Abbul is an optimistic guy; he works hard everyday managing his small shop and he can see improvements in his shop with support and assistance from Ruma's staff. He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 40 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Mercidita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercidita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mercidita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mercidita has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mercidita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 61 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Fe's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Fe is taking out a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Fe has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.
