loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 42 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Maria Fe is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maria Fe requested a PHP 1,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business.

Maria Fe has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maria Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Circa en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Erick se dedica a vender uno de los jugos mas nutritivos que existe: de quinua. Haciendo mezclas con leche, manzana y otros resulta una bebida deliciosa, por eso Erick necesita un prestamo para comprar quinua y otros insumos para incrementar su produccion de jugo Erick es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero su producto es de gran aceptacion  por eso se recomienda ayudarle
texts.en: Erick is married. He has two children and lives in the community of San Juan de Circa in an adobe house he owns. Erick sells one of the most nutritious juices in existence: quinoa juice. He makes blends with milk, apples and more and the result is a delicious beverage. That is why Erick needs a loan to buy quinoa and other ingredients to increase his juice production. Erick is the only source of income in his home,  but his product is very popular and that why helping him is recommended.

loans.use: to buy quinoa and other ingredients to increase his juice production.

loans.name: Las Limas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Limas” se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad tranquila, casi todos los habitantes se conocen y se dedican a las labores del campo. Algunas personas siembran árboles de nanche cuyo fruto venden o elaboran hielitos (tipo de paletas de hielo) para consumo familiar o para comercializar. 

El clima en la comunidad es fresco, la calle principal es la única que esta pavimentada, el acceso de los autobuses es cada dos horas aunque en  taxi colectivo suele ser un poco más rápido. Para los miembros del grupo, la distancia no es impedimento, lo que verdaderamente les importa es la unión como grupo y seguir trabajando arduamente. 

Doña Valentina ha dedicado 3 años de su vida a la venta de comida los fines de semana y a la venta de tamales entre semana. Su especialidad son los chiles rellenos y también vende refrescos. Comparte que inició su negocio pues se sentía sola, pero todo cambió con la actividad. Valentina también se hace cargo de su nieta de dos años quien llegó a darle alegría al hogar. Con las ganancias obtenidas y el dinero que su hija envía, cubre los gastos de su pequeña mejorando su calidad de vida en lo posible. Valentina necesita un préstamo para comprar refresco, aceite, maíz, chiles, queso, carne, jitomate y más insumos para la preparación de la comida.

Los demás integrantes son:

María - Venta De Artesanía
Ambrosio - Venta De Pan
Manuel - Venta De Refacciones
Jorge - Venta De Hule

 El grupo da las gracias a Kiva y a VisionFund México por brindarles una oportunidad para ampliar su negocio.

*En la imagen: doña Valentina viste blusa azul y falda verde.
texts.en:
The “Las Limas” group is located in a peaceful community. Almost all of the residents know each other and do farm work. Some people plant nanche trees, whose fruit they sell or use to make hielitos (a type of popsicle) for household consumption or to sell. 

The community's climate is cool and its main street is paved. Buses come evert two hours, although a collective taxi tends to be faster. For the members of the group, distance is not an impediment. What really matters to them is group unity and continuing to work hard. 

Valentina has spent 3 years of her life selling meals on weekends and selling tamales during the week. Her specialty is chiles rellenos. She also sells beverages. She shares that she started her business because she felt alone, but everything changed with the activity. Valentina also cares for her two year old granddaughter who brought joy to the household. With the profits she makes and the money her daughter sends, she covers her little one's expenses and improves her quality of life as much as she can. Valentina needs a loan to buy beverages, oil, corn, chiles, cheese, tomatoes and other ingredients to prepare the food.

The other members are: 

María - selling artisanal crafts
Ambrosio - selling bread
Manuel - selling replacement parts
Jorge - selling rubber

The group thanks Kiva and VisionFund México for offering them an opportunity to expand their business.

*In the picture: Valentina is wearing a blue blouse and green skirt.

loans.use: to buy beverages, oil, corn, chiles, cheese, meat, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational material for the children in her daycare.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer que lucha por salir adelante cada día, vendiendo diversidad de fruta partida frente a la entrada de su cantón tres días por semana, además se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: calcetines, calcetas, ropa interior, blusas, faldas, etc. María está feliz con los arreglos que gracias a los créditos recibidos ha logrado hacer a su vivienda, pero le falta colocar techo a su corredor, es por ello que solicita nuevamente a  FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para colocar techo al corredor de su vivienda y así evitar que la lluvia azote hacia el interior de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her partner. María fights to get ahead every day by selling a variety of fruits at the entrance to the local area. She does this work three days per week and also sells items of clothing such as socks, stockings, underwear, blouses, skirts and more. María is happy with the repairs that she has been able to make to her house with the help of loans. However, she still needs to build a roof over her hall and so is applying to FUSAI for another loan. This loan will be used to buy metal sheeting, purlins and fasteners in order to put a roof on her house and prevent rain leaking into her home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, purlins and fasteners in order to put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 52 años de edad, no pudo estudiar sus padres le negaron el estudio ya que no contaban con los recursos necesarios para mandarlo a estudiar a él junto a sus 3 hermanos. Esta acompañado y con su esposa han procreado 4 hijos, de ellos el estudio máximo ha sido hasta 5° grado, ya que él manifiesta no haber podido darles más estudio por a falta de dinero, en lugar del estudio él les enseño a trabajar la agricultura.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, aprendió de su padre junto a sus hermanos por no tener una buena fuente de ingresos, él decidió trabajar la agricultura y laborar como jornal, trabaja todos los días, su jornada comienza a las 6:00 am y termina a las 12 md,  esto es como jornal para ganarse el dinero y llevar el alimento a su familia por la tarde él trabaja en lo propio cultivando maíz,  frijol, cuidándolo y asegurando los granos básicos para su familia.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abonos, herbicidas y fungicidas, para aplicarlos a sus cultivos en las fechas indicadas,  para asegurar una buena producción de granos básicos y que a su familia no les falte nada, en la temporada que no puede cultivar.

Él desea poder producir muchos granos básicos y así asegurar el sustento a su familia como también vender parte de ellos para recuperar un poco de la inversión que ha realizado, desea también poder construir su casa de un material más resistente, ya que la actual es de lámina y desea hacerla de bloque.
texts.en:
Miguel is 52 years old. He did not go to school as his parents did not have enough money to pay for his and his three siblings' education. Miguel is married and has four children. The highest grade that any of his children has reached at school is fifth grade. Miguel says that he did not have the money to pay for his children to finish school. Instead, he has taught them to work in farming.

Miguel has been working in farming since he was a child. Alongside his siblings, he learned the trade from his father. With no source of income, Miguel decided to work in farming and as a labourer. He works as a labourer every day, starting at 6am and finishing at midday. This work allows him to earn a living and take home food for his family. In the afternoon, Miguel works on his own crops, growing corn and beans. He looks after them and ensures that there are basic grains to give to his family.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy manure, weed-killers and fungicides to apply to crops on the necessary dates; this will guarantee a good yield of basic grains so that Miguel's family will not need for anything during the low season.

Miguel wants to continue to grow many basic grains and thus guarantee food for his family. He also wants to sell some of his yield in order to make back a little of his investment. Miguel would, in addition, like to build a house with more resistant building materials. His current home is made of metal sheeting; he would like a house built with bricks.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killers and fungicides to apply to crops on the necessary dates; this will guarantee a good yield of basic grains.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Circa en una casa de adobe junto a su hermano Rita se dedica a la venta de leche y necesita un prestamo para compra de ganado vacuno, de esa manera podra mejorar sus ingresos  Rita es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Rita is single and has no children. She lives with her brother in the community of San Juan de Circa, in a house made of adobe. 

Rita sells milk and needs a loan to buy milk cows and increase her income. Rita is the only one earning money at home, so she needs help.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: La Esquinita Group

texts.es:
“La Esquinita” es el nombre de este grupo de préstamo y se eligió porque las reuniones se llevan a cabo en el club de nutrición que pertenece a uno de los miembros y este se ubica en una esquina.

En la localidad donde se originó la agrupación, es una región cañera y hay un ingenio que forma parte de la lista de los de mayor producción de azúcar en el estado. Además, el ingenio representa una de las principales fuentes de empleo al igual que el campo, en las plantaciones de caña.

Las integrantes del grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras, su principal propósito es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y el de las que son solteras, prepararse para el futuro.

Reyna - Venta De Antojitos
Rosalba – Venta de productos de nutrición
Alma - Venta De Cosméticos Por Catalogo Y Artículos Para Regalo
María de Lourdes -Venta De Abarrotes
María de los Ángeles- Venta De Abarrotes
Catalina - Venta De Ropa  Interior De Dama 
Alicia -Venta De Chicharrones

Desde hace ya 6 años, Rosalba años se inscribió a una empresa de venta de productos de nutrición. Comenta que al principio le costó un poco de trabajo darse a conocer, mas hoy en día el nivel de ventas le ha permitido abrir su club de nutrición (vender en un local). Doña Rosalba es una persona muy alegre, está feliz porque con ayuda del préstamo que VisionFund México le otorgue, comprará más producto para la preparación de las malteadas. Su meta es seguir subiendo de nivel en el esquema de ventas de la empresa, lo que también le permitirá adquirir sus productos a un menor costo y tener más ganancias.

“El tener mi propio club y atender a mis clientes me hace sentir feliz conmigo pues sé que con el producto que vendo puedo ayudar a muchas personas” dijo Rosalba orgullosa.

*En la imagen: Rosalba viste con una blusa de color rosa de tirantes.
texts.en:
“La Esquinita” [The Little Corner] is the name of this credit group. It was chosen because the meetings are help at the nutrition club that belongs to one of the members and it is located on a corner. 

The area where the group originated is in a sugar cane region. There is a sugar factory that is one of the biggest sugar producers in the state. In addition, the sugar factory is one of the main sources of employment along with farming, in the cane plantations. 

The members of the group are hardworking women. Their main goal is to offer the families a better quality of life. For those that are single, it is to prepare for the future. 

Reyna - selling snacks
Rosalba – selling nutritional products
Alma - selling cosmetics by catalog and gift items 
María de Lourdes -selling groceries 
María de los Ángeles-selling groceries 
Catalina - selling women's underwear 
Alicia -selling chicharones 

For 6 years, Rosalba has been registered with a nutritional products business. She says that at the beginning, it took her some work to become known, but today her level of sales has allowed her to open her nutrition club (selling from a locale). Rosalba is a very cheerful person. She is happy because with the help of the loan that VisionFund México gives her, she will buy more product to prepare the shakes. Her goal is to keep climbing the ranks of the business' sales structure. This will also allow her to acquire the products at a lower cost and have more profits. 

“Having my own club and serving my customers makes me happy with myself because I know that the products I sell can help a lot of people.” Rosalba said proudly. 

*In the image: Rosalba is wearing a pink shirt with straps.

loans.use: to buy powder for shakes, as well as aloe, and tea.

loans.name: Fidel Moreno

texts.es: Fidel de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años y un varón de 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón por la tenacidad que demuestra en diferentes ámbitos de su vida, Fidel se dedica a la venta de pan francés de forma ambulante y gracias a esta actividad se gana la vida desde hace 3 años. Él desea comprar una puerta y pagar mano de obra para que la instalen en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: una puerta de hierro y pagar mano de obra necesaria para que sea instalada en su vivienda.
texts.en: Fidel, 31 years old, lives in his own house with his domestic companion and his two children: a 5 year old girl and a 3 year old boy. He is a well known man in his canton because of his tenacity, which he shows in different ways of his life. Fidel works selling French bread as a street vendor, and thanks to this job he has supported himself for 3 years. He wants to buy a door and pay for the hand labor to have it installed in his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI in order to buy an iron door and to pay for the needed hand labor to have it installed in his house.

loans.use: to buy an iron door and to pay for the needed hand labor to have it installed in his house.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 32 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosalina's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her native basket-making business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Rosalina is taking out a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rosalina has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: El señor Renato vive en Cochabamba provincia Carrasco en una casa alquilada anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en la agricultura en el terreno de sus padres, con el tiempo realizo la compra de su lote urbano posteriormente tomo la decisión de buscar un trabajo más estable y fue así que consiguió ingresar a trabajar en una empresa que está cerca del lugar en el que vive, pero por el tamaño del cuarto y por el costo del alquiler tomo la decisión de empezar la construcción de su vivienda con los ahorros que tenía, pero le faltó dinero para continuar con la construcción y es por ello que decidió solicitar un préstamo, que le permitirá vivir más cómodamente, sin necesidad de pagar alquiler, con este crédito su deseo de tener casa propia será una realidad.
texts.en: Renato lives in Cochabamba, province of Carrasco, in a rented house. Before, he worked in agriculture on the land of his parents. Over time, he bought a lot in the city. Subsequently, he made the decision to look for a more stable job. This is how he was able to start working in a company which is close to the place where he lives; but, because of the room size and the rent cost, he decided to start building a house using the savings he had. However, he ran out of money to continue building, and therefore, he decided to request a loan that will allow him to live more comfortably without having to pay for rent. With this loan his dream of having his own house will be a reality.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Cambiar Foto Cinema Group

texts.es:
“Cinema” es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes han decidido crecer y por ello cada una inició en diferente tiempo una actividad económica. Algunas de ellas tienen más experiencia en el comercio pero todas han luchado por mejorar sus ganancias y aportar parte del gasto de la casa. El nombre de grupo tiene su origen debido a las instalaciones de una antiguo cinema que se encuentra en la localidad, donde también se ubica uno de los mejores ingenios de la zona. 

La señora Gregoria es soltera, se hace cargo de su mamá y de su hermana. La familia vive frente a las vías del tren, algunas veces se observa cómo pasan los migrantes que vienen desde Centroamérica con el ideal de llegar a los EE.UU. Desde hace ya 30, Gregoria se ha dedicado a vender ropa en su casa y en el tianguis los días viernes  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. La cantidad de ropa que tiene en su casa es sorprendente, con las ganancias obtenidas invierte nuevamente en más prendas y sustenta los gastos del hogar.

Doña Gregoria ha solicitado nuevamente un préstamo el cual invertirá en ropa para dama, caballero, niña(o): pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, short, playeras, vestidos, batas, camisetas y ropa de frio.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Zulma – Venta De Perfumes
Joaquina - Venta De Ropa
Teresa -Venta De Ropa Por Catalogo
Gregoria – Venta de Ropa
Olivia -Venta De Comida Y Verdura
Martha -Venta De Cosmeticos Por Catalogo
Cristian - Venta De Zapatos
Yolanda - Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo

*En la imagen: doña Gregoria viste de blusa verde a rayas y se ubica detrás de la pequeña.
texts.en:
“Cinema” is the name of this group, made up of eight very hardworking ladies who have decided to grow and each one started businesses at different times.  Some of them have more experience as merchants, but all of them have strived to improve their income to pay the household expenses.  The name of the group comes from the fact that there is an old cinema in the area, along with one of the best plants in the area.

Gregoria is single and cares for her mother and sister.  The family lives across from railroad tracks and sometimes they can see the trains pass with immigrants coming from Central America on their way to the United States.  Gregoria has been selling clothing out of her home and in the open air market on Fridays from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm since she was 30.  The quantity of clothing that she has in her home is surprising.  She reinvests her profits and also pays the household expenses.

Gregoria is asking for a loan to buy men’s, ladies’, and children’s clothing: pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, dresses, robes, shirts, and cold weather clothing.

The other members are:

Zulma – Perfume sales
Joaquina – Clothing sales
Teresa – Catalog sales
Gregoria – Clothing sales
Olivia – Food and vegetable sales
Martha – Cosmetic sales via catalog
Cristian – Shoe sales
Yolanda – Shoe sales via catalog

* In the image Gregoria is wearing a Green striped blouse and is standing behind the baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 55 years old and married with two children. Pilar works very hard to provide for them.

Pilar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, noodles, coffee, sugar, canned goods, juice, etc. to sell.

Pilar has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, noodles, coffee, sugar, canned goods, juice, etc. 

Pilar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, noodles, coffee, sugar, canned goods, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Seila

texts.en:
Seila is 49 years old and single with no children. 

She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Seila needs a loan to buy printed material, elei shirts, samoan woven caps, cava bowls, snail shell bracelets and wooden carved picture frames. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy printed material, elei shirts, samoan woven caps, cava bowls, snail shell bracelets and wooden carved picture frames.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 24 years old and single.

Ivy's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ivy has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ivy has taken a PHP 9000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ivy is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ellen Mae

texts.en:
Ellen Mae works hard to support her family. Ellen Mae is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Ellen Mae requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Ellen Mae has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Ellen Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Genevy

texts.en:
Genevy is 38 years old and has eight children. Genevy is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Genevy and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Genevy is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,500 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Genevy has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Genevy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Meet Ade, he is single and he lives with five of his family members in Tangerang, a city located just south of Jakarta. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and offers utility bill payment service for his customers. He began working with Ruma microfinance institution two months ago because he was interested to try out selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business and he looks forward to other business opportunities. As the business runs, he has requested a Kiva loan to increase his working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime credit transactions on the busy weekends

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 34 year old single woman with 2 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years experience with this business. 

Lina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Lina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old married man from Tubas, a village near Nablus city. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. 

For the past five years, Ahmad has been working in making natural honey. The demand for his products is very high due to the good quality. 
 
Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more wood frames to build new beehives. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and also the family income.

loans.use: to buy more wood frames to build new beehives.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 60 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Ermelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Ermelinda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ermelinda has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ermelinda has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ermelinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cabin and adapt it to use for hair extensions.

loans.name: Andri

texts.en:
Andri and his wife live in Bandung, West Java. Andri runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits, and it also provides utility bill payment services. He joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. 

Nowadays, he can process 40 to 79 transactions per day. He has seen improvements in his shop since he got support and assistance from Ruma agents. 

As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunity.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Panda Província de Inhambane tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 1 filha menor de idade responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão mais velho que vive na Matola.
Trabalha numa Ferragem  a mais de 5 anos aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com empréstimo solicitado pretende adquirir mobiliário para sua casa. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende abrir um estabelecimento comercial de venda de material de construção e tem como desafio garantir o ensino da sua filha até ao nível superior
texts.en:
António was born in Panda, a Província of Inhambane. He's 30 years old, lives with his wife has 1 daughter who is underage. He is also responsible for his older brother who lives in Matola.

He has worked at a hardware store for more than 5 years and makes a salary which he puts towards household expenses and construction. With this loan he plans to buy furniture for his house. This is his 2nd loan with Hluvuku.

In future he plans to open a commercial establishment to sell construction materials and his challenge is to guarantee his daughter's education until college.

loans.use: buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is a 19-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells chicken and meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Delsa needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a large pot, a strainer, a new oven, a gas bottle and meat. She plans to use her profits for the betterment of her family's living standards. Delsa became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a large pot, a strainer, a new oven, a gas bottle and meat.

loans.name: Kawsar

texts.en:
Kawsar is a 47-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin called Al Yamoun. She is a mother of two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a construction worker who gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. 

Kawsar and her husband would like to buy all the needed stuff for the family house. Kawsar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Kawsar will be able to provide her family with hot water without using electricity. This will decrease the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Yayi

texts.en:
Yayi lives with his wife and their daughter in Sukabumi, a city located about 60 km south of Jakarta. 

Yayi runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. 

He was already looking for a multi-payment service provider when he met one of Ruma’s agents who came over to his stall. Yayi decided to join Ruma not long after. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. 

This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek for more business opportunities in the future.

 He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. 

She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Akenese needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Akenese has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Kolokika

texts.en:
Kolokika is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Kolokika needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Kolokika became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for his grocery store to resell.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 22-year-old single man living with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until the secondary education, but he could not complete his study because of the hard condition of his family. 

In order to assist his parents in covering the expenses of his family, Haytham decided to work in an ice cream factory in the capital city of Sana'a. Haytham is a very dynamic and clever young man. In time, he accumulated a good amount of money from that work in order to start his own business. Unfortunately, that accumulated money was not enough to go ahead in his business, so his father supported him financially. 

Haytham has been running his own business, which is a small an ice cream factory, for more than four years. He started that business with a small amount of capital. Little by little, his business increased more and more. Haytham found this business is very profitable for him. 

For further expanding in his own business, Haytham applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase sugar, flour, and the other necessary materials for make ice cream and sell it.

Haytham looks forward to providing his business more through purchasing other ice cream equipment and all the necessary materials that he needs to make an ice cream and sell it.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, and the other necessary materials for making ice cream.

loans.name: Limalau

texts.en:
Limalau is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Limalau needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, soft drinks and a new cash tin. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Limalau became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, soft drinks and a new cash tin.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 18 years old and unwed with one child. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. 

Margaret needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan-designed caps. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan-designed caps

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support for her family. She is married and raises livestock in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her farm.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her farm

texts.en:

Sinafoailuga needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses, and help with the expansion of her business. Sinafoailuga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Valeai

texts.en:
Valeai is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Valeai needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, snail shell bracelets, woven fans and earrings. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, snail shell bracelets, woven fans and earrings.

loans.name: Haryanto

texts.en:
Haryanto lives with his wife and their daughter in Indramayu, a small city located in the northeastern part of west Java. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks,  groceries, mobile phone airtime credits, and a utility bill payment service. 

Haryanto began working with Ruma a month ago because he was interested to try selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 75 transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him processing more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting him plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sarapia

texts.en:
Sarapia works hard to support her family. Sarapia is married and has a spice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell.

Sarapia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Sarapia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Shirly works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a charcoal resale business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Shirly has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Shirly would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rizky

texts.en:
Rizky lives with his wife and their daughter in Bogor, a satellite city located about an hour from Jakarta. Rizky runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and a utility bill payment service. 

He joined Ruma because he wants to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 40-79 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. 

This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business, and consequently support him plan in seeking for more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova, her husband, and their 1-year-old son live in Bogor, a satellite city located about an hour from Jakarta. Nova’s husband works as a factory laborer. 

To support their family's living, Nova manages a small shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payments. Nova joined Ruma because she wanted to try out a mobile airtime business. 

She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sinauta became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

Elisapeta needs a loan to buy a bingo machine, bingo playing papers, bingo bottles, chairs, tables and a new white board. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Elisapeta became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.
